Reviews.Title: “Not in the smart part of town, but good value”
Reviews.Author: Unrulymob
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel just next to the station, in backpacker-ville. But not so far away that you can't walk to the main sights if you're up for some walking. Or the buses from right outside the hotel door will take you up to Circular Quay in 10 mins or so. I was lucky with a big corner room for my 4 night stay. Good size room and quiet. Breakfast was good, though they rotate the buffet over two menus. The gym is on the top floor, with good views, but there isn't a lot of equipment and the pool is pretty small (and the water murky). If you want to exercise, run up to the Andrew (Boy) Charlton outdoor 50m pool on the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “room 529”
Reviews.Author: johnandshell2 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Day 1 - Electrical wall sockets hanging out of the wall with exposed wires,insufficient towels in the room for four people and the TV did not work . Day 2 - TV worked after complaint and towels arrived Day 3- Electrical wires still hanging out of wall socket Despite the above - food good

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay thanks to friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 2012Holidays
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 1 night at this hotel and were welcomed the moment we stepped into the hotel, the front reception was friendly, the guys who send your bags to your room were attentive, the lady who gave me a bucket of ice after I arrived was prompt and the staff were happy and attentive. I felt important which is how you want to feel when you are paying and on holidays.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: fenflyer
Reviews.Content: The Mercure is perfectly placed near the Central Railway Station and is near many bus routes. The receptionist Rizzi gave us a walm welcome and checked us in straight away, even though we were early.and was equally pleasant and efficient at check out. The room was spacious and modern with interesting feature photos to brighten up the walls. The bed was extremely comfortable. Both bedroom and bathroom were scrupulously clean and although the bathroom has seen better days, the toiletries were of a good quality and the shower hot and powerful. Although we faced a busy road we were not troubled by outside noise and had a very good night's sleep. Perfect hotel for a post or pre flight stop over as the hotel can arrange a minin bus too or from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but could improve in some areas.”
Reviews.Author: emmak808
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mercure for 4 nights in April as part of a 3 week trip to Australia. The hotel is in a good location beside Central station. The room was clean, spacious and modern although the bathroom let it down. It required updating and is the main reason for the 3 stars instead of 4. Wifi is also at a charge which isnt really acceptable for a large city centre hotel. We used the free 555 bus from outside Central to get down to Circular quay as it's about a 45 minute walk although you can take the train. If i was visiting Sydney again I would probably consider a hotel further into the city however the benefit of the Mercure is the quick transfer time to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The best by far!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyChrista
Reviews.Content: I stayed three fantastic nights at this recently renovated hotel in Kings Cross/Potts Point. I found it on the internet on a site called 'whotif' that was recommended to me. I was able to secure an internet deal for three nights for the price of two which then worked out to 93 Aus. dollars per night for the standard room. It was great! The room was immaculate, the bed was comfortable, it was peaceful and quiet and the staff were wonderful. I felt safe and secure right down in the cross or as I like to call it "party central." The area is well policed, the atmosphere is fun. I'm not a party person by any stretch of the imagination, but you couldn't help liking the atmosphere of this place at night. It comes alive! There are places open 24/7 whether you want a good cup of latte or a pie to eat at 3 a.m. (I recommend the pie shop across the road.) You have to go to the second floor of the hotel to get to reception, but I like the added security of needing a room key to get any further up in the elevator. The underground parking was a bit of a pill, it never wanted to let us out, but a minor problem at best. The breakfast in the morning on the second floor was delicious. Buses run right outside the door and the train station is adjacent. Despite all this, there was absolutely no noise with the double pane windows. I would have been very happy indeed to stay another week just in this place for the experience! Well done Mercure!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well situated for our needs which had to be close to the train station. Within walking distance to city heart, buses etc. Thought breakfast was a bit expensive so ate breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “central in every way”
Reviews.Author: straddiedog
Reviews.Content: caught train to sydney, walked out of station[at 930pm] with 2 kids[8 and 15] and quickly found the hotel[in a lively, but a little rough part of town] the room was pretty small and was advertised as 2 doubles, but beds seemed more like king singlescaugh this the only complaint though breakfasts were tasty and great value-prepaid 18 dollars a meal for all 3 of us[kids less than 16 free] indoor , near roof top pool, also a success best of all was location-proximity to public transport of all types-train[and ferries], light rail[and monorail], buses if in sydney with family on sunday, take advantage of amazing family fun pass-$2.50 per person for unlimited train, ferry, bus and light rail [not monorail, but not a great loss anyway as advertising obscures views from many carriages]

Reviews.Title: “Great food”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mercure Sydney is always a great place to stay and central to everything. The rooms are comfortable and the staff are always nice. The food there has to be our favourite part especially the buffet breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: W4Peter
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from the Mercure now. We paid extra for a city view. I suggest you do the same - I'm from Sydney and it's very different from up here. I liked: Check-in : Courteous, quick, efficient Location: Central Station, Broadway, Chinatown and Pitt St are all nearby. Newtown is a brisk walk away. Tidy, clean room. On the twelfth floor, no serious traffic noise. I didn't like: The bathroom is somewhat antiquated, but not dirty or anything like that. There don't seem to be any smoking rooms, which would be aggravating if you smoke. Internet access is diabolically expensive. The air conditioning is quite loud, not necessarily a bad thing. It can be quite soporific. The price was a little steep, but it's Easter Saturday and you may fare better. I can thoroughly recommend the Mercure.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DinFrance
Reviews.Content: Have been to Sydney a few times. This is probably the best hotel have stayed in based on a mixture of price, room, location and service. I would come here again. Top point for myself was the location near the station. A great train service meant easy to get out of town - plus I even lazily caught the train/underground up to Town Hall a couple of times (even though just one stop up). Anything to avoid the continual waiting at road crossings! (You cannot hear the station at all). A 14th floor room facing the city was an added bonus. I checked in early (around 06h30) due to my flight and this was not even mentioned. I liked that. After 24hrs of travelling I was looking forward to a nice shower. So full marks there. As ever internet connection and charges remain somewhat behind-the-times. Internet, in this day and age, should be free in places like this - plus the connection speed should be faster. Alas, this seems to be the norm in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: NisieA Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay, shame it was for only 1 night. Our room was quite large and had views towards the city, Like to have same or similar room for our next visit. The only down side was that there was no variety in the coffee pods. Regards Barry & Denise

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend Mecure Sydney to all Travellers”
Reviews.Author: yeochinwei
Reviews.Content: Had a 10 nights stay at Sydney last year during July'11. Top notch location; near CBD, train station, chinatown, walking distance to Darling Harbour and many other attractions. Excellent Service; staffs were extremely well coming and service oriented. I was able to check in at 0800 even though check in timing was supposed to be 1400. Hotel concierge also helped tremendously in advising on fantastic restaurants, attractions and local hangouts. Great furnishing; standard of furnishings were well maintained, do request for higher floors. Decent charges; paid a total of $1.5k for 10 days in Mercure. The main thing about Mercure is definitely their location and service from the front desk to concierge to room service. Will definitely be lodging at Mercure on my next Sydney visit. Travelled as a couple. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Haven”
Reviews.Author: Amanabbs1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last December. After a terrible experience with an airline, the manager was amazing. He kept in touch while we were en route at Perth Airport even rang me when we landed at Sydney. On our arrival he had already checked us in through 'priority' so we were able to go straight to our room. When we got to the room we were amazed to have been up-graded to a 'Privilege' room. The facilities were great, chocolates on the pillow, dressing gowns and slippers wrapped in satin ribbons and a cappuccino maker! I was in heaven! The pool was fantastic with spectacular views over Sydney, we also used the gym and sauna, perfect! We didn't eat at the hotel as there are so many places close by to chose from. The consierge were most helpful, they could have been tour guides with tips of where to visit and in what order etc. I would highly recommend staying here and will, without a doubt, stay there if I am ever fortunate enough to visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney Central”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in China town close to the universities and right beside central station which makes travel by public transit very easy within the city and to suburbs of Sydney. The food in the area was excellent with many different ethnic restaurants to chose from. The hotel front desk staff were very friendly and accomodating. The concierge service was hit or miss depening who was on staff. The rooms, lobby and restaurant were clean and had everything you would expect. The internet fees were $5/half hour or $10/hour. They also have a 24 hour option. The tv bill viewing option was not always correct, but when questioned at the front desk corrections were made as needed....so check your bill when you check out. We were there for 9 nights so when the charges add up you need to be diligent when reviewing your bill. We had some issue with the TV not working properly, this was promptly attended to. We also had to request our luggage to brought to our room after we were told it would be waiting for us. Minor things overall.

Reviews.Title: “Three star at best”
Reviews.Author: NeedGoodCoffee
Reviews.Content: Close to Central Station - so suited us going to the Australia Technology Centre in Redfern - was walking distance. Reception was nice - polite staff and easy check in. Room was small but adequate - but then the problems started: 1. Dirty flannel in the bathroom 2. Shower curtain (my pet hate) - with no fan to equalise the pressure. This meant constant battle with the curtain while trying to wash myself in a shower that was not adjustable. 3. Sheets too small (this one seems to haunt me wherever I go - why on earth don't they get sheets big enough for the beds?). 4. Internet was A$22 p/day - too expensive with free wi-fi across the road at McDonalds 5. Advertised pillow selection didn't pan out - there were none of the ones we wanted left. Also, the decor was dated and the cupboards were cheap and didn't quite fit together. Not a generous place. Barely adequate for a short business trip. The good thing was that it was sound proof is such a busy location.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: 294226Rob
Reviews.Content: It was a disappointing stay at the Mercure in Sydney. They charge $22 per day for the internet and it takes two minutes to load a page which is very frustrating when trying to get work done. The rooms are dark and dull and in need of a refurb and better lighting. Housekeeping one day left my door open, I called down to complain and was assured that someone would come up and read the lockset to establish who had left the door open (fortunately my laptop and ipad were still there) - however no one turned up. Room Service was average and the trays were left on the corridor till midday the following day which gives you a good indication of the management. I inadvertently left a usb in the business centre which they had automatically sent to the wrong room, since I was in a rush in the morning to leave I said I would come back later, when I returned to enquire they told me that a usb was never found! The cleanliness was not up to much and the back of the bathroom door was filthy! (probably still is!) Overall very disappointing and would never go back The room cleanliness was

Reviews.Title: “Sydney excursion”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mecure Sydney is very well located near Central Railway Station, so is easy for travellers who do not wish to drive in the city. It is also easy walking distance to Cina Town and the main shoping area of the city, and entertainment areas too.

Reviews.Title: “No wireless in rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For business travel, I believe you need 3 essentials. A reasonable room rate that includes breakfast, wireless Internet in the room and a clean room. In this hotel the room is clean, but no wireless and breakfast is extra. So when you add these to the cost of the already high base rate, it is an expensive exercise to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our four night stay, the room was clean and comfortable with a good view, the location was ideal being next to Central Station and the Railway Square buses it was easy to get around this great city. Only a short walk to Darling Harbour and all of the great restaurants and attractions, Paddy's Markets just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Improved from my last visit”
Reviews.Author: Canberra-ites
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently and was not at all impressed. I can happily report that everything the Manager had promised would be fixed, had been. The room was nice and the mini-bar was back. I had a few hiccups with housekeeping after leaving my electric toothbrush behind and then it magically disappearing within a 1/2 hour of checkout. The duty manager was however very helpful and all was resolved. Sometimes it takes something to go wrong for you to be able to comment on a hotel. The recovery by the team was great and they couldn't apologise enough. I would stick by my original comments that although this hotel is very close to the train stations it is not the ideal location for tourists. Try for something a bit closer to Darling Harbour if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ebstar
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I recently stayed at the Mercure in Sydney for 2 nights at $180.00 per night. It was definitely in need of a makeover and quite musky inside. The foyer and staff were great and check-in was smooth and easy. We arrived before our room was ready but we were able to leave our luggage with the concierge. The Mercure is located next to central station which is convenient if you want to go anywhere within Sydney but is quite a struggle to walk into the city centre where all the shops and attractions are located. Sydney public transport is over priced and we wasted a lot of money trying to get around on the monorail, taxis etc. The rooms are decent sized but small beds and bad tv. No iPod docks or stereo functions and the bathroom is also quite dated. This is a convenient hotel if you want to be near central station but I would suggest that you spend a little more on a room in the city centre and not waste your cash trying to get around.

Reviews.Title: “not as central as people say”
Reviews.Author: minerva14
Reviews.Content: Not knowing Sydney we needed a hotel that was fairly central and easy to get around the city. Despite what reviews say I'd say that while it's near the central station to get around the area it's not the best place to be based within the city. On our first evening we went out to find somewhere to eat but found little other than McDonald's and KFC. Pubs stopped serving food at 9pm on the dot. While the hotel is ok (although our view from our room looking straight into some less than luxury flats where a man was sitting on the toilet within full view was a bit off putting) clean and efficient, the rooms are a bit old fashioned. Because it's not very near restaurants we ate twice in the hotel restaurant. While the food was very good the service was incredibly slow with an almost empty restaurant. The kitchen serves the restaurant and room service and if room service is busy the restaurant suffers. We waited an hour for our main meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SuzBuz_12 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms & facilities. Can't rate restaurant, as unable to dine there, despite only being 1/3 full! Possibly staffing issues but just a little odd! Breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrianto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a big Group from Indonesia in March 2012 for 4 nights. The location was perfect. Easy access and very good service. Hotel facilities also excellent. Lift to room was very FAST.....Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality!”
Reviews.Author: Mel G
Reviews.Content: Right next to the train and across the road from the George St bus. The local restaurants/cafes are also very reasonable and good quality. I found this a good location for business if your commuting to the CBD each day.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel next to Central Station”
Reviews.Author: john_gpjm
Reviews.Content: Location location location! Arrive at Sydney international airport, take the city rail train to Central station (4 stations away - 15 minutes; trains come frequently; check website) and within minutes by foot from central station, you will see the hotel. There is a nearby pharmacy, food, convenient store, pubs, bus stop). Chinatown; 8-10 minutes walk Darling Harbour; 15 minutes walk Circular Quay; 15 minutes by city rail Check in was smooth and staff very friendly. Very helpful in providing directions. Under Accor group of hotels, so you can add miles or collect Accor points. Storage of luggage available for free (before check in and after checkout). Some hotels charge in Sydney! Room facilities basic: Bed with choice of pillows, clean linen, iron and table, coffee making facilities, shower, bathtub, (special assistance rooms available), TV, Wifi+broadband (chargeable), Safe, slippers (upon request) Did not use much of the facilities as I was here on business. Price can be steep; changes by the day and usually higher on weekends - lookout for promotions and book early. This hotel gives you a comfortable sleep with minimal noise and is very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PMMLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for six nights two weeks ago. Overall we had a good stay. The hotel is in a very good location, right by Central station. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't eat in the restaurant or have breakfast there. We used the pool every day but as it was such a strange shape and very small it was difficult to swim in if there is more than two of you in there. Having said that it was very quiet most of the time we were there - around 9am. I didn't use the gym but it seemed well resourced. One day we got back - my partner's birthday in fact - and found that the room hadn't been made up. After a long day sightseeing and as it was a special day this oversight was disappointing. It also seemed cheeky to charge for using the internet. The hotel is not cheap and I feel it would be more appropriate for this to be a complimentary service. We used the bar attached to the hotel a couple of times - I forget the name. Staff were friendly and they have various deals most nights. I would recommend a cafe for breakfast, 'East Meets West', 15-25 Regent Street behind the hotel. The food was very good and reasonably priced and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recurrent Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel on a regular basis and always find the staff exceptionally helpful. The location close to Central train station for transport and close to Darling Harbour to access great restaurants is extremelly convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disaster this time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Iron missing Basin drain stank Night lock on door broken Phone broken (had to use Mobile) Received a wake-up call at 5am when I didn't request one Good stuff too - nice pillows and bed, A/C good, TV ok, Restaurant V.Good.

Reviews.Title: “Good start, but bad finish”
Reviews.Author: Katherine T
Reviews.Content: Great location near Central Station and Chinatown. Room was comfortable, clean, spacious and had a nice city outlook on the 10th floor. Staff were courteous, friendly and helpful. However my final night of stay was spoilt by the presence of loud youths in the next room partying, fighting, yelling and throwing furniture. A complaint was made but the noise started again in the early hours of the morning and I consequently got no sleep at all. I mentioned this at check-out, left my contact details hoping for some recompense but to date have heard nothing, which is disappointing. If you pay good money for a room (and this hotel is not cheap) and you don't get the expected minimum level of quality, frankly to my mind, you are being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: kwdk4 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A good location but having stayed at the Swanston Grand Mercure in Melbourne I was a little disappointed. The Hotel is quite dated and in need of some renovations especially the bathrooms. Rooms were clean and quiet however.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Madeleineb1
Reviews.Content: Recently my boyfriend and I stayed at the mecure in sydney and found the rooms tastefully decorated with modern furniture the room was beautiful, with windows all along the curve of the wall looking out onto the city. We also got complimentary breakfast which was delightful! The only downside I can think of is that the pool area was not kept up to high standards of cleanliness. But overall beautiful place with great location :)

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe this is 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Fluffytowels
Reviews.Content: This is Sydney's little secret. A budget priced hotel with all the amenities and service of a 5 star hotel. I visited Sydney due to a family tragedy and really appreciated the help of the staff. In particular Adam the concierge and his assistants Rene and Mohammed went far beyond the call of duty in helping me . The dinning room has an excellent range of food and the rooms, while perhaps a little smaller that 5 star were clean and well serviced. Thank you Mercure.

Reviews.Title: “sydney with kids”
Reviews.Author: suzanne l
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights in a room with 2 double beds& a free portacot. we paid for buffet breakfast online when booking and kids were free. They loved the breakfast. Short walk to Central station for train or free tourist bus on Eddy St. Housekeeping a little clumsy. Heated pool not too deep and kept clean. Taxi was about same cost for 5 of us as shuttle or train. overall good although price much higher than when we last visited2years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Fine...”
Reviews.Author: Antonio-ASJR
Reviews.Content: Not bad, not good, not dirty, not clean... Average. Stayed 3 days after a cruise with family. Location is good for shopping and to visit China Town. Few steps from Paddy Market (bargain shops) and from really fine Chinese cuisine (such as East Ocean Palace - must go). There is also a fine Italian restaurant just one block after Sydney University (2 blocks away). Well... at the end of the day, it is a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More like a two star”
Reviews.Author: old_anselmian
Reviews.Content: Superior city view room is narrow but kept clean by hard working house keepers. The drains are a touch smelly. Full breakfast should be avoided at $25 as all you get is undercooked bacon - which I could say the same for the scrambled egg. The staff are helpful but I think it's a bit over priced - as plenty of other places in Sydney. The pool area is a bit scuzzy - al i all it feels like it cold do with a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but good service”
Reviews.Author: Terri-Anne K
Reviews.Content: My stay here was a slightly longer one - check in on a Sunday afternoon and out again the Saturday after. Check-in was quick and friendly, with the staff member giving a thorough and efficient rundown of hotel services and where they are. The room itself was on the small side, but efficiently organised. Personally, I'd like more light: there are two lights on one wall, opposite the bed, and two lamps, which left me feeling like the room was set up for mood lighting - great for romance but a bit uncomfortable for reading or working at times. The room was quiet, looking over the laneway, so little to no traffic noise. The laundry is clean and tidy (and the exhaust fan is strong enough that there's no damp smell in the room). The gym is well-equipped and has a great view, plus is well air-conditioned; the pool is good too. Room service was quick and good quality. My one complaint is the price of internet access, though this is not unique to the Mercure. Sydney hotels almost all charge like wounded bulls for internet access. I compare this to what I've experienced in the US, for example, where high speed broadband is almost always free in hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to get around Sydney”
Reviews.Author: beach_buoy
Reviews.Content: Situated right next to central station it's a good base to stay to get around Sydney. Rooms were above average and the staff were helpful,gave us a room upgrade which was nice. One negative is the pool area which was very small considering the size of the hotel. TIP: taxi rank next to hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lets go to work”
Reviews.Author: Koleenos
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8.15pm for one night, met by friendly staff, room although small was clean and tidy, the only thing I didn't like was the white and yellow tiles in the bathroom. Nice size TV. Two double beds in the room, nice pillow menu to choose from and I had a lovely night sleep. Location in Sydney is great. Ordered room service which was brought up in a very timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: Alana666 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cleana nd tidy but I was very disappointed with the service. I had a family room with a king size bed, sofa and a roll away. When we got to the room the rollaway was not in it. I immediately rang house keeping and they said they would bring it up. We got back to the room in the afternoon to get changed and go to dinner and the rollaway was still not there, again called and they said they would bring it up. Finally got home at 2am and guess what no rollaway, someone from hosue keeping did bring it up this time and then was cranky at me, if they'd bought it up the first 2 times neither of us would of had to be cranky!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ebonybridget
Reviews.Content: The Location of this hotel and price were great! Staff were helpful and rooms very clean.. The bathrooms could really do with an upgrade! however they were very clean and good showers. The only "bad" thing I felt was the room service trays left outside doors for collection.. it looked horrible tip toeing around peoples half eaten food, perhaps they should consider having staff pick them up from the rooms rather than being left outside! Other than this our stay was very pleasant and we will defiantely use this hotel again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Average and overpriced ..”
Reviews.Author: sabreena0303
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a single night in late Jan 12 in an room with two double beds. The room and bathroom were clean, however, the room was probably not really spacious enough for four people. The bed and pillows were not really comfortable but ok for the single nights sleep. The hotel corridor carpets looked very worn and in need of an update and also the indoor pool is in need of a clean and update. Overall, the staff were very friendly and helpful, arranging a pickup taxi for us the next morning to the airport. The location is very convenient and right near central station.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was expecting...”
Reviews.Author: ElmoTJ
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't normally stay in this part of town, but I was meeting a friend. Very close to Central Station, buses going to and from the city, drinking holes and places to eat. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, as were the gentlemen at the concierge desk. The only downer was the breakfast - make sure you tell them if you have pre-paid! To start with there was no food/mini bar in room - but this changed whilst I was there due to "customer demand". I am glad because I thought it was odd and I know if you want something, you want it now! The bar attached also had good specials and happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “11th Year Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I could only wish we had more time to enjoy a longer stay. From the time we checked in until the time we checked out we were treated a special VIP guests. The staff showed perfect customer service skills and were extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: swanniebob Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well located, excellent, helpful concierge and reception staff. We stay at this hotel 10+ times per year and are never disappointed.We are welcomed back, many staff have been there a while and remember you which is nice. Breakfast and the restaurant for dinner are good value and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Didn't receive room booked and paid for. Large stain on carpet. Expresso machine to dirty to use. Room lighting dreadful. Ceilings very low, I could put all of my hand on ceiling in bathroom (I'm 5'7"). Decor Dated. Needs Upgrade. Keycards work occasionally, worst I've used. Staff indifferent to patronising.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure George St”
Reviews.Author: RichardS154954
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for 8 days just recently. The rooms were neat and tidy and quite adequate. Housekeeping did a good job of cleaning them while we were out during the day. However the lighting in the rooms was poor and we had to open the drapes all the way in order to see properly. That was ok during the day but obviously not so at night. Internet is very expensive in the hotel,more so than we are used to in Canada. However there are many Internet cafes within walking distance that you could use at a fraction of the price. The concierge desk was a hit and miss. There was one fellow during the day that seemed quite knowledgeable and helpful (don't remember his name) and we tried to use him whenever we could. The others on the desk were a disappointment. On two separate occasions we asked for recommendations on a Thai and an Italian restaurant close by as we were walking. Upon reaching both locations, and after one long walk, both were closed down and did not exist. We would expect that the concierge desk should know and have an updated list of restaurants in the area. We did not use them again for restaurants. We did however discover an excellent restaurant on our own that you could walk to but it is a significant uphill walk and worth the taxi fare. It was called The Winery and I recommend making reservations and to sit upstairs. Excellent decor, food and service. It would seem that we always got the best service in Sydney from servers who were not born and bred Australian. We experienced that quite often in the cafes and pubs around the hotel and the popular areas in Sydney The front desk was always helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is adequate and is near Central train station which is a bonus when you get tired of walking back from a day of sight seeing. It is a long walk to Darling Harbor and a significant walk to the Sydney Bridge,Opera House,Circular Quay and the Rocks area. However there are many good pubs in between to rest your feet and have a beer or glass of wine. You will meet people from all over the world in these pubs. A small bar in the lobby area which always seemed to be busy or full at the end of the day with business types, so we did not use it . Not too many bars in the immediate area at night to enjoy a beer after long days.Best to find somewhere in the more downtown area on the way back to the hotel. All and all, a decent hotel but preferred a more central downtown location where we stayed a few nights prior to this Mercure

Reviews.Title: “my stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room was comfortable however the toilet kept flushing, some lightbulbs were dead making the room dark and the wrong size sheets had been fitted to the bed, apart from that it was good, rooms were quiet and cean and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shoopy10
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel it has a breakfast restaurant behind it that is really yummy it does not belong to the hotel and in front of the hotel are other restaurants such as MacDonald,KFC,Subway and one of my favourite that was there was a Mexican restaurant called mad mex.I really enjoyed the stay in the hotel room alot it was pretty and stuff but the bathroom colour was a bit not matching it was yellow so I did not like it that much but it is ok.There is no free WiFi which really disappointed me but I was able to live with it and there was a shop in the hotel and a pool.VERY IMPORTANT:Whoever is reading this must know from my personal experience that almost everything closes at 5 pm really early so you should know that because all Australia stores and stuff close at 5 pm well most of them I hope you enjoy and find this very useful Thank you :)

Reviews.Title: “Good solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Central Station, Darling Harbour, Chinatown, etc. Especially great value with Accor Advantage Plus membership, kids breakfast is free so buffet breakfast cost $25 for 3 of us. Two course dinner was $80, although service was a bit up-&-down - garlic bread arrived 1 minute before main course. Check-in & check-out were friendly and hassle-free. Good pool & gym, though they are a bit awkward to access via fire stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good vale for a centrally located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ynotcracker
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Darling Harbour and the associated areas of Sydney, it's clean and much better than its Hobart counter part. The room we had on the 7th floor was a bit small but typical of many big city hotels. staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well located above train station”
Reviews.Author: worddict
Reviews.Content: An oldish, cleanish hotel. Good location above train station and other means of easy transport. Concierge is helpful with bus guides to get around provided. But I really don't like the fact that Internet access isn't free in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Price for family but service should be improved”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Basically the hotel is clean and with good location near central station. The family Room space is very "compact", and very limited space for lugages. The breakfast is good, especially it is free for kids. However, we paid the breakfast but it is always not in the restanrant room list. We wait for confirmation almost every morning, and it make us feel uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: stuart316 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location...easy to get to from the airport on the train. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable. I was on the 3rd floor facing out to a busy street, however the room was well noiseproofed which meant traffic noise was virtually non-existent. Staff very friendly at check in and ensured that points from my stay would be credited to my rewards account which I only established a couple of days before.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Sydney Central.”
Reviews.Author: mi55y66
Reviews.Content: We often stay here for a weekend and find it very convenient. Easy access to Darling Harbour, Chinatown and the Cbd. Grab the deal with the buffet breakfast included for real value for money. Great if you travel in from out of town to Sydney central. Staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ritika512
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel, very functional, comfortable bed and decent sized rooms etc. The location was not bad at all, and had a number of restaurants and cafes nearby. However, as tourists, we later thought that we should have stayed in a hotel overlooking the darling harbour. We needed to walk quite a lot to reach China town and then darling harbour, from where we were to embark on a cruise. There is nothing exceptional that jumps to mind about the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good.Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: gautam9999
Reviews.Content: The amenities and the location of this hotel is definitely value for money. The staff is pretty courteous too. Had a good time staying here.But the lights in the room are pretty dull. When we checked in the room was very nicely done up.The quality of food was good too. Overall it was a nice stay..

Reviews.Title: “Sydney from the point of view of Melbournians”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had travelled by car to Sydney to see the Harry Potter Exhibition at the Powerhouse Museum - which was within walking distance from the Hotel and that was really convenient. We also went to see the Picasso Exhibition at the Art Gallery of NSW which was a 5min (free) bustrip and a lovely walk through Hyde Park and The Domain gardens and that was also convenient. Darling Harbour was a 5 min (free) bus ride and a 5 min walk and Circular Quay was only a 10 min (free) bus ride. We did not need to take our car out throughout our whole stay as the train/bus/monorail were all there at our doorstep. I would recommend the Mecure for any family holiday stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Izzowizzo
Reviews.Content: Huge comfortable beds and located in the central area of Sydney. Its a 15 min-walk from the hotel to Darling Harbour. Over-all it was a pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good standard”
Reviews.Author: Sky30
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occassions. The rooms are of a good size and I have always had a reasonable view from the room. The location is convinient to Central Station and China town is a short walk from the hotel as is Darling Harbour. If you can get a breakfast inclusive package for a good price take it as the breakfast is a great buffet which is a deal maker for me. There is a gym and swimming pool on the top floor which seems to get little use but offers great views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: whywhylove
Reviews.Content: Short walk to Central station, China Town and Darling Harbour. Being on Railway Square, it is very convenient for catching a bus to Coogee, Bronte or Bondi beaches. If catching the train from the airport, you can walk all the way to the hotel via tunnels (rather than go outside and be forced to cross many roads). Simply follow the Devonshire concourse exit signs and keep going to Railway Square via the tunnel. Take the stairs just in front of the Easy Way and you'll find yourself in front of the hotel. Perfect! The heated pool on the top floor was nice (28 degrees) but often crowded. Very popular with children. For the size of the hotel, the gym was quite small and often busy. Being so close to the pool, we often found the floor of the gym was quite wet. In addition, I found the gym to be quite hot. The water cooler was handy though and the views were nice. Good fun to watch people walking down below while exercising. We had a room with 2 double beds. For 2 people, it was VERY spacious. TV reception was very poor, with no digital channels (GO, channel 11 etc) but you don't spend much time watching TV anyway so not a big deal. Bathroom was an adequate size but the shower curtain was not. Keep the curtain INSIDE the bathtub or you will saturate the bathroom floor. Housekeeping was adequate, with the exception of our tissues not being replaced when used up (one of us had a cold). Air conditioning in room was excellent- we set it at 24 degrees and it was sufficiently cold for us. Staff were lovely. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. We left our luggage with concierge when we checked out and found the service excellent. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel so can't comment on that. Overall, a good hotel. If staying for a few days, a my-multi weekly pass could be handy to reach destinations that are a bit further (Circular Quay for example). Would recommend to friends and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy our stay whether business or pleasure. Restaurant is excellent and great service. Good location near trains and buses. Desk staff are excellent, able to get in at 9am after long flight. Would heve liked a king bed but queen is ok. Enjoyed city view room.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction Rating 9/10”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times over the past 8 years. It meets all of our requirements and on each occasion we have been completly satisfied. Employees are always friendly and helpful. We usually avoid large hotels, BUT this is an exception and very hassel free. Well DONE.

Reviews.Title: “AN EASY STAY”
Reviews.Author: TanyaHolt Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel clean, tidy and had all the comforts of home. It was near Darling Harbour and close enough for city access. My family were impressed with the pool and other facilities available to us.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Gorros
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here regularly and have found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The Hotel is convenient to the City - a 10 minute walk and and public transport is right outside the door. Breakfast is excellent - plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & very helpful staff :-)”
Reviews.Author: LoveStalis06
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for 4 nights in February 2011 and we really enjoyed our stay. We had room 806 which was big enough for the two of us with 2 double beds plus a seating area and a small wardrobe area which also had tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom was ok although a more powerful shower would of been nice but everything worked fine and there was always hot water. We found the hotel to be ideally based for public transport options with a ticket office just outside the hotel. On our 2nd day we realised we had lost our camcorder but were quite sure we had left on the plane!!! We knew it was a long shot but I went down to reception and spoke to Renaud, one of the concierges, and he took all the details and said he would try to get in touch with our airline. We went out for a while and when we returned we had a phone message to go to reception and to our amazement Renaud had got in touch with our airline, Emirates, and they had found it!!! The hotel also has a small pool which is nice to relax in after a long day of sight-seeing. Darling Harbour/Cockle Bay is only a short walk away with plenty of places to eat and is nice to have a walk round and people watch. All in all the hotel was a good base and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the Mercure Sydney on Wed 18.01.12. The best impression was the girl behing the counter who checked me in after 2200hrs, (i didn't get her name), but her service and attitude were outstanding, and she she was one employee perfectly suited to her role. The room was very clean and the breakfast delicious. I really have nothing to fault so well done, and i will now make the Mercure Sydney my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at The Mecure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I took my young daughter and a family friend to see the Harry Potter Exhibition. We stayed at the Mecure as it was close to train station, yet still easily and quickly accessible to inner Sydney by bus. Our room was exactly as described.. it was a great size, and very clean. Your front desk staff were very professional and courteous.... Room service was very quick and the meal sizes were great! In all, a great experience, and we would stay with Mecure again.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: television reception was poor but other than that would recommend it the hotel. Pool area was looking a little neglected. Breakfast was good not the best buffet ever and the coffee machine kept malfunctioning. Good position to investigate the city, staff that greeted us were excellent and rooms very clean and tidy, beds very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. The room was quite spacious having two very comfortable double beds a desk area and a large wardrobe and very adequate sized tea/coffee area. The bathroom was also a very good size and spotlessly clean during our whole stay. The location of this hotel is very good, you are right near Central Station and the main bus terminal with the light rail around to Darling Harbour only a short walk away with the terminus at the front of Central Station. I asked for a room in a quiet location upon check in and was allocated a room on the 8th floor at the back of the hotel and although we had no great view to speak of we heard no traffic noise at all which was excellent considering the hotel's location at a busy intersection. My only two small complaints were the cost of internet access at $22 a day which I thought was very steep considering we had just come from a small hotel in the Blue Mountains where it had been free and the high cost of parking although I do understand that parking is always expensive in a major city. All in all though the staff were very friendly and we enjoyed our stay. I would recommend this hotel for someone wanting to stay close to the Darling Harbour area but without the steep price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location for a night in the city”
Reviews.Author: Haz89
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here as we both had work functions on in the city. Service at check in was good and efficient. Our room was a studio and was well priced for what we got ($180). After checking into the room late at night we discovered it had a strong smell of vomit from the carpet which had not been cleaned correctly. My fiance was pregnant at the time and this made her feel sick, the smell didn't make me feel to good either. We decided to sleep on it as it was late in the night. Breakfast in the morning was nice and service was good! I received an email survey and when I had reported the vomit smell I never received a reply... Overall it is a nice hotel for when you need to spend the night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabfeathers
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights after getting off a cruise with the family. We decided to upgrade from the standard twin room we had booked to a family room and it was well worth it. The kitchen had its own espresso machine plus the usual tea/coffees/hot chocolates. Huge flat screen tv in seperate room with Super king bed. Kids slept in lounge area in pull out sofa and roll away. Had bathrobs to use which came with a small box of choclolates. We did feel special. The main restaurant had a very large buffett breakfast with just about everything you could want. Staff were efficient and friendly. There is a pizza bar attached to the side of the hotel which allowed us to take our pizza order up into our room. Very delicious and we enjoyed happy hour! it is located a short walk from the Central Train station which contects you with every other sort of transportation you need to get around Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AND SEE SHOW AT CAPITAL THEATRE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really convenient if you are travelling to the City , just a short stroll to the Capital Theatre.Staff are wonderful and the rooms are really great value.The retaraunt is fabulous and the food and wine is excellent once again staff great.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Mecure Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mecure hotel in Sydney as an overnight stay on our way to Melbourne. The room for 4 people is a little small (there were 2 double beds for 2 adults and 2 children). Especially disappointing is the fact we were given a smoking room when it was disclosed that were travelling with older children. This is the first time in 20 years of travelling that we have ever received a smoking room. Please note that the smoking rooms do smell to non smokers and we had to keep the air conditioning on to get some air into the room. Its a good lesson to learn to ensure you always request a non smoking room when travelling. The restaurant and dining were excellent but limited menu for young children. Overall its a good hotel for location but would be better suited to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Shopping & Eating Frenzy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mission accomplished! Needed a good hotel to stay as close to the centre of Sydney as economically possible. Mercure was a nice hotel and close enough for us to walk to Darling Harbour and Pitt Street Mall (although we did end up riding the bus a few times). Thank you to the concierge and room staff on our floor for looking after us.

Reviews.Title: “Good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved the proximity of the hotel to train, light rail and bus transport and because it was within walking distance of a few tourist attractions such as Chinatown, Powerhouse Museum and Paddy's Market. A really handy location! Cleanliness of the room very good. However, we didn't like the view of a dilapidated building from our room which already felt a little on the small side. Two double beds for a family? Realistic photos on website would maybe help expectations. And the shower leaking constantly and splashing on the floor making it slippery was a health & safety issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mv18829
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because of it's location and availability of a good family package. Our package included breakfast and an in-house movie in a family room with two double beds. Great value. Right near Central Railway Station, Chinatown and Paddy's Markets. The staff were some of the most courteous and helpful we have encountered, right down to the concierge and restaurant staff. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. Room service was on par with most hotels in terms of price and quality and delivered within 15 mins. The breakfast buffet was well stocked with a wide selection. The pool was somewhat small but for the price, we did well to find an indoor heated pool in the Sydney CBD. The only negative was the quality of the TV. The picture was awful and a brand that I've never encountered before. We had to turn off the free in-house movie part way and watching other channels was painful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travellover191
Reviews.Content: We booked this on Expedia as they had a 'summer sale' price for the dates we required. Our family of 2 adults and 2 children aged 12 and 10 enjoyed a wonderful stay sharing a room for 3 nights in this well located hotel at Railway Square with easy access to train, buses and light rail. It was perfectly situated for walking to Paddy's Market, Chinatown and Darling Harbour. It was also perfect for us as we were able to easily catch the light rail to Star City to see "Annie" at the Lyric Theatre. Our kids also loved their swim in the hotel pool after a long day of seeing the sights. The staff were all very attentive and personable. Our room was cleaned well we had very comfortable beds and pillows. While the daily parking added to the cost of our stay, it was cheaper than many other Sydney hotels we enquired about. We did not use the internet so we did not incur their charges for this service. The only negative for me would be the lobby area which was a bit lacking in atmosphere and warmth however not a place we spent any time in so it didn't worry us particularly. It is certainly something that could easily be improved upon. The friendly and attentive staff certainly made up for this. We would definitely return here and happily recommend to our friends. Great option for a family while the kids are still happy to share a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay Once Again!”
Reviews.Author: Pana67 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Mercure. Was lucky to get a room facing the city this time so spent some time enjoying the view! Breakfast was good. Good location for visiting the Powerhouse Museum with Harry Potter exhibition - only 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good value provided you don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: 4Macks
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we have stayed with the Accor chain before and a promotion at the time enabled us to get a reasonable discount on the room. My wife and I traveled with two children (aged 9 and 12) and we had a room with two double beds and stayed for seven nights. It was our second stay at the hotel. It might seem a strange thing to focus on but one of the standout items for us was the guest laundry! The hotel had set aside a small room with a washer and dryer, enabling us to get the laundry done without a trek to the nearest laundromat. Thatâ€™s a big plus when travelling with kids and / or when being away from home for more than few days. Other similar hotels (even ones in the Accor chain) could take note of this. Staff were always friendly and courteous and the concierge / porters particularly helpful with local directions and assistance with baggage. We stayed in a standard room, so with the two double beds and three pieces of luggage, it was a bit of a squeeze but we didnâ€™t spend a huge amount of time in the room anyway. The two double bed configuration was acceptable (the only other choice to cater for our family was to get two rooms). However, while we are not particularly tall, queen beds would have made for a more restful nightâ€™s sleep. Even better would have been â€˜family roomsâ€™ with, for example, one queen and two singles or a queen and a double decker bunk bed configuration. The kids are of the age where they will still share a bed now but next time we head to Sydney weâ€™ll need to seek out more family friendly configurations. At the risk of getting on the soapbox, in our experience there is a dearth of family accommodation worldwide in hotels of this standard. Itâ€™s a big market and if hotels could provide bedding configurations to sleep a couple plus two or more children (other than in trundle beds squeezed into a small room) then travelers would respond positively. The hotel is frequented by airline flight crew and cabin staff and hosted a lot of foreign tourists. We were impressed to see a reception staff member speaking fluent French (I think) to a French speaking guest! We took advantage of the â€œPillow Menuâ€� and requested some firmer pillows than the standard ones supplied (at no charge). That was a nice touch. We paid in advance for the buffet breakfast and this was good value, as kids eat for free with an accompanying adult. There were cafes etc nearby but when you compare the range and value of the buffet, you are better off eating in the hotel if you have children. The hotel doesnâ€™t have mini bars but instead â€˜smart barsâ€™ located on each floor. Thatâ€™s a good idea if you are traveling with children as it is easier to resist the temptation! Wifi and internet connections were available in each room and in a business room, but at extra cost. If places like MacDonalds and cheap hotels can offer free wifi (even for a limited time) then surely the Mercure should have been able to do so as well. The hotel is right on Railway square on George Street, so access to buses and trains is easy. As is access to Chinatown, Paddyâ€™s Market (walking distance); and Circular Quay and city centre just a few stops away. There are a range of eating places nearby. We felt the room was good value for the discount price we paid and would certainly stay there again (provided a reasonably priced family friendly configuration can be arranged).

Reviews.Title: “Kept in the Dark”
Reviews.Author: Liz D
Reviews.Content: Arrived only to find we weren't actually booked in due to travel agent's mistake. Reception refused to help, we had to sort the booking out ourselves by ringing Melbourne travel agent. (they didn't offer for us to use their phone/quiet space). At least they looked after our luggage. But once sorted, checked in ok. Room small and very dark after sun went down. NO bedside lamps, only 1 wall light on main wall and one small halogen downlight over fridge work top and mini lamp on desk. Only good for watching tv. I could not pack or read in the evening!! Bed/pillows very comfy. But what, no minibar. Had to trundle off back downstairs to request a 'smart card' so didn't bother. Eve's Bar very cold due to air-con and draught from open doors. Not welcoming, dark and bar stools too high (prob ok for 6' men) Both first choice of wine and beer not available and the bar man didn't seem bothered. I don't set out to find fault with things and therefore didn't complain but it's only after when you realise that something should have been said for the benefit of future guests at least. After all it's our hard earned cash that's got us there. On the other hand, great location to Central Station and staff courteous. Pool on top floor had great views but was very very small and wet floors dangerous. Stairs to/from Pool very visually disorientating due to stripes in the pattern and no stair nosings/tactiles. It is one year since a hotel stay and one sets out to enjoy oneself, no look for fault from the beginning. There was also a long thin crack in bathroom sink and water pressure of shower not up to standard.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden extras make this an expensive stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Parking and an internet connection will add about $50 to your bill each day. At the extra cost there are better hotels. The hotel lobby has a damp hue and the room was only cleaned each day after 3pm.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Mecure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel well located to Sydney CBD and transport. Central to most inner city tourist sites. Rooms are comfortable but are slightly squashy and bare minium for a hotel of this standard. Storage of luggage and personal items for a stay greater then one night not good. Rooms clean and well kept. Not a fan of self service mini bar system out side the room. Breakfast is OK, but choices on full breakfast limitted most times only has scrambled eggs? Service desk and room service good friendly and efficient. Limited parking for Hotel this size. Good value for money in regards to Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamadodo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Christmas break and even had our Christmas breakfast here. The room was nicely appointed, enough room for four of us and it was great value for money, given the busy tijme. We took the family package which included breakfast for 2 adults, 2 children, parking and a pay per view movie. There was a little confusion at first over the movie as our receptionist told us we had a movie per day, which would have been great, but just in case I rang to check and sure enough it was only one per stay, regardless of how long the stay. Still the parking in Sydney for three days overnight, definitely made up for that! lol!! The swimming pool was small but clean and the same for the gym. Staff in the restaurant, in particular were very friendly and attentive. They gave no impression, even on Christmas morning, that they would rather be elsewhere. Overall, a terrific place to stay and we will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Sydney CBD. Very easy walking to local shopping, transport, Darling Harbour and other central Sydney attractions. Room was clean and functional, a little bit small however. We found the room a bit noisy at night with people returning to their rooms. Noise from rooms nearby and foyer area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and well appointed. The bathroom was "tired" but the room has been upgraded and renovated. The location of the hotel is convenient to Darling Harbour and Chinatown and only a stone's throw to Central Railway Station. There are a lot of cheap places to eat in the area due to the nearby university. It is quite a distance to hike to the areas and streets of Sydney which I would consider to be more upmarket, and public transport is not an easy option. The buffet restaurant was quite nice. Overall, the hotel offers really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: pleiria Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was amazingly surprised with the very good quality of this hotel. The location was perfect as very close to the railway station and just a very short distance from all the interesting places. The staff was very friendly, either at the reception as in the restaurant which were those I was more in contact. I would definitely recommend the Mercure Sydney to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Summer stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our first stay at this hotel. Location handy for transport. Amenities of a high standard. Pool and gym an unexpected bonus. THe room was slightly larger than we expected, and included a good view. All facets of the hotel very good, food was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff made the visit special, they were all so welcoming and only too happy to be of service. Humans have a way of making a hotel hospititable... the rooms were nice, clean and quiet. Will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Crazysteveb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights - we were upgraded to a deluxe room on an upper level which was wonderful. Very comfortable room, staff were friendly and helpful, and the restaurant was good, albeit sometimes very busy at breakfast time. We would certainly stay here again. Used our Accor Advantage Plus card without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CPA52
Reviews.Content: Mecure Sydney is a great convenient place to stay as it is within walking distance to Central Station, Darling Harbour and China Town. Happy hour at Eve's Place is good value. We also dinned in Four Elements Restaurant finding the food to be very good. The only disappointment was when we returned at 3pm from sightseeing finding that our room had not been made up, a call to housekeeping, they advised it would be attended to immediately so we went to Eve's Place for a drink returning to room 45 minutes later to again find the room still had not been cleaned, another call to housekeeping back to bar returning about 1 hour later the room had finally been cleaned. This is the only fault I could find with the Mercure and it would not stop us from staying with then in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location on George Street Walking distance to Darling Harbor Expensive for breakfast and can find same food for less money in the city. Very modern accommodations and price of room is reasonable in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's stay 2011/2012”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel and helpful concierge. Pool area is very small and was full of kids so weren't able to use it, but it was Holiday season and New Year's as well. I know that all hotels raise prices for popular nights but to have Dec 30 be ~$259/night and Dec31 be ~$759/ night was pretty excessive. But, I guess that is to be expected anywhere on New Year's. The AC didn't keep the room cool, but did provide air movement which helped. Overall it was a decent stay and I would stay there again - if a hotel closer to the water and with a larger pool area was not available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Located Near Bus and Train Stations”
Reviews.Author: W-Hartford_CT
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights and the hotel was very good. The room was small, but clean and efficient. Right outside the hotel entrance is one of the central bus stops and the train station is a short underground tunnel away. The location can be seen as a plus because of access to transport and being right next to Chinatown. However, it is the other end of the Central Business District so if you want to be within walking distant of the Circular Quay it wouldn't be the best choice. Also, at night the area is bit sketchy. I never felt unsafe, but some people might feel uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late 2011 for one night with a 2 year old. The location is fantastic, right next to central station. I got this room for free so I won't comment on the cost, but the price on the website was much cheaper than many hotels of a similar size. The restaurant provided the usual wonderful Accor breakfast (free for kids) and the parking saved us a lot of money. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge”
Reviews.Author: kazlac Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I wanted to particularly commend a Conceirge that served us whilst we were there, I believe his name is Shane (he is of Islander apperance). He was courteous and extremely helpful and had a great personality. We were very impressed with his service. Please ensure he receives some sort of recognition for his fantastic customer serivice.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above the average Mercure Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very few hotels allow you to have two children stay; this Mercure is very child friendly with an indoor heated pool and close proximity to the Powerhouse museum, Darling Harbour, and Haymarket. The staff are very friendly and provide high quality service, and the breakfast quality is well above the usual high standard offered by Mercure.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to the City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mecure Sydney is always a great convenient place to stay. Excellent for children as it has a great indoor pool on the roof top and you can see all across the city. Would stay here anytime as it is reasonably priced for a city hotel and convenient to everywhere and parking is quick and simple!!

Reviews.Title: “My stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days. Everything was of good services in the frist 4 days. However, in the last 2 days, the room service became quite poor such as: - Bath towels were not changed. - Bedsheets were not changed. - Toilet was not cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Rude receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Kohsamui_9 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i think her name is Rizza, she checked us in and also was the person who checked us out. I arrived early and instead of trying to accommodate in the best way she can she just told me to come back in a few hours. Finally the manager helped to allocate a different room for the night. Also during check out she was extremely insincere and generally just very cold and seemed like she didn't want to work there. I think someone should check the video of how she provides her service and try and train her. Or maybe she just shouldn't be working in the service industry. Besides her, most of the other staffs were extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “stay at mercure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Efficient Service. Amenities wonderful. Friendly and helpful staff however dont agree with extra $3 charge for room service. received towels with holes in them unacceptable. quiet best nights sleep ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel to transport was excellent, buses stopped at the front door. The room was very clean and well appointed with lovely view. The bed and pillow were very comfortable, The staff were very friendly and could help with maps etc Value for money we couldn't have done any better Would always stay at the Mercure when staying Sydney

Reviews.Title: “The big Harry Potter trip”
Reviews.Author: Diamondshire Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Brought my daughter from Brisbane to see the Harry Potter exhibition for her 16th birthday. Love the Mercure Sydney as it is so close to everything including Central. Easy walk to the Powerhouse, Monorail and Chinatown. Room was a bit small but we were only in there to sleep so it didn't matter. Concierge was extremely helpful. Fabulous and memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable and Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We just spent Christmas in Sydney and we enjoyed the best room in the hotel, with great views over the CBD, in a large room with a bed far more comfortable than usual. The room was very quiet and you simply cannot beat the convenient location. Due to the room getting a lot of the morning sun, it did heat up rather quickly, making the aircon have to work hard, but it was still a comfortable and enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very ill treated no one replied to my calls for room service k k

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you like using public transport, it's ideally located. 10 mins walk to Pitt St Mall and Darling Harbour. Lots of cheap places to eat nearby, I like the Thai place for takeaway. Nothing flash, but comfortable - I stay here a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet spot in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Sydney is located close to Central Railway Station and not too far from the CBD. It is a very busy area but the sleep quality at the hotel is excellent. I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is good, near UTS, China town, and the central station, you can walk to the central station in 10 minutes. The internet access is expensive. Many hotel in US and China provide free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Tour around the world - step 8”
Reviews.Author: bimbo_swiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the beginning of March. I had booked a non-smoking room but they gave me a smoking one, I insisted but no way. The reception clerk said that they would give me a non-smoking one only if I paid an extra cost. The room had a bad odour of smoke. The bathroom was very outdated. The only good thing was the view from my room. I tried to go to the swimming pool but it was dirty and I decided not to get in. Location is not so good, I would prefer for the next time a place closer to the Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Xmas Syd visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were very curteous. Beds very comfortable and clean. Handy parking underneath. Best thing was the breakfast bar, fantastic selection. Only complaint was having to set and wait for sauna to heat up, and generally no staff assistance in that area (pool/sauna/gym). TV reception was not very good but otherwise a wonderful place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel with good service. hotel excellent avec un personnel accueillant et disponible, situation idÃ©ale pour tout ce qui concerne le chopping et notamment la proximitÃ© de Hay Marquet. proximitÃ© de la gare idÃ©ale pour les Ã©trangers car facilitÃ© d'accÃ©s Ã  l'aÃ©roport international

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stay in a suite if you ahve children we up graded and it was the best choice...so much more space..The brekky was great and the staff awesome....It was the best stay we had in the city for a long time and there is no noise from the outside freeway...overall great

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: swj101
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Sydney during a big conference. This was one of only two downtown internationally known hotels with any availability. I found out why! Far below Mercure standards elsewhere in the world. Dirty, outdated, poor service, ugly views of dingy back streets and not even a minibar. They have some sort of communal mini bar device on each floor that systematically didn't work - meaning I couldn't even get a bottle of fresh water! The staff couldn't have cared less. I got out of there after two nights!

Reviews.Title: “A great time in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved staying at this place. When ever we didn't know where something was, the concierge planned our transportations or suggested restaurants that were always incredible. Friendly staff and quiet rooms, I loved it! I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great w/e away”
Reviews.Author: chunky51 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right near central station and shops, trams, restaurants etc, it was just what we wanted , food was great, very busy, staff were friendly and efficient, they would help with maps directions bags etc, we had a great stay and would recommend to anyone who is looking for a hotel close to everything. thanks for a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “My Excellent Stay at Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotles I've stayed at , very conveniently located and in close proximity to Paddy's MArket and China Town. The staff were very helpful and always willing to give you a hand with things especially travelling with 2 young kids. Will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great friendly service from when we arrived to our departure. Easily accessible and a handy location. The restaurant meals were delicious but too small and we would have enjoyed some more milk in the fridge for a coffee on arrival. But overall a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at a reasnable price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean & well presented. Service was good except when we went for breakfast in the morning. Apparently it was showing that breakfast wasn't paid for when i paid for when i booked the reservation. location wasn't to bad. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney with small children”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location to get around Sydmey with small children. Motel very close to train station. Room was very clean. Customer service great. Only problem difficult to find motel entry and car park if you are driving there

Reviews.Title: “Mercure in George St, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was not very happy with Accor when I arrived but after a couple of minutes with the fabulous lady on the desk, I felt so much better, she was awesome. The room was better than expected and we had a really nice stay. The restuarant was fabulous, we had dinner in the restuarant and thoroughly enjoy our meal.

Reviews.Title: “Don't sleep here if a function is on.”
Reviews.Author: ayrbrain
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here a number of years back we thought we would stay again. the first few nights were fine, but then it all went pear shaped on our last night. We had a very early start the following morning to catch a flight, our early night was completely ruined by a function being held on the 2nd floor despite us being on the 4th floor the noise from that area was terrible. After phoning reception about this noise they offered to move us, but they only had smoking rooms left which we found very unusual as we were told it was a 500 room hotel!
