We had to take up this offer even though we are non smokers, we ended up getting up even earlier than planned just to get out of the room due to the smell. We heard that other guests were complaining as well due to the terrible loud music. It is unlikely that we will ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Start of Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first couple of days to get over from European jetlag. No room ready but we were early, we knew there was a hospitality room but this was not offered, we stayed there for a few hours. The hospitality room was not cleaned with dirty towels lying in a heap. This was cleaned quickly but since the room was not private we couldn't sleep/relax properly. Once we got into our room our holiday started, lovely clean room but the traffic starts at around 6am so don't expect much sleep after that. Consierge good with local advice. Pool on top floor lovely but needs to get the broken tiles fixed, lots of clean towels and not much used.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions. The staff are always friendly and helpful. the rooms are always clean and the beds comfortable. The hotel has a carpark which has easy access. It is close to both trains and buses and also the light rail which can transport you to the Paddy's Market, China town and Monorail and also out to Darling Harbour and Glebe. It is also within walking distance to downtown Pitt st although this is a fair walk but not a hard one.

Reviews.Title: “Conveinient to rail. Not much else.”
Reviews.Author: allanmc
Reviews.Content: Standard 3 Star hotel close to Central Station, small rooms, basic furnishings, poor TV reception. No wireless internet above the 3rd floor only cable, all internet is charged at some inflated cost. Even the wireless in the lobby is charged. Room was reasonably clean but unappealing, not somewhere that I would like to spend a few days. Check-in was efficient and friendly with directions to the pool, restaurant, bar and business centre, none of which I needed to know, but others might. Not worth the AUD$249/ night, but that maybe Sydney prices. I would not stay there again, only because it had a feeling of a very basic 3 star hotel at 4 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and it was very quiet. A lovely place to stay and I had an enjoyable time. Easy acess to public transport and China Town. Rooom service was afforable when on a budget. The room was nice and clean. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Most take away food outlet straight across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service. Congratulations to the dedicated staff.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The airc-onditioning was turned off on arrival, quite warm in the room. However, once I called for service, the staff member fixed the air-con and all good. The staff member was extremely friendly and dedicated to his work, great service. Value for money. Location is close to everything. Overall all 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed over two days to celebrate 2 birthdays and also to see the city with all the Christmas Decos. The room was a good size for 4 of us. The breakfast was great. The kids enjoyed the pool after walking around the city all day. It will be a birthday they will remember.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: PaulN60 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel, particularly as I'd stayed in the fantastic Art Series The Blackman in Melbourne prior to arriving in Sydney. As I pointed out to the assistant front desk manager, the entire hotel is tired and dated, particularly the bathrooms and room decor. Small, dirty, smelly room didn't really make for an enjoyable stay! The smell was the industrial spray that they spray the rooms wth to cover the stale smell as there are no opening windows in the room. The assistant front desk manager agreed that the hotel was dated and tired, but explained that it is reviewed annually for its 4 star rating. He explained that a refurbishment is imminent and felt that the hotel represented good value for the location in the meantime. Excellent location, but room, service and facilities are no way 4 star, very disapointing!

Reviews.Title: “My Mercure stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service levels provided by staff and their knowledgeability were good, the cleanliness of the facilities and the location were also good. Access to parking was also good. However, the air conditioning in my room was noisy. I found it a little uncomfortable having a relaxing sleep. Overall, the experience was enjoyable. The breakfast food was fresh and abundant, the building clean and the room reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for Sydney, decent location”
Reviews.Author: yorkie79rio
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small and basic but more than adequate had everything we needed. Very clean. Reasonable value for Sydney, decent location 5 mins to China town and 10 to Darling Harbour. We walked pretty much everywhere. Didn't eat breakfast there as quite expensive and prefer to eat in a cafe.

Reviews.Title: “House Keeping - very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really loved the location. Everything was great apart from housekeeping. When we arrived in the morning as we had 4 people they said they would send up some extra towels etc straight away to the room was only set up for 2 even though it was 2 double beds. Unfortunately we still had not received them by 7pm that night so had to ring up. Another day we came back at 9:30pm to find that our room had not even been made up and the used towels had not been replaced. We also still only had 2 cups, 2 teaspoons 2 of everything instead of 4 during our entire stay. We had to ring housekeeping to organise new towels. It was very disappointing as it had been a late night and we had hoped to put the kids in a freshly made bed. We then also asked for more mugs to make them a hot choc in the morning however we were informed that they had none.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, value & great service”
Reviews.Author: Edster88
Reviews.Content: Rooms are of good size & clean. Bed is comfortable. Buffet breakfast is honest with basic international variety(Chinese Congee & Indian varieties). Location is quite central being about 7 minutes walk from Sydney Chinatown & Paddy's Markets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and family value!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyDude72
Reviews.Content: Very handy location. Right in in the middle of all the action. Not far too the airport. Parking and breakfast was included in the family package. Worked well for our family for the week. I highly recommend the buffet breakfast. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall, good value for money as far as Sydney goes

Reviews.Title: “Aircon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A bit of a wait to get into restaurant for a meal one night of our stay & the aircon wasn't working so it was very cold. Actually left & went to another restaurant down the road. Apart from that the location suited us very well, as had to catch train to Olympic Park. Concierge very helpful. Overall a great stary. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Clean and Very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: BrendanG70 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very high class hotel which lives up to all expectations. Situated in the heart of George street which is easy access to all restaurants , shopping centres , busses and trains. Only 15 mins from the airport so your hardly going to bit late for check in or flight. Getting back to the hotel.. Rooms are very clean and are well looked after, the main resaurant i wouldnt reccommend as it is overpriced and the food is very poor there.. thats dinner.. breakfast on the other hand is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be all that we required. We look forward to our next visit in the New Year. It is our Sydney Hotel!! We travel by the XPT train from Port Macquarie (usually to go on cruises) The closeness of Central Station to the hotel makes it an ideal locality for us.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Party”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel met expectations, staff were firendly and basic cleanliness was fine. Valet parking would be an improvement as would mini bar rather than a dispenser in the hall way. Location is good and proximity to chinatown was a bonus

Reviews.Title: “my three day stop-over in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: johdenmac Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in easy but no service for luggage to room. Room spacious and welcoming --chocolates and avian water supplied. All facilities provided. Concierge desk very helpful and knowledgeable re Syney and surrounds particularly in relation to transport. Breakfasts and meals good quality. Bars pleasant and reasonably priced with satisfying range of drinks. Staff friendly when encountered anywhere in hotel. Well positioned hotel for ease of access to Sydney shopping, theatres and landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stopover sydney for a night before heading back to Brissy. Was looking for a decent 4-star hotel but with reasonable price. Mercure is just amazing and was the perfect choice. Close to central station where chinatown is and it was easy for us to get to and fro the hotel. I absolutely love the location. The rooms are reasonable size for two girls as long as you are not aftering something along the lines of SUPERB. But overall, we love it and it was great. Thanks Mercure Sydney for being so awesome :)

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed multiple times at Mercure Sydney because we find it a great place to stay plus it is so convenient to access by car (with good value parking) and rail (Central Station) and by city buses which stop very close by. The hotel staff are friendly, efficient and courteous, the rooms are good, the beds extremely comfortable, the dining good value and the breakfast is a wonderful spread. We have already booked three more stays.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgtkHongKong Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very confortable hotel in brilliant location and excellent quick shuttle bus trip to airport, while still being able to stay in and enjoy the CBD. Central station, and Chinatown are on the doorstep, it is an easy walk to the main shopping area and the restauarant serves excellent food at sensible prices. The pool has a great view over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre night out”
Reviews.Author: pratt109 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay and everything went well. We havent stayed at the hotel recently and were surprised to see the changes in the restaurant area. They have opened the area up and it is very good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible and sub-par”
Reviews.Author: jjdd77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure last week as I was presenting at a conference at UTS. The booking had been made by the conference organisers. On arrival I was told that I could not check-in as I didn't have photo ID and didn't know some of the details of the booking. The front of house staff were inflexible and unapologetic. I waited for five hours in the lobby for other conference presenters to arrive. The staff did nothing to alleviate or soften this wait time. The room itself was old, dank and the shower was pathetic (sticky shower curtain, minimum water pressure, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Two in our group were cheated by the hotel. Beware.”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan U
Reviews.Content: The organizers of a conference in which I participated booked a dozen rooms at this hotel, as it was just a few minutes from the conference venue. Two of the participants arrived in the evening, and the hotel reception desk told each of them separately that the hotel had overbooked (deliberately) and had given away their rooms to someone else. They were told that the hotel would refuse to refund the money for the reservation, which would have enabled them to find a room at a nearby hotel. Instead Mercure would provide them with tax vouchers to go stay at the Mercure Hotel way out at Sydney Airport, where Mercure wanted extra business. It meant that these two conference participants would be stranded out at the airport away from the conference site and out of contact with other participants. What Mercure did constituted an illegal breach of contract. All of us know that travellers must give their credit card details to hotels when making reservations, and that they will need to pay for the room if they don't show up in what constitutes a contract with the hotel, since the hotel has had to keep the room free for them. For its part, a hotel is legally bound to honour a reservation in this circumstance by having a room reserved and available for the arriving guest. Instead, Mercure commits breaches of contract as a POLICY (the lady in charge of the reception desk admitted that this was the hotel's regular policy), My wife and I will never again stay at a Mercure hotel in Sydney, as we can't trust that our reservation will be honoured.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was spot on. We were able to check in earlier which was very convenient. The children loved the swimming pool. The staff were never too busy to answer your questions. I loved the fact when we asked to book the shuttle back to the airport the Concierge advised us that it would be more affordable to take a taxi, which is a welcomed piece of advice. The directions to any of the public transport was always easy to understand and a map was always on hand. The 11am check out was also very convenient as there was no rushing to be out by the usual 10am. Overall I would easily stay again and I have already recommended your hotel to someone. Thank you......Deb

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay for stopover”
Reviews.Author: El_Bones_Chapman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days whilst seeing friends and waiting for another flight. Easy to get to. Easy access for rail links and and easy 5min walk down to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. Had checked to see if discount booking had been made and they replied promptly that it had. Service in hotel fine when required. Pool nice for a little freshen up, not too big or too warm. We had views looking back up towards town/station. Noise not a problem for us...and a comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was well looked after from booking to check-out especially in house services from maintainence to room service. Would recommend the Mercure to anyone, friends and family. I was impressed by a no hassle upgrade to a non-smoking room, much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staffs were very friendly and helpful. Offered me a free upgrade to a Kings Suite so I can have additional cot in the room still with a bit of room. Swimming pool at rooftop is a lot of fun ( a bit bit ) but understandable in the middle of Sydney. 5 minutes walk to Central station, bus stop at the doorstep and 10 minutes walk to Chinatown. Really good experience with the stay and will definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Prepay at the Mercure but don't arrive late”
Reviews.Author: bigwsister Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose this hotel because of its location - near Central Station and bus interchange and because the restaurant is convenient. We prepaid for a standard twin room (two double beds). As we travelled by train to Sydney and the train was late, it was around 8.45 when we checked in. We were offered a room on a smokers' floor (both our husbands died of lung cancer) or a King room. It appears that rooms are allocated at the time you check in even though we had prepaid. The king size room was fine except that one of us (my friend opted) had to sleep on a fold out couch which was not made up until we requested. It actually turned out OK because there was a heavy sliding door to separate the two sections so we had a room each but what if we had booked and paid for a pair of the few available connecting rooms (as happened to my son and family at another hotel) and they had been allotted already. It seems that you do not always get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Communication”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights, prepaid for my accommodation by Visa Debit Card (which I thought would provide all the same facilities as a Visa Credit). After travelling for 5 hours on the Friday and having to rush out to a function immediately on arrival I chose room service for my evening meal. The pizza was not cooked properly and the crust was rubbery, however, being so tired I went to bed only to be woken by a phone call at around 10pm from room service demanding payment for my meal. I was told that I had to pay cash/credit for all my meals and could not charge it to my room. However, the meal was charged as "credit" using my visa debit card. The next day I also chose room service for breakfast and dinner and on both occasions queried this, only to be told it was hotel policy. It was not until I was ready to check out on the Sunday morning and I raised this with Reception that it was explained to me that because I was using a Visa Debit Card they could not put a hold on funds as it would freeze my money for 7 days. If this had been explained to me at check in (when my Visa Card was swiped twice to ensure the hotel took a $50 deposit), my stay could have been entirely different and cheaper as I would not have used room service. All in all I felt some form of discrimination. Why not hold a large deposit from which meals could be deducted?

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A relatively expensive Saturday night rate that weekend. The charge of an additional $30 for overnight parking in a hotel owned on site car park was an unexpected additional expense. This additional charge should have been advised on booking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jono_and_Jo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year as part of our round the world trip. The hotel was clean, modern and bright. Our room was just what we needed, a base to explore this great city. The trips we booked were also excellencent. I would definately stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “mecure sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had dinner and breakfast at the hotel and enjoyed both. service was great and staff friendly. the room was adequate, clean and tidy and the king size bed was great. we were on the 12th floor and heard no noise at all through the night ensuring a great sleep. we would stay here again if we were staying at this end of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on many occasions. Staff always helpful and friendly. Biggest asset is its location close to Central Railway, bus stops, Haymarket, Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the CBD. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean, neat and tidy room. Great views from our room looking down George St. Check in was just superb, we arrived early and had our bags checked in and then went for look around the City. When we arrived back at our suite our luggage was there. Check out was easy and once again our bags were stored in 'baggage' while we went for another private exercise and returned to collect the baggage to board the train at 12 noon for Canberra. Our stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a revamp”
Reviews.Author: pollypiglets Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nothing spectacular, rooms are a bit tired and in need of an update especially the bathroom. Very comfortable bed though and a good nights sleep. We chose this hotel for its proximity to central station but it turned out to be not as close as we thought

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep in good Sydney city location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mercure Sydney is oasis in the busy transit end of the city. Access by rail,bus or car is so easy. The rooms are well appointed and well insulated from sound. Friendly staff and a wonderful indoor pool make this our preferred Sydney city location.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wasn't impressed with the hotel. Very average overall from the rooms to breakfast buffet. Novotel is of similar rating being mid scale accommodation and I would prefer Novotel anyday to the Mercure. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for business”
Reviews.Author: Shee80
Reviews.Content: Mercure Sydney is well located, close to Central Station, easily accessible by bus and walking distance from Broadway Shopping Centre. Its clean, has onsite parking (have to pay for). Stayed here for almost 4 weeks, had an executive room. Likes: Good bed, a reasonable size room, Nespresso Machine in Executive room, great location, helpful staff, guest laundry ($10 for one load of wash, dry & detergent), KFC, McDonalds, convenience shops right next to hotel. Decent breakfast served at the hotel restaurant. Dislikes: Not as clean as one would expect, always found dust on the study table & bed head. Never enough milk in room to use in machine (had to wait an hour once to have some milk delivered to the room), restaurant in hotel is decent but does not have enough options on the menu to attract you there after the first visit (slow service at restaurant). Anyone can access the the different hotel floors. Not sure if I would want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst value ever!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've never paid this much for a hotel room in Sydney and that includes Hilton and Four Seasons. Room was dated with a stench right through the entire room and floor level. Try as I may I could not get the room remotely dark to sleep at night and was woken by light at 5am for the same reason. Mould and grime in bathroom. Needs a dramatic overhaul as this is a rip off and borders on misrepresentation of the highest kind!

Reviews.Title: “Our room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We did not like the fact the mini bars are not in the rooms. We had a late checkout till 1pm and when we returned to pack up we could not get into our room.Considering we had paid for an up grade we were quite disappointed in this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Accomodation in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at this hotel for its proximity to Central Station,as we only travel by train. It is affordable,very friendly and clean.They also have a restaurant and there is a bar adjacent. It is a fair way from Circular Quay but there are plenty of buses right out the front if you do not feel like walking.Darling Harbor is within walking distance as is China Town.The Queen Victoria building which is great for shopping is about a 20 minute walk but you can always catch a bus if this doesn't suit.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having the pool was great. Room was small but adequate; very clean and decor quite nice. Personel were very courteous and helpful. We would certainly stay again. Took the shuttle bus to the airport which is a very convenient service. Hotel is close to many amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney - do not visit”
Reviews.Author: Thundering_Raiden Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Mercure Hotel on George Street, Sydney (near the Railway Square) in Nov-2011 for 2 nights. I was in Australia for my honeymoon. I would not recommend the hotel to my friends for the following reasons: 1. Room was not ready at the desired time 2. Reception staff was not at all helpful during the check-in. 3. Once the rooms were ready, basic bathroom amenities (such as toiletries) were opened 4. The next day, the room was not clean when though we asked the housekeeping staff to do so. Only high point about the hotel was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Return customer still impressed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mecure Sydney on several occasions in the past and I am pleased to say that I am still very happy and would definitely stay there again. From the moment I arrived, the staff made me feel welcome. The room was clean and quite, so a good nights sleep was had. As for the location, being right next to Central railway station is very convenient. My only disapointment was the high priced glass of Pinot that came highly recomended by the barman, I think the bottle had been opened far too long. I would definitely look to stay at the Mecure on my next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “handy to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the mercure is very central to the cbd in sydney it is very clean and reasonably priced there are plenty of places to eat or have a drink close by and it is only a short stroll to Darling Harbour or China Town The buses and trains run from right out the front to the beach suburbs or its a short train ride to the quay to catch the ferry to taronga zoo or manly beach or luna parkCan fully recommend the mercure when i am in sydney and cant stay with relatives i stay at the Mercure

Reviews.Title: “Worst view from a hotel room I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Hepsprings
Reviews.Content: I wish I could post the view from the room I was given , check before staying . It was on the 11 th floor and it was a depressingly ugly vista

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cicine M
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel, They let us check in early which was much appreciated after a 27 hours trip, The room was big, nice and well furnished, the hallway was very quiet. Good location, the train station was very close, and even a fair walking distance from the city. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kiwis in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were all friendly and helpful and did their best when we had problems with our room. Towels and face clothes were not replaced one day, so the front desk had some sent to our room. it would've been nice to have a microwave and cutlery provided. but other than those few things my friend and I were very pleased with the hotel and its services. The view looking out towards the central station was great. I would consider staying here again next time I'm in Sydney. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay at especially for the location, the boys went to the Australian Golf Open, caught the train at Central, very close by. Us girls went to the new Ikea store, only 10-15 minutes away. Went shopping in the city only a 10 minute walk. Went down to Darling Harbour, again only a 10 minute walk. We stay here every year when visiting Sydney, can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely thanks. My husband and I enjoyed our stay, the tiles in the bathroom were a bit gross though. All in all it was great, enjoyed the location, the cleanliness, the staff and the service. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Fault !!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent check-in service - polite, friendly and helpful. I liked the fact that I was able to choose a smoking or non-smoking room. I have no complaints whatsoever - everything was well organised and all staff I had contact with were helpful, polite and enthusiastic in their respective roles within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the mercure george st sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent location and the staff are helpful and friendly the room was clean and fairly basic..the room on the first night the toilet or bathroom had leaked at some stage so the room smelt like wet carpet the staff however quickly found us another room the next day when i complained,the next room wasnt very soundproof I could hear the women next door coughing all night and the showers being turned on and off,i'm not sure weather this was just the room I was in or an all over the hotel thing. I had to ask the maid at 4 oclock why my room hadnt been cleaned but they were very busy and did it as soon as i asked.The room service food was barely warm and the tray sat outside for at least 12 hours.The pool was excellent and the gum sufficent.All and all the whole experience was fine.it is reasonably priced for sydney hotels and the location is fantastic so I would maybe stay here again

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Mercure 11/11/11”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Mercure Hotel in Sydney. I arrived early in the morning abut had to wait 3 hours for my room..i was exhausted from my this delayed the whole resting process. Other than that everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The concierge was excellent and the Reception desk staff were also very helpful. I had a little difficulty connecting to internet in my room but got there eventually. An improvement would have been a window that opened. It was very stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our children 7 & 12 and couldn't fault it. Rooms are clean, well equipped and modern, staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is ideally located for lots of Sydney attractions, (we walked to Paddy's Markets, Capitol Theatre, Powerhouse museum, Darling Harbour and lots of other places). In general a value for money hotel that we would definitely stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “great ccess to the cbd”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: always a great place to stay with easy access to the cbd and central. A quick taxi ride to the airport, this hotel is clean and provides good service. The accor rate varies and this is confusing , never knowing what the rate will be next visit. would be nice to get a frequent visitors rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was v.good. Check in very fast. Pleased. Check out: slow; only one person at Reception at 9am. Hotel very clean. Good location. Easy access. B/fast ok. Because I paid in advance, I didn't get the discount fopr b/fast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: chrisjrn Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel's is very well kept, with a comfortable lobby and also plenty of space on each floor outside the rooms. Room was clean and tidy; pillow menu was a nice touch. Room, however, was very small for the price range (I'd have expected something maybe one and a half times the size -- there was very little space to walk past the end of the bed, for instance). Also, bizarrely, my Visa debit card, taken at check-in could not be used to bill for room service (this is the first hotel where this hasn't been possible) -- very odd.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid lower rooms on weekends.”
Reviews.Author: mrrobstarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very popular with large tour groups and airline staff and I can see that the hotel staff is trying their best to please every guest. I stayed on the third floor on the weekends and I just say the experience was horrendous as there was a conference room on the floor below and they had a country music party with the volume that goes up to the fifth floor! I can't believe the management allows this. I chose to stay in the room despite an offer to move into a smoking room for obvious reason (the room had smoke stain and thinner beds) however I would hope that the management had offered free wifi at least for such inconvenience!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ChrisShaunIllawarra Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located in a great spot and close to everything - we do like walking though. Nothing was a problem, we received an upgrade as it was my husbands birthday plus chocolates, complimentary water and a robe to use as well. The room was spacious - and a great coffee machine - love the coffee. The Service Desk was brilliant and very helpful..............with a smile. Highly recommend it :)

Reviews.Title: “For a chain hotel, this one was out of the box”
Reviews.Author: towrag72 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we celebrated our wedding anniversary by staying at the Mercure and catching a show nearby. Our check in person, Amanda, organised for a complimentary bottle of bubbles to celebrate the occasion, which was not only a nice touch but made us feel welcomed. The little additional touches in the room of fudge (with the bubbles, a great way to end the evening), Evian (for the heavy head next morning) were also appreciated. Would recommend the hotel highly - its location can't be beaten for food (go to Longrain about 15 mins walk away) and public transport, but also proximity to the theatre, Darling harbour and Chinatown. would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “DECENT HOTEL NICE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: rajesh v
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MERCURE SYDNEY during an official visit. The hotel is right next to the central station and PADDYS MARKET is just a stone's throw away. Apart from the location the staff are very helpful and the breakfast has a very good choice. I was surprised to see them serving Indian dinner may be that is the reason that it is popular with Indian groups. Over all anice experience will come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this was my first time in Sydney. I had no idea where to go or how to get there. The staffs at the hotel was very helpful and friendly.The location was great too. you can catch the bussses and trains. room was nice and confortable. I would like to stay again next visit in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at your hotel and would recommend it to anybody. The girl on the front desk when we checked in and out (same girl) was very nice and efficient and made our stay very pleasant. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Tripper”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mecure Central Sydney is a great place to stay when you need to be close to the city, Darling Harbour and within walking distance to Circular Quay the Art Gallery and many of the attractions our wonderful capitl city has to offer

Reviews.Title: “Happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was roomy clean and quiet. Staff were all lovely and friendly. Hotel is located centrally right near central station and buses so so easy to get anywhere. Heaps of restaurants and eateries around too.

Reviews.Title: “What an EXCELLENT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorOctopus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 14 nights in June/July 2011. I am a young woman in a wheelchair and had brought a carer with me. Unfortunately, whilst in Sydney, I needed to engage additional care services. I could not praise the hotel enough for the lengths they went to in order to ensure my personal well-being and comfort, despite the emotional trauma I experienced. The staff were constantly helpful and professional, no matter what needed to be done, or what time of night it was. I was extremely grateful for the help received and very glad of the free use of the phones on one day. Whilst staying, there were renovations being undertaken. However, I was completely unaware of this and there was no additional mess, or noise, as might be expected. My one point of concern: on two occasions, despite being made aware of my allergies, the hotel gave me food containing dairy. However, on both these occasions it was very quickly rectified and I understand additional staff training has been implemented. The facilities were top-notch. Everywhere I went was wheelchair accessible (though I did not visit the gym or sauna). Staff were excellent at communicating directly with me, and did not attempt to liaise with my carers on matters that concerned me. However, one point, the shower chair was bolted slightly too high on the wall for me to use (I am only 4'10") and the bedroom doors are rather awkward to open for someone with little arm strength. (I suppose actual ease-of-use is different for each person.) Location-wise, the Mercure could not be better placed. One barely has to leave the hotel before a bus station or train station is reached! I would not HESITATE to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here. Because the hotel is close to central station, it is easy to explore Sydney. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The restaurant prices are also not outrageous when considering how much other hotel restaurants charge their guests. We were very greatful that upon our checkout, the conceirge held our luggage untill we were to depart Sydney. Also, do not forget that there is a pool and gym like we did! Over all we were very pleased with our stay, would love to go back again, and would recommend others to come and stay here too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for the traveller or business person”
Reviews.Author: Silly_girl42
Reviews.Content: This hotel has undergone many changes including the menu and Bars. Staff are very ehlpful especially the concierge. Excellent location as close to buses, trains and not far from airport. We usually stay there at least for 2 weeks and have stayed there on an average 2 - 3 times a year.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A quick checkin with a extremely polite staff member plus an unexpected touch of a city view room was a great start. The room clean and welcoming and the view up George Street was a bonus. A quick shower and a change and we were off to grab some dinner and see a show. The return to our room was welcome and a good nights rest was experienced. Bedding and pillows were comfortable. A quick breakfast in the restaurant was good, though the coffee was not a feature. Hopes of a quick departure were soon dashed as the check in area was near bedlam. With a bus load of QANTAS passengers arriving. With 3 people working at the checkin the departure took some time. Many guest were jumping the line by going to the A Club priority checkin. I'm an A Club member, but I am not a priority member, these guest did not produce an AClub card and were unchallenged by staff. A somewhat disappointing end to a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my stay at the Mercure was too brief so was unable to take advantage of the restaurant and other facilities. I chose the hotel for its convenience to Central Railway Station. I had arrived in Sydney late in the evening from a long haul flight and was catching the Countrylink train from Central the following morning at 7.40 a.m. It was so relaxing to have a soak in the bath prior to going to bed. The bed was extremely comfortable. I have stayed in the hotel on a previous occasion and can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Sydney and we were very happy with the location. Very close to all transport services and only 3 train stops from the airport and then only a short walk from the station. The staff at the desk were very helpful and even though we arrived at 7am we were given our room right away. Other hotels where we have stayed have not allowed us to check in till 2pm. This was great as we had been travelling overnight. the rooms were clean and big enough. A minor detail is that the carpets and tiles were starting to look dated. But as we were out all day sightseeing all you really need is a comfy clean room and bed. We also found that there was no problem with noise so slept really well. Did find that the cost of breakfast in hotel was a bit pricey so we did not use the restaurant. Fortunately there was an excellent coffee shop just outside of hotel. We found a great special online deal and would definatley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent, always a smile for us when we walked by. We couldn't ask for better service, the room was well presented, the beds were very comfortable, with a choice of pillows as well. The location was perfect for our visit, a couple of minutes walk to China Town and the markets and easy access to the Monorail and light rail. Definitely value for money and will be the first on my list for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: timmil Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: arrived off the red-eye from Perth; room was ready asap which helped to prepare for meetings that afternoon and next day; night manager very helpful; restaurant good quality, even better with accor card; all in all relatively good value for a Sydney hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight. Staff were all very helpful. We arrived early but the concierge took our bags for us and they were taken to our rooms when they became available. We were able to use the carpark immediately. Over all a great experience. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good venue in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In have stayed at tghis hotel many times when visiting Sydney and find the location very good, handy to the CBD, Central Railway and the enternatinment area. Staff are very helpful. It is pleasing that this is one of the few hotels inn Sydney that still offer smoking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay at the Mecure, George Street, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Mercure, George Street, before and found it very good then; indeed, our opinion has not changed. The hotel is central to railways and buses and there are always taxis at the front door. The Concierges are knowledgeable, helpful and provide assistance with a smile. Staff, overall, are excellent. When there is the occasional glitch, they respond quickly and with a minimum of fuss, never forgetting to thank we the customer for alerting them. The food in the restaurant has improved in quality and although the prices have increased, the fare is value for money. There needs to be a clear indication in the rooms as to when the restaurant is open for breakfast. We were not the only ones caught out on the morning of our departure. Other complaint is that there should be more than one chair in the room, although I must say it gave me the excuse to lie down on the very comfortable bed. We will be back again and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others; indeed, we have done so in the past and know of at least two people who stayed there on our recommendation and equally enjoyed their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We use this hotel often when traveling to Sydney. It is near Central station so is convenient to transport. On this last visit the restaurant menu has changed back to a more rounded choice. This suited us better than the previous fare. We have recommended this hotel to our friends and they have also appreciated the moderate tariff and overall quality of service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “sydney visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you for another great stay at The Mercure! It is convenient when I want to visit my daughter who lives very close in university housing. The concierge staff are always friendly and helpful. It is starting to feel like home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was very quiet, clean & roomy,we enjoyed dinner in the restaurant both nights and staff were polite & helpful. I also had cause to use the business center, which was very helpful as I'd forgotten to bring my laptop with me.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: dekkoz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: People at check in were courteous. We were given a high floor. Room was clean. The bed is on the firm side. Pillows on the soft side, though they do have a pillow menu. The hotel sign wasn't lit that night, and since I'd not been there before, the hotel wasn't as easy to find as it should've been.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly. I had a room at the back with a poor view, Expensive for what it is, as compared to other hotels. I booked and paid for a late check out only to find I was locked out of the room as their system failed to update the door lock!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Sydney is at a perfect location on George Street, with fast food and convenience stores close by, and Chinatown within walking distance. Rooms are good and clean. They even offer several types of pillows if desired. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean with enough room to move and everything that was needed. Staff was friendly and helpfull with good services. It was also very central to the conference I attended to and in close proximity of convenience stores, coffee shops and restaurants/takeaways. Will probably use again for further conferences myself and recommend to firrends and/or workcolegues.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Mecure Sydney in late Sept 2011. We booked with The Mecure because we had stayed their prevously with our family and the experience was fantastic .The room that was booked was part of a family package. The room was tiny with no room for the kids to spread out and colour their books that they had been given. After returning from dinner we all went to sleep but were soon awoken by extremely noisey neighbours, this noise continued until the early hours of the morning. Not great when you are travelling with 2 children under 7. Breakfast was included in the package but was disappointing also, terrible coffee and minimal choices. On check out we were not asked about our stay and when the staff member was told of our disappointments their response was that The Mecure was under new management. An extremely disappointing experience and we will not be staying there on any further trips to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in for a while”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Spacious and very well-maintained room with an excellent view. Service professional and unobtrusive. Also scored very well on the little things (decent-sized coffee mugs, plenty of coathangers, a good iron) that a lot of hotels skimp on.

Reviews.Title: “Our wonderful stay at the Mecure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mecure Sydney was wonderful with the rooms being of a very high standard in all aspects including the quality of sleep able to attain due to our request being accomodated for a room being on a level which would not be near the road. I must re-inforce the high quality of service provided as even when we left for our cruise we requested whether on our return we could leave our bags at the hotel as we would be returning early in the morning and not leaving for Adelaide until late afternoon. We were told that there would be no issue with leaving our bags and could collect them anytime even though we did not have a reservation. I will certainly be staying at the Mecure on any future trips to Sydney and will also highly recomment the Mecure to my freinds and relatives who might also be travelling to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliantly located right next to Central Station and all that Sydney has to offer. The rooms are not massive, but are functional and the beds are comfortable. The food is tasty and good value. Overall a hotel that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking rooms available.”
Reviews.Author: Animitra
Reviews.Content: Expensive option but if you are a smoker and you are in Australia, your options are limited. In spite of being a supposed 5 Star property, the whole place is tacky, the service is non-existent. Right next to Sydney Central station, it's very conveniently located for transport.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Mercure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The assistance, helpfulness and service from the reception and concierge desks was a highlight. Dinner at the Four Elements was great - again, wonderful service! Housekeeping quickly and efficiently responded to requests and the room was serviced at a time cionvenient to me. A most enjoyable stay - I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “day out”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff at front desk were great. Asscess around the hotel was easy ,rooms were clean and tidy. Nice cosy room But the matteress need to be updated they sage in the middle . All else was very pleasing

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 11 year old daughter for one night after seeing Mary Poppins. The check in and out was quick, the staff were very friendly without being over the top. The room was very comfortable and very clean, the beds were especially comfortable. We were on the 13th floor and the noise was minimal from the city below. I felt the breakfast buffet was good value and had a variety of foods to suit all tastes. Excellent location for China town, Darling Harbour and the Capitol Theatre and a quick trip on the monorail will get you to the other end of the city. The Hotel is close to a couple of 24 hour convenience stores if you want to pick up fresh milk for tea/coffee. My daughter had a swim in the pool which was clean and did not have an over powering chlorine smell. The parking cost $30 overnight and I was able to leave the car there after check out while we spent the day in the city. I felt this was a very reasonable price for city parking We had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Bigtones25 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was very dated with worn carpets and curtains, I expected more from Mecure. The pool was great indoor and heated on the roof. the bulk movie deal was good. Staff friendly enough. Breakfast was good and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Mercure stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the reception and the quality of the room and facilities. We stayed there as we were going to the State Theatre and we have found the facilities and service good in the past. WE have and would recommend the Mercure to friends and family. Being part of the ACCOR chain is important to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room too small”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great but room is too small for two double beds. Overall hotel was good. While internet worked well would be better if WiFi. Also had to pay for internet which in this day and age should be included in room charge.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel was fantastic. The only problem we had was that the service room on our floor was full of employees smoking with the door open so the whole area near the lifts and outside our room smelt awful (especially to non-smokers). I think if you are going to have floors which are smoking floors then you should inform your patrons when they book. We also thought that smoking indoors in a public place was illegal?

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel ... Perfect for a weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: ellefraser
Reviews.Content: I had some doubt about this hotel after reading other reviews but we were pleasantly surprised by our stay at the mercure Sydney. Yes the room was a little small but we were hardly in it. The free parking, free breakfast for 4 and free in house movies made up for that! I had a lot of trouble finding a hotel for my family of four - boys aged 6 and 9, and was relieved to do.d somewhere that welcomed us and our kids. The best part of our stay was when we came back from a big day a the zoo - we opted for dinner in the restaurant and as soon as we sat down our waiter arrived with textas and a colour in menu to occupy the kids ... They were quiet, we were happy and it summed up to us what the hotels priorities were. We have stayed in many places and I would recommend the Mercure Sydney to families .

Reviews.Title: “Great price for Sydney location and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Matthew K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the mercure Sydney for a week and really enjoyed our stay. We found the customer service exceptional. The room was clean and spacious and the hotel was well located for everything ( a short stroll to darling harbour, next to central station and a bus stop out front). The food at the restaurant was also good, but make sure you also check out the restaurants around the area

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very handy location and it was easy to organise parking. Our room was located near the lifts so was rather noisy at times. We were able to borrow a phone charger from reception, but initially were given one that was unable to be plugged in so had to go back a second time.

Reviews.Title: “overall of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Bad reception on TV and foxtel location was excellent bathroom needs up dating paint peeling off the doors. service was very good. food was not good would not recommend the breakfast or dinner their

Reviews.Title: “sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i just wanted to mention sheun form concierge helped us charge our battery when our car would not start and was extremely helpful please pass on a huge thank you. otherwise the beds were very small an uncomfortable for two. and the toilet leaked and was quite loud. but for the money it was ok. prob would not stay again due to being harassed by people at bus stops for money constantly on way in out of hotel. not good around my child.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When travelling overseas or interstate we always use Mecure as it so close to Central railway station where you can catch the train to Airport every 15min so convenient. Also they take bookings for the Airport bus which is also convenient if you don't want to drag your baggage on & off the train. Not much difference in price. The hotel even though very busy is always very quiet, we always have a good night sleep and the beds are very comfortable.The staff are very approachable & friendly which is a relief when you arive frazzled from a long flight. The menu in their dining room has just been upgraded (about time) and has a menu to suit everyone.Our steaks were cooked to perfection and service was A1. We will definately be staying here again! The hotel is centrally located so if you have time to kill it is not far from China Town & Darling Harbour. If you want to explore the city or travel down to Circular Quay ,buses just across the road ,ask the conceirge & he will give directions.

Reviews.Title: “decor / bathroom was a little dated, but location and service made up for it”
Reviews.Author: priyarskumar84
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the mercure sydney for 3 days 2 nights. with the exception of the dated decor (the bathroom looked and was a little old.. faucets were a little rusty, and it generally looked like it had 'yellowed' and aged) i can't say i can find fault with the place. the location is great - a short 5 - 10 min walk from Central station. lots of little cafes and shopping nearby and the staff was amazing. they helped me with tracking down wine i had tried in Aria, and they were so cheery and accommodating. i didn't try the restaurant or the breakfast though, so i can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: for the type of room we booked to also accommodate a child we expected a larger room because it was too cramped .we have stayed there many times before just 2 of us and have had larger rooms disapointing !

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband,daughters aged 8 and 11 and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Mercure.Beds were comfy rooms clean and everything was we wanted to see/visit was close by. The concierge was extremely helpful with directions and public transport schedules.All staff pleasant and helpful..would recommend to all and would stay there again.Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dining”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Dining room service was poor because of lack of service, the restaurant was not busy but if took twenty minutes for any table attention and a further twenty five minutes for drinks to arrive at the table, in this period of time staff including the Restaurant Manager was attending to minor empty table set ups, glasses, etc I could not recomment this Restaurant under current management.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and we had a pleasant time. The only problem was the service in the resturant as we had to keep on asking for things ie menu, where our drinks were and desert menu. The rooms were clean. There were no towels in the pool room. But overall the hotel and their staff were very helpful and my kids loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in Mercure Sydney with my sister and his 8 yr old son because the hotel is very close to Central Train Station. They travel back home to Armidale the next day after a good sleep and a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: michele8040 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was great the beds really comfortable. Transport at the door step. Can't hear any noise from your room. The whole place was very clean and had friendly staff. Couldn't ask for more. Didn't eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on that but there are lots of eating places close by.

Reviews.Title: “Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: quite happy with the over all service, would recommended to anyone looking for a hotel. Thank-you!!! . . //////

Reviews.Title: “mercure Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room is large enough for 2 pers , but we are Three , it's still ok . the location is the best tip for this hotel , near train station and many bus stop . service is good , airport shuttle is available . We ' re very pease with our trip in Sydney .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay and the staff are friendly. There is a short walk to Central Station and then the buses, trains or tour companies can take you anywhere. Only one complaint. As with hotels, the rooms could be better insulated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Capital Theatre”
Reviews.Author: lookingnorth
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if planning trip to Capital Theatre and Chinatown. Plenty of things to see and do in close walking distance. We saw Mary Poppins, which is an excellent show. Stayed 3 nights, 2 adults and 15 year-old daughter. Beds and pillows excellent, clean quiet room, we were on 8th floor facing down George St. Plenty of cheap eating places nearby, wells served with taxis, buses and trains. Central Station is next door. Catch free bus 555 which goes up George St to Circular Quay

Reviews.Title: “Would try somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: journeyManBallarat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night. Location is good, being close to central station etc and it had good cheap food available nearby. The room looked and felt a bit tired. The bathroom was small but adequate. The bar opposite reception was good. The price appeared high for what was offered however I am not used to Sydney accomodation prices. Would I chose to stay there again, think not, no value for money.

Reviews.Title: “g'day mate”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great staff. dining room menu lacked variety your website is difficult to find and use. this is high lighted by the fact it is difficult to get beyond this stage of the review, what the hell else do you want.? make the system user friendly or else people will simply go to another hotel & system. you probably don't read these anyway!

Reviews.Title: “excellent position”
Reviews.Author: 327jaydee Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in was very positive and prompt. We were upgraded to a superior room, which was appreciated, however, we needed to arrange extra bedding for the children. Our request was responded to courtesly and quickly. The room was spotlessly clean, bed comfortable and the little extras provided appreciated e.g. coffee machine, bath robe.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For an outer CBD hotel in a central location this is quite expensive wher ethat rate jumps between Thursday & Friday nights. The room service was fast & efficient. The breakfast was OK and busy. I would not stay here on a business trip. The reception staff & concierge were attentive & friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Club priority under delivered”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived for two night stay for pre-paid room to find that booked room was only available as a smoking room when non-smoking was specified. This was after a 20 minute wait on the A Club priority check in queue. The staff member commenced check in and then answered the phone while I waited even longer. No apology for interrupting already delayed check in. As an A Club member I was asked which newspaper I would like delivered each morning. Newspaper did not turn up day #1 and after mentioning this to reception the newspaper was not delivered again on day #2. The room was not well sound proofed from either inside the hotel or from outside noise. I was left completed unimpressed by the poor standard and lack of attentive service at his hotel. Staying in Sydney again in the same area in coming weeks but will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT customer-service oriented”
Reviews.Author: Kelbykamir
Reviews.Content: I am finishing up a 2 night stay at the Mercure as I write this review. This hotel is not customer service-oriented at all. I had so many problems that when I spoke to the manager on one of my routine trips to the front desk to have yet another issue handled, he had a long list of excuses for me but little sympathy for everything that had gone wrong. Be aware; -the room service food is particulary bad, and they messed my order up by sending a side salad instead of full Greek salad. When I called to complain, they told me the best thing they could was send up a bowl with the Greek salad items in it, for me to combine with the side salad they had mistakenly sent me. -my room was cleaned, although i had hung up the "do not disturb" sign -when i complained that i was getting a headache from using a computer in their business center that did not have lighting, hotel staff were hesitant to give me a code to use another computer, telling me that "no one else has ever complained about that." -this hotel does not have wireless in the rooms. if you buy a pass for their business center, be aware that the pass code is only good on one computer. if you buy a 24 hour pass code and return to the business center to find someone using the computer you were on, YOU will have to go down to the lobby and get a new pass code, and you will only be given 1 hour pass codes. -you will need a special card to access the drink machines on each level, but the hotel staff won't bother to give you one when you check in. I was told this is because some people don't pay be credit cards, even though I had. -when I complained that my room key didn't work, the hotel manager told me that he didn't want to say it was my fault, but that the strips can get demagnitized. I told him I am used to staying in hotels, I know how keys work and it wasn't my fault, because I hadn't put the key anywhere near my other cards or any magnetic devices. At which point he acknowledged that the keys often don't work. The hotel has had a lot of opportunities to improve my stay over the past 2 days but instead it's been one problem after another and I can't wait to be gone. The only thing I liked about this hotel was the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to sydney by train to see mary poppins, the mercure isin walking distance to trains ,shops pretty much everything .Service at the hotel was great my 2 girls loved that you could order pillows, would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the third year in a row that I have stayed at the Mercure with my granddaughter. I have always found the service to be first rate. The rooms have always been ready before the normal check-in time. Rooms serviced daily with care and everything left in excellent order. We have breakfast in the restuarant on the first floor and the staff are always happy to cater for something extra which is good when travelling with a child. The staff are all happy to help with giving directions or anything you need. The advantage of the Mercure is the closeness to Central Station and the trains and trams.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My visits to Sydney require much access to local transport, which determined the location of my stay. Mercure is by far the best of the Railway Square precinct hotels I have used. The room, while small, was comfortable, clean and well serviced. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The high point was breakfast in the restaurant, where plentiful good food and great staff made for a good start to my busy days.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Brilliant spot, friendly staff, clean room and all at a great price what more could you want! The only bad bit was the view was a bit ordinary but I don't travel to look out a hotel room so who cares :)

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Lovely Service”
Reviews.Author: PrinkleCookie
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Hotel is conveniently located near the Central Railway Station of Sydney (4-7 minutes walk). There is also a free bus station (Route 555 around 5 minutes walk) near the hotel that can take you around Sydneyâ€™s CBD area so my wife and I were able to go explore the city easily and cheaply. I would say I like their concierge since they were very accommodating in answering our inquiries on how to go around Sydney. Though there was this one time they told us we couldnâ€™t ride the ferry at Darling Harbor to a specific location but after insisting you can, they checked the internet and they were able to tell us that you can ride the ferry at Darling Harbor and the schedule. The room, my wife requested if we could get a city side view room since it was our honeymoon and that we would like to have a nice view of the city. This was technically an upgrade and happy to say it was approved. The room and the toilet were generally clean, not too spacious but Iâ€™ve been to hotels with smaller rooms. Overall it was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Central to all transport”
Reviews.Author: FozzieAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Mercure is a good average hotel- probably 3 1/2 star rating. Our room was clean but needed a refurbishment re painting and furniture. The room on the 8th floor was quiet and looked west along the main road called Broadway. This hotel is about 1 km (15minutes walk) to the C.B.D. of Sydney ie Pitt St Mall. The hotel is extremely handy to all forms of transport- Central Rail station and buses, plus Airport Shuttle for about $16. The Mercure is within walking distance to China Town and the Darling Harbour precinct. Car parking is available on site for $25 a day. I choose to stay at this hotel on trips to Sydney due to location and convenience to all forms of transport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Turkeyjay
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Sydney is located next to Central railway station. A one-way train fare to the airport is $15 and a taxi from the domestic airport cost $26. Its location is a comfortable walking distance to Paddyâ€™s Markets, China Town and Darling Harbour. Arrived at the hotel an hour and a half before check-in but was given a room straight away which was greatly appreciated. The room was small but comfortable with a bed with pillow menu, small desk with chair, safe, small fridge, tea/coffee making facilities, iron & ironing board and a decent-sized flatscreen TV. The bathroom had a tired, outdated feel to it with a bath/shower combination and a hairdryer. The fridge in the room was empty so handy to put your own items in. The mini bar is instead located on each floor as a â€œSmartBarâ€� vending machine that needs a separate card available from reception to operate it, with items then charged to your room account. Internet costs $10 per hour or $22 per day. Parking is available in the basement for an additional cost. The hotel was quite happy to hold baggage for several hours after check-out. Overall this hotel offers good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Comfy Beds, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: voxypop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mecure Hotel under a group tour to Sydney for two nights and it was a great stay. Not sure which type of room it was but it was two double beds which was more than enough for my friend and I. One of the lights flickered we were quite spooked but only to be reassured by my friend's father who said that it's an old bulb which just needed to be changed. We called for someone to change the bulb, took the guy about 10 mins to reach our room to figure out what happened. He examined the bulb and said he will change it (which required him to go fetch the bulb) so we waited for him another 10 mins. When he came back, he tried to fix it and realised that it was the wrong bulb. So we had NO choice but to wait for him to come back with a new bulb. Finally he came back with the right bulb and also took some time to fix it. All in all, despite getting a new bulb, his way of solving this minor issue kinda bugged me that he took his own sweet time when two girls were already spooked by the lightbulb. But other than this, the rooms were great, breakfast spread was great too; the location is pretty good too; very near to the Central station and within 15 mins walk to Paddy's Market and Chinatown. We wanted to visit the DFO outlets which was quite outskirts of the city area but the Market City is a good alternative! Market City is located above Paddy's Market with outlets like Supre, Jay Jay's and many more (okay, I only remembered those two as we spent our whole day digging through the clearance section at just those two shops :P) Overall, I would love to go back to stay at Mecure again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in handy location. Perfect first night in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: shabangle23
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as our first night in Sydney. We were staying in an apartment for the rest of our time but decided that jetlag needed to be beaten with a hotel doing everything for us to start with! The location of the hotel is great, right by the main station. The taxi from the airport was relatively cheap because we weren't having to drive through central Sydney (much cheaper to get a taxi than a train or bus weirdly!). Check in was great even though we were a few hours early they let us into the room straight away and upgraded us. Close to Darling Harbour and the CBD. The pool was great first thing in the morning and not at all busy. The bar downstairs has a good happy hour as well. We didn't stay for breakfast as it seemed quite expensive so we opted for a coffee shop over the road which was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good start to holiday in Australia”
Reviews.Author: frecka
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel for a 5 day stay in Sydney the beginning of a much anticipated 3.5 week trip to OZ. It was excellent, the location firstly is ideal right beside Central & across the rd from a range of convenience stores & sandwich outlets. We ate in the hotel restaurant 1 night & the food was really enjoyable & nice range of wines to compliment. The staff can make or break a hotel & the staff here were excellent in particular the Concierge Adam who was extremely patient, attentive & professional. I used the pool once it is on the small side but perfectly useable. We didn't have breakfast as part of our deal & a good tip is to go across to the youth hostel - I think it's called bite, bar& bed or something like that as they do a lovely cheap& friendly service. It's an interesting walk down George Street & if you don't fancy walking home any bus from the B bus shelter in the quay will take you outside the hotel another good tip is to buy a book of prepaid tickets as many of the buses are prepay. My 1 gripe is the lack of free Internet; travelling in Europe America you come to expect access to free wifi I was disappointed that there was none in this hotel. Most enjoyable all round.

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED OUR STAY AT THE MECURE GRAND CENTRAL”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Both my wifeand I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was very clean and we enjoyed the view of Sydney and of the Central area. We both thorougly enjoyed the dining room and our meal was first class. All the staff whom we met at check in and check out were very helpful. We will definitely be staying there again. The hotel is situated in a very handy location for shopping and immediate access to the Central Station and China town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent price, only problem is internet (price+speed)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What I like: Nice and comfortable hotel for a decent price. Location is great, plenty of bus lines right outside the building to go to the main areas of Sydney. What I didn't like: One can hear people in the corridor, but the hotel being big, corridors are usually empty. Main issue I had was the price of the internet connection. The proposed plans are such that you *have to* take the 24h deal which costs 22 dollars. This is way too much, in particular since they advertise a "high-speed" connection via ethernet inside the room, and this is nothing like high-speed at all. I quickly gave up my efforts to work remotely while being in my room. Skype works just fine but the video quality isn't very good (and Skype usually doesn't need such a good connection to have a decent video...)

Reviews.Title: “Mercer Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location , parked the car for three days and didn't have to use it,just walked and used public transport.staff were so helpful and professional hotel was clean and tidy. Thank you for a enjoyable stay"....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, rooms very nice, view from room was a pleasent supprise all in all bloody brillant!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetas340
Reviews.Content: Arrived in sydney, to an excellent hotel, brilliant veiws, clean rooms and awsome location! the only problem we had is that it took 30mins to get a coffee, but the employee looked like he was training, so we understood and did not complain... All in all very good stay thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Mercure Sydney. The location was perfect as it was central to many of the sights we wanted to see. In addition the staff were friendly, helpful and very professional. We would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to visiting Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The keys to the room were not working. Went back to the receptions and they issued another key, and send a staff with me to open the room and the keys did not work again.
