So the staff opened the door with his master key and let me in. He also told me fix the key when you are down at the reception next. Then went down again to fix the key up, and lucky enough it worked the third time. But this took at least 30 minutes of my valuable time. There is room for improvement to this problem/approach etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Hayley_19_1-
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! i stayed here with my partner and after a long flight delay, the reception staff were very accommodating. They rushed to the door to grab our luggage and made sure we were comfortable from the moment we stepped in. This will definetly be our first choice when we return to Sydney. The pool was lovely with a great view and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Couldn't make one complaint.

Reviews.Title: “A standard, average, corporate hotel with no exciting features”
Reviews.Author: nesbitevans
Reviews.Content: I came here for a 2 day committee meeting held at the hotel and so stayed overnight. The hotel is situated next to the railway station so convenient but considering everything else Sydney has to offer, it's not exactly in the best part of town. The concierge staff were friendly but the reception staff somewhat inattentive and disinterested. The room was OK - quite small with no view but it had everything I needed and the bathroom and toiletries were good. The TV did not work and this must be common as there was a note saying to contact the front desk for a repairman. This proved somewhat tiresome as it took an age for him to come and then he spent ages trying to get it to work. I almost wish I hadn't bothered and just managed without the TV. My room was quite near the lift which "pinged" all night long leading to a poor night's sleep (and I usually sleep like a log). Perhaps the worst thing about this hotel, and the thing that drags down its rating, is its food. It is truly terrible. As part of our committee meeting package, we were entitled to a buffet lunch both days and breakfast. The lunches were dismal - terrible greasy food, plastic desserts, motorway service station cending machine coffee and to add insult to injury, it ran out really early and was not topped up so on the second day we ate almost no lunch. The breakfast was a little better but only just. On the other hand, the committee meeting rooms were good with all mod cons but quite pricey with every little thing being charged for. So, in summary - a mixed bag. I understand the rooms were quite cheap with the committee room package so if this is your main priority, this hotel is not a bad choice, but it's certainly not up there with Sydney's glittering best

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the reception, porter and concierge staff. They were so helpful. We had an early booking-in due to travel from another state and commitments and there were no problems, very helpful staff upon arrival and departure with our bags. Good location close to the railway station, tower restaurant and Paddys markets.

Reviews.Title: “The Pillows”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I know that there is a pillow menu at the Hotel, which we unfortunately did not take advantage of. The pillows supplied on the bed were terrible - flat and lumpy. Apart from that I have absolutely no problems with Mercure

Reviews.Title: “Mercure great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have frequently stayed at the Mercure on George Street Sydney. But we did ask for a non smoking floor and there was someone defintely smoking. Our shower was not clean. They are in a great location easy to get transport or walk anywhere. But they need to lift their game.

Reviews.Title: “stopover”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent/outstanding service. We always use this motel when traveling to and from the airport. They cannot do enough to assist and help us.Very comfortable beds and facilities, clean room, convenient location. Morning newspaper to read over coffee is a definite bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MIN4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure for 4 nights. The two queensized beds were of good quality as were the pillows. Only a footstep out of the hotel is Central Station were most busses are stopping and going into all directions. Walking down George Street you can't miss China Town, QVB or Circulay Quay. During our stay we couldn't complain about noise. Traffic noise was blanked out through excellent isolation, just the last night we had some neighbours next door which you could hear a bit. The only negative point to mention would be the bathroom as it was outdated and a bit shabby. Grouting was discoloured and some dust. We would have prefered a proper shower instead of a bath tub with showerhead. Nevertheless the water had high pressure and was hot. Staff was very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Myrtus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when overnighting in Sydney because there was a great special rate on Expedia Staff were very pleasant, room was great. Overlooking Railway Square but surprisingly quiet. Biggest surprise was the Airport shuttle - it was cheaper than taking the train (not sure why they don't advertise this) and much more convenient. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: ingrid08_11 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Small but clean and comfortable room. Confusion with restaurant bill that has not been sorted nearly a week later. Close to Entertainment centre, walking distance, and trains. We parked the car and did not need it again until we left. Good value for money as a weekend package with some extras.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: RinaBuderim Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Mercure, it is a great location with the bus or train at the front of the hotel. Our room was very comfortable with two double beds and good seize bathroom. Buffet breakfast was excellent with a great variety. We also enjoyed dinner at the hotel with the different tasting plates. overall an fantastic stay, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for public transport.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is great for public transport and easy walkling to Darling Habour. We were meet at the door and helped with our bag, the service made us feel welcome. Bed was good. We would stay again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: stef0363
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mercure Sydney last month. The location is good however lots of hotels are much closer from Darling Harbour, the Opera House and Hyde Park. At first we were not allocated to the room we had booked but when we mentioned it to the receptionist she complimentary upgraded her to another room. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel at an unbeatable location: close to Central Station, city centre and many tourist attractions. I stayed in a nice room on 13th floor. I agree with some other reviews, the bathrooms would benefit from a make-over and certanly from better ventilation. However, all facillities were very clean. All staff have been very polite and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be staying again”
Reviews.Author: 2011Marg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mecure for four nights and I would not recommend this hotel and will not be staying again. I think all staff, including Management, could benefit from â€˜customer serviceâ€™, â€˜communicationâ€™ and â€˜problem solvingâ€™ training. I checked in late after a flight from Perth and found that the bathroom smelt strongly of urine. In the morning I reported this to reception and some hours later when I returned to my room, housekeeping was just finishing off. I asked what had been done about the smell and she proceeded to get a spray bottle and spray some room deodorizer around. On the way out, I again let reception know that the smell was there and they said they would get â€˜maintenanceâ€™ to have a look. Upon return to the hotel, no one could account for whether maintenance had been to my room. Later, when I let the water out the bath, it bubbled up into the basin. I called reception and asked for the Manager to come to my room to see and smell the situation for his/her self and a few minutes later a maintenance person showed up. I again called and asked for the Manager. An Assistant Manager showed up and said there was little he could do. I stated that I would be checking out if he didnâ€™t find me another room. I was moved two floors down to the noisy front of the hotel. The room was fine except there was no bedside lamp. I left a note at reception â€“ but no lamp was forthcoming. I completed a card to request a customer survey be sent to me by email and this has not arrived. Upon checkout, I asked that the Manager contact me and this hasnâ€™t happened either. I can only conclude that Management actually does not want to know about the issues at this hotel. Internet charges are exorbitant at $10 per day and some floors are smoking floors, best avoided. On the brighter side, the hotel is in a good (but noisy) location near central train station, and has a wonderful concierge team who are helpful, professional and friendly. In fact, maybe they could manage the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for purpose, could do with some improvements”
Reviews.Author: SarDav
Reviews.Content: Check in was excellent and room was ready 1.5 hours before standard check in time. It was fast and efficient. Provided with room 627. Inital view of room was good. Great size with 2 x double sized beds with a desk and ample space to walk around. Bathroom was a good size, if a little dated. Bathroom had odour that was not pleasant and there was no exhaust fan. Happy to have the door shut and did not enjoy going in there at all. Dined at the restaurant that night, the menu was limited and the pricing was average. I ordered a steak that was particularly average and whilst it was on the specials menu I later discovered the identical dish on the room service menu and for a cheaper price! My son had a toasted sandwich from the kids menu which was great. The room service menu was far more comprehensive and better priced than the restaurant and the service (we later ordered dessert in room) was excellent. The bed was comfortable, however was prone to moving around as it was not fixed to the bedhead and is on wheels and in the morning I discovered a bloodstain on the quilt that was not mine! There was a pillow menu that we did not use and the provided pillows were more than adequate. Very disappointed that there is no mini bar, and that the smart bar concept was not mentioned at check in and so it was not until we were wanting a drink later on that we realised we did not have the correct type of card to use the service and would have to go down to reception to have it organised. It ended up just as easy to go to the convenience store next door and purchase supplies! The rooms are not very quiet. We could hear noise on both sides of the room and the sound of other room doors slamming shut was quite noisy inside. The sound of talking in the hallway was quite loud and we were disturbed well into the night. We had an interconnecting door with the next room and as a consequence could hear noise from that room quite well also. The buffet breakfast the next morning was fantastic. The offering was very good and we left very satisfied. The conceriege who attended knew everything we asked about and took a great deal of time printing out timetables and highlighting maps for us. I could not have asked for a better service. All staff that we came across were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Convenient Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location to stay and move around Sydney as it is near Central Station and main bus routes. It is also surrounded by many food outlets. The hotel staff are helpful and courteous.Convenient location to stay for both tourists and those on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ILoveDownunder
Reviews.Content: Everybody there from front desk (we got an upgrade!), housekeeping, restaurant, concierge to gift shop was very friendly and helpful. We liked having cab and bus handy and of course it was also walking distance to lots of places. Not fancy, but clean, nice and very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “thankyou”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i have always enjoyed my stays at mercure, the staff are always friendly and helpful. rooms are always immaculate and i love the location i also find the prices quite reasonable, being a single parent it is especially good value when i can get the room for about $150 thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Room needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I'm quite happy with the service and location of your hotel and parking is good, but there is lacking of sound proof between rooms and the facilities are farely old, some renovation will needed for the rooms. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Mecure stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the bed quite comfortable. The bathroom was a bit dated and I think for the money paid for the room there should be more than a shower over a bath with a shower curtain. Overall would stay there again providing we could get a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in relation to buses and trains enabling easy access to theatres, tourist attraction, shopping and ferries if you don't wish to walk. The staff were very pleasant, rooms quite good and the meals excellent. We will definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Zmith
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the same time as a large coach party. Despite this check-in was relatively quick and very friendly. Was booked in a Standard Room, but given complimentary upgrade to a Privilege Room so as to avoid the noisy coach party. Room large and very quiet, very comfy bed, excellent range of television channels. Decent sized bathroom, only let down by a relatively low shower head, so if you are above 6foot tall you may struggle to stand up straight under the shower. Canâ€™t comment on the food, although the bar was quite pricey and very busy. Convenient location, much cheaper than some similar hotels around World Square. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay experienced at the Mercure Sydney was very enjoyable. The staff were very helpful and their positive attitude was very encouraging. The location is very good and within close proximity to Central Station. A very enjoyable stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: INDIA2010TRIP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure hotel in August 2011 on our first stop in Australia. We booked this hotel based on the pictures displayed on the website/Tripadvisor photos and the location we thought was good. We took the train from the airport which drops you off at central station next door to the hotel which is very convenient. The hotel itself is in a good location if you are planning to stay anywhere in Chinatown. For us, we went to Sydney to see the CBD and harbour front attractionsm. We found the location to be a bit far from the main tourist area as Sydney is a massive city. Even if you decide to take the metro throughout the city, it doesnâ€™t have as many stops as other major cities so there is still a lot of trekking involved and with your hotel located north far from the major attractions, this can mean a lot of walking. The hotel staff was very friendly upon arrival and took our bags until the room was ready as we arrived early. There are many places to eat nearby as there seems to be a large number of backpackers that congregate in this area. The room had a very nice view of the main street and was very bright and spacious. The only poor aspect was how incorrect the pictures were when portraying the hotel. I am one who never judges a hotel on its personal website pictures but after looking at some of the Tripadvisor personal photos, I was still a little disappointed. The room was very clean and came with all of the amenities required for a standard hotel. The room was a little noisy at night as you can hear people in the surrounding rooms as the building may be a bit older. The pool was located near the top of the building with amazing views but again was a bit over done on the website. Not that it was dirty or unclean for swimming, it was just a little outdated and could do with a new paint job. The bus to Bondi is located outside the front door along with the train to Blue Mountains which is very convenient. There is also a bar downstairs with a very reasonably priced happy hour which is a welcome site for this very expensive city. Overall this is a standard, clean and friendly hotel but in a poor location if you are looking to walk around Sydney for a few days as it can become very tiring doing the 20-30 minute walk to the harbour front each morning. Itâ€™s close to the airport and all out of town attractions so the Mercure is a hotel with a lot of positive aspects but its location to the harbour front is its major drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney is the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in the heart of the City, easy access to transportation, courteous and friendly staff. Most of all very knowledgable. Household staff were very organized and the hotel was kid friendly! Your staff have done very well in promoting your tourism. Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Thank You”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, had a few issues when we arrived in our room but they were very quickly sorted. The concierge were fantastic, so so helpful. They had great knowledge of the area which was great. It is a great location for public transport & also into the city too

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel I dont want to tell anyone about”
Reviews.Author: R0bertstewart Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite Sydney hotel other than the Mercure Airport. Why? Because it is so centrally located and it has easily ccesible parking. Not flas, but good basic amenities. Usually good value and an easy destination at the end of a hard days work in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Girls' weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mercure Sydney is in a great location at the top of the very diverse, busy, action packed George Street. It was an excellent walk from the hotel right down to the harbour. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. It was a great place to stay for a girls' weekend but would also go back there with my husband and kids. Good value for an inner city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: barp_m
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were travelling round Australia and when 2 young people, after a 22 hour flight looking like hell with enormous backpacks on our backs, were expecting to get noses turned up at us, we received nothing short of excellent, professional, impartial service. The room was lovely - 8th floor, couldn't hear the road, thick "block-out" curtains. The bathroom was simple but great shower and bath. The gym was OK and sauna was great, once it was working - went down to Concierge - very helpful, efficient, wanting to solve it asap - it was! Fantastic location being very close to Central station and various morning food establishments, and just over 30 minute walk to Circular Quay, or 4 minute walk to the free bus stop. My only downers are really that the gym was sometimes not up to scratch (i.e. people messing up the weight machines - not reporting it - so perhaps not excellently maintained). The other is, unless you have a laptop, no wi-fi and PC suite internet time is not complementary - however, free wi-fi spots are available in surrounding establishments. Excellent treatment - very comfortable - great location - for Sydney, multiple nights = good value 4/5

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly Accomodation - great staff and willing to help A+”
Reviews.Author: Luke C
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 1-2nd Aug and the experience was so good we booked an extra night on return through Sydney on the 8th. We have a 18mth old and they couldn't have been more helpful. Set up a cot for no charge. We forgot both mobile chargers and they lent us one each no problems. Our return booking was very last minute and as a result the cot wasn't set up (and took a while to do so) and the room wasn't ready. They upgraded us and gave us a free breakfast! The breakfast was fantastic- fresh, tasty and great range. I would recommend this for anyone with kids who doesn't want to walk too far from the train station with heavy luggage! A+++

Reviews.Title: “Happy guest”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the Mecure Sydney ideal for my purposes. It is so convenient to central railway station. The room was clean and large. The bed lovely. The staff very obliging. Even though the motel is on some busy roads it was quiet so we were able to sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure on George St”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well situated on George St. Just a stones throw form access to Central station. The hotel is clean and well provisioned. The staff were courtious and my romm was cleaned well for the two days I was there. I woul recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hits and misses”
Reviews.Author: KevinChong
Reviews.Content: Hits - Very good location, as the hotel is near paddy market and is very accessible to different types of public transport. Further, one of the reception staff, Natalie Souza was very helpful to our room request, and has very a pleasent personality as well. Hotel has good security during the night, as only guest with hotel card can gain access into the hotel. Misses - The tap in the sink could not be switch off tightly. Therefore water was always dripping during our entire stay. The hotel chambermaids etc should have saw it and reflect it to the necessary people to get it fix, as otherwise, it is a waste of water. Further, I don't understand why the chambermaids consistently gave us only a single towel when there are two guests staying in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well-placed hotel. Easy walk to all the attractions, but with buses and trains at the doorstep, Concierges were most helpful. Rooms clean, bed comfortable. Excellent spot if you need to get to USYD, UTS or TAFE. Hotel restaurant meal prices were great.

Reviews.Title: “great location for central station”
Reviews.Author: loveegypt Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for purpose of travelling by train and the location was excellent. The car parking was tight in some spots , but got around fine. On arriving in room, we found it pretty small in comparison to other hotels, but for one night it was fine. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: VandR430 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely room. We were lucky to book early at a discount price. Larger room than we've had before at Mercure, and very spacious and comfortable. LOVED the "extra" feather pillows as I dislike the usual hard pillows in hotels. Only "complaint" was that we phoned reception that night and again next morning to request a morning newspaper which was nvever delivered (or someone else took it!) and had to go down to the concierge to get it ourselves. Very pleasant staff, and very helpful. We have previously recommended this hotel to family and friends and will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in general except bar access for family with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite good, room are clean except the a bit dusty from air conditioning system. Breakfast buffet is great. The only problem when staying with a family with teenagers (or Children) You can't stay in the bar to get beverages because there are slot machines in !!! Only way to get a drink in family in the hotel is outside on the terrace in winter ! That's not well thought...

Reviews.Title: “Staff went the extra mile!”
Reviews.Author: businesstrav255100
Reviews.Content: From the booking process well before the date of arrival to the check-out, staff were most helpful and courteous. The room was very clean. The environmental care was followed through on regarding linen (something I have often found not to be the case in other places). But over and above all this, important as it is, was the extra mile that relevant staff went to in response to my business needs. I had a significant request to make that was way outside the normal expectation, but the head of the relevant team (the concierge) did not make a big deal of it and just extended the assistance of the hotel to respond to my need. (This was discussed and arranged before my arrival.) Upon my check-in I noted that the head of that team was off duty at the time and thus I was concerned I may have difficulty with what I was needing. But, to my amazement, the other staff were ready for me and this assistance continued with warmth and enthusiasm throughout my stay. I will most certainly use this hotel in the future! While breakfasts were not cheap, they were thoroughly enjoyable with lost of choice and of the highest quality - and, again, the staff most warm and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: I was so angry with the way I was treated by the manager on duty upon my arrival that I decided to check out the next morning and stay at alternative accomodation. I was initially denied a room after a long plane trip. Then I was humiliated, because I was rightfully angry, and fored to sit down for ten minutes before this man would serve me again. The concierge and other staff were helpful, in organising another room ,when the TV wasn't working in the room I was finally allocated. Also there was no yellow pages in room, and the shower was awkward to use, and the half flush on the toilet wouldn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to the theatre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms a little narrow but very comfortable. Stepping into the bath for a shower can be a bit hazardous for those of us who are 90. The kids had a great time in the pool. We booked two rooms. We were very comfortable for our one night stay to go to the theatre near by.

Reviews.Title: “Good One”
Reviews.Author: Honeypie78
Reviews.Content: Room was small but they got great location, close by just by walking distance. They don't provide free Internet but you can just cross to the Mc Donald to have free Internet wifi connection. Breakfast was ok, they don't have big place when together with one big group no more space.

Reviews.Title: “Lack lustre attempt of a hotel and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner. We were staying here because we had a concert to go to. We arrived at the hotel and I checked in. We then drove the car to the car park and parked the car. Parking was priced at a special deal of $15. We were given a room on the 12th floor, which at the time seemed exciting. When the lifts opened to the floor I was a tad shocked. The walls were painted in patches and the hallway was dark. It looked cheap! Definitely not we had imagined of an alleged redeveloped hotel. We arrived at our hotel room. The room looked clean and spacious. The room had a flat screen television and a view of railway square. The room was pretty quiet too. I then noticed a letter on the desk, it said that there was going to painting done of some of the floors. I was quite concerned because I am an asthmatic and the paint fumes may make me sick. A staff member arrived at our room to deliver our bottle of wine, I asked her if they will be painting on our floor today, and she said no. We then left our room for a few hours and returned, it seemed that our level was painted because the patches of paint were no longer present on the walls. Luckily there was no paint fumes. I felt quite irritated for the fact that the staff member who checked us, did not tell us about the painting! We also noticed at several instances on level 12 where we stayed, there were stenches of cigarette smoke. I called and inquired with reception and they advised me that level 10 and 11 were smoking levels. What made it worse, was that level 11 and 12 had this gap between the levels, like a large hole so the fumes could travel easily to the next level. We once again found this quite irritating, because this was not told to us when we checked in. The room itself was clean, bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The only minus of the bathroom was the shower curtain, which seemed a tad dirty on the ends of the shower curtain. The hotel itself is closely situated near Railway Square, which is handy for catching buses and trains. The car parking spaces are quite narrow and quite often you would see people parking in two spaces! Upon check out we told the reception male staff member about the smoke fumes problem and he apologised and he said he would investigate it with management. He then offered us complimentary parking, which a nice gesture. We then got into our car and drove to the exiting gates of the car park. We placed the ticket in the machine and it said we have to pay $30. We were shocked, because we were told we were given complimentary parking! My partner pressed the intercom button and spoke to reception and explained the situation. The lady at reception hung up on us. Nothing happened for a few minutes, so I pressed the intercom again and explained the situation and she huffed and then the gates opened! In summary, I was not entirely happy with this hotel. Whilst the positioning was convenient, I was not happy with the customer service and the lack of communication. I find it quite weird that a hotel would have 2 smoking floors mid level in a hotel or decide to paint the hallways and not notify customers before or during the check in process.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever.”
Reviews.Author: LesleyDG Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had the best stay at the Mercure Sydney for a weekend prior to a trip overseas. My friend and I went to see two shows, the hotel was conveniently located for the theatres and for the airport. The staff were without fault, friendly and helpful, even when I had to change my airport shuttle three times due to a delayed flight. Nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely stay here again. it was also the best value stay I have had in Sydney and conveniently located for most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: geeijo
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent - only a short walk from central station We ate a very nice dinner at the restaurant and were impressed by the effort made to present affordable good quality wines. Room was good standard - we had two double beds. Shower head was water saver with the pin needle spray that is really not good - only complaint about the place and the reason for a very good and not an excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable time staying at the Mercure Sydney. Would love to stay again, beautiful room, dining room, service and cleanliness are all very well shown. Thank you. Couldn't have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was neat and tidy and view was spectacular from the top floor.Location was perfect as we relied on public transport to get around.All staff were friendly and very helpful.The dining room was convienient and meals were delish.Weill be sure to book again on our next visit.Thankyou for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a very relaxing stay at Mercure Sydney. The room was clean and spacious, and the staff were very friendly. The Hotel was in a fantastic position with close access to Central Station providing us with ample opportunity to explore the CBD and Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great service, great staff, great location easy to get around on the train, bus taxis. Definitely will return. Thank Mercure Sydney. The service was absolutely fantastic right through from housekeeping to bell boys. Honest housekeeping. I dropped $100 out of my purse and it was on the bench when i returned from my day trip. I didnt even realise i had dropped it. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on numerous occasions and have always been well satisfied. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Can recommend the tapas menu and alsp breakfast. Is in walking distance to Chinatown, Paddy's Markets, Capitol Theatre and Power House Museum. Public transport is very handy for other parts of town.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant comfortable stay- shame it went so fast!! The room was clean, staff were friendly and helpful- location is great. I would happily recommend this motel. I have stayed there before and will stay again when I come back to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: 7pr
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent! Centerly located, close to everything. The rooms are comfortable and well kept. The refrigerator in the room was a very good extra.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in an expensive city!”
Reviews.Author: Azhkman
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay after my business trip ended, and my wife's began in Sydney. So for Saturday night, I booked this hotel, as I wanted to be in the city. Staying anywhere else would have added $60+ in return cab fare. I stayed in room 1305. Great room! It had open views of the Eastern suburbs and to the south. The room and the hotel were both very clean (unlike the Mercure Potts Point!). The area of town is not the best, but which Central Train Station is in the good part of town? However, it is not bad, and it is near Chinatown which is one of the areas of Sydney that buzzes late into the night. If I have a complaint it is that the queues for check-in and check-out were both very long. The process included wait time, too over 20 minutes for each. Just plan accordingly, and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Ok value, bit out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: Carolinevc1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights in July. It's well situated for the main train station (5 min walk) which connects to the airport and has bus stops right outside. However it is situated on the outskirts of the CBD so not convenient for the sights - it took my daughter and I 40min to walk (at a fair pace!) back from the Opera House. The hotel itself is pleasant enough. Staff on reception were very friendly and couldn't be more helpful. Rooms were small and basic but clean. House keeping was a bit hit and miss (just with little things like clean cups and replacing milk) but beds were made daily and we had fresh towels daily too. Very good at putting things right with someone sent up within 5min of reporting any problem. We didn't use the restaurant so can't comment. Room service was average hotel stuff. Each floor has vending machines (chargeable to your account) which were great for grabbing nibbles and drinks. We took a look at the pool but it's tiny. It was full with just 3 people swimming. The only real negative was noise. Our floor had a seating area in the corridor, which meant that people tended to gather there and we were disturbed throughout the evening (up to about 11pm most nights) with children running around screaming or groups of people gathering. I believe the seating areas are on multiple floors. The walls were pretty thin too and the door blocked no sound at all. We were woken up two nights running by a particularly loud lady who struggled with her door card. Overall, it's the staff that give the hotel the edge (and the cheap price!) so I'd stay here again if I had to... but worth spending extra to be closer to the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: As per most Mercure, rooms are of a good standard and with all the facilities needed. There is a pool, gym and sauna on the top floor (indoor), but it is all a bit to small and it could be cleaner. The hotel is nearly literally on top of the main train station in Sydney, which means that you can get to the airport in less than 15minutes and it is well connected to anywhere else. The area is sorrounded by backpacker hostels and bars, and further up towards the harbour there are plenty of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful two night's stay at the Mercure in Sydney. We found the rooms to be excellent, clean and very comfortable. The hotel is situated close to everything and the buffet breakfasts were amazing. We would definitely like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney overnight”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It's always a pleasure to stay at the Mecure, George St, Sydney. The warm, friendly staff cannot do enough to make your stay an enjoyable experience. make sure you are there early so you can secure a car space as these are limited.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have often stayed at the Mercure Sydney for both business and leisure. The location is idea for accessing the Sydney CBD and surrounds with buses and trains on the doorstep. The rooms are comfortable and well equipped. The standard of service has always been very good but this trip stood out as excellent. All the staff I encountered from check-in, concierge, restaurant and housekeeping were exceptionally polite and went out of their way to be helpful

Reviews.Title: “position position”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi, we love staying at George St Mercure. We find it to be so handy in location as it is very close to markets, darling harbour and shopping. All the staff are so friendly and aim to please. We even got a free upgrade to a King suite which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location to Central Station is excellent. Being in the central part of Sydney where one can walk and see the sites was great. Also from here getting to the airport by train is a bonus. As I was only at the hotel overnight and can not make further comments on food as I did not have any meals

Reviews.Title: “previleged room but didnt felt like it”
Reviews.Author: joannegoh Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: if not for novotel's 20% discount we wouldnt have chosen in mercure sydney.. the rooms are out dated even for the previleged room, and even thou we requested for two people, they gave only one bathrobe and slippers. The chocolates advertised was jus one n a biscuit in a nice box. Abit of a let down. The bathroom, isnt what we expected was an old bath tub shower, think they desperately need a renovation in the room. the coffee machine was faulty, and their pillows were low n flat. their service was ok, but its mostly a very busy hotel for business travelers who jus need a place to sleep and not expect the works. Without the 20% i think there are other hotels we would rather stay in

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Mercure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Concierge service - Excellent Disappointed Restaurant closed at 9.30 when it is advertised 10.00. Realised it was late but still within advertised times. Would like a bigger range of bar meals. All staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy and average hotel, would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Worldfoodies
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 2 weeks and found it a very average stay. The hotel was constantly busy and the service was poor on all the occasions I asked for help. The swipe card for you door constantly deactivated and I must have made at least 12 trips to reception as I could not open my door to my room, very frustrating to say the least! When I brought this up with the duty manage I was told that it was my fault. Not great service overall. The room was average and the bed quite uncomfortable. If you are staying a night or 2 I guess its okay but I would not recommend a long stay. The breakfast was also quite average. The only positive of this hotel is its location, right near central railway, broadway, the university and china town. All a short distance walk which is great. Sorry but won't be staying here ever again by choice.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: artfan99
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent in walking distance of darling Harbour etc. Car park is very handy too. Staff were helpful and I was upgraded on arrival with a city view. Comfortable bed and clean, modern room. Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: okitu
Reviews.Content: While I'm not convinced about the four star rating, I would have no hesitation staying here again. The main reason are the trasport links. Train and bus are all excellent. The multi card (transport pass) made navigating the city a breeze. Rooms clean and tidy and staff were excellent. Found the resturant to be a bit ordinary. Some good resturants locally made up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ReidyNSW Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great value on an Accor deal at $80 per room for the night. Good location for the trains to the Olypic Stadium as well as access to buses and great service from friendly staff - except the Accor Priority checkout line was very slow on Sunday

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, very well-appointed room, friendly staff... only negative was slow service in the restaurant on my first night. Appreciate this effort to check in with me. Why the 200 character minimum... this is getting tedious!

Reviews.Title: “Bulldogs/Sydney Annual Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While the service at the Hotel was excellent, we had terrible sleeping accomodation, what was supposed to be a Queen size bed was in fact no bigger than a double bed which was backed up by the friends that we travelled with who also stayed at the same hotel, they claim that theirs was close to a King Size bed. Our 2 nights of sleeping was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Sydney stay!”
Reviews.Author: RichardR_10
Reviews.Content: Staff very pleasant, rooms well appointed and comfortable (My room had a view down Broadway). Very central - catch a train bus walk to many fine restaurants and entertainment. Priced mathed the product - infract a good deal! Oh, one down side the meals in restaurant-good but portions very small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mercure Sydney at Central on the weekend to attend a concert with family, teenagers and friends and I just want to say I enjoyed the location, Rooms, facilities and the very helpful staff at the reception desk, And will recommend Mercure to everyone. It was great to have the double beds in one room, which I found extremely hard to get in the centre of Sydney elsewhere, And the price was great @ $170. I will always stay at Mercure when travelling to Sydney for concerts etc. Donâ€™t change anything. You are unique in the fact that you cater 2 double beds in your rooms and we discovered the train system this weekend with the help of your staff, and travelled everywhere in one day. Thank you very much. It was a pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel for years and we love it. The restaurant has the best food. This hotel is an excellent place to stay with easy access to trains, trams, buses and an easy walk to darling Harbour, restaurants, shopping and the markets. We go to Sydney for business a few times a year and we wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Our opinion of the Mecure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always try and stay at the Mecure when we come to Sydney . Because we normaly go with a few girls its nice to know that it is so central to everything we need.The staff are very friendly and helpful i would recommend it to anyone. very enjoyable stay everytime :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably middle-of-the-road”
Reviews.Author: jusech
Reviews.Content: This is a solidly 3.5 star hotel so don't expect luxury if you're booked to stay here. We travelled as a family with two young children and all four of us were very comfortable in the deluxe double room on the 13th floor. The room has two double beds, a sitting area, a bag storage area, a work table, Internet access, and enough space to swing a 'roo in. Windows on two sides of this corner room gave great light and views across the city. The beds are on wheels and move if you move too much while you're on them. But in this room you can choose your preferred pillow from a menu, which is nice. The bathroom seems stuck in the eighties but is perfectly functional, with the usual amenities provided. Breakfasts are adequate and will fill you up, even if the quality of the food may not satiate your appetite. The best thing about the Mercure is its location, which is next to Central station. If you are taking a train to and from the airport, this is really very convenient. Don't bother with the pool or the gym. Staff at reception and the concierge (especially) are excellent, great help with directions and shopping advice. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and extremely good value”
Reviews.Author: MikeDav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a half-price deal throgh my Accor Advantage Plus membership. I have stayed on business before but this visit was a holiday with my wife and sister-in-law. The meal that we had in the 4 Elements restaurant was of high quality and very good value. Sharing dished between us worked very well. Breakfast on the Saturday morning was a little chaotic as the hotel was full, but the staff coped well with the rush.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel, but the breakfast has gone downhill.”
Reviews.Author: trevar
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed at the Mercure near Central Station. Its location is hard to beat, and it used to have the best breakfasts I'd ever encountered in a hotel (except, perhaps for the Sheraton). Unfortunately, although I found a rate with an included breakfast, I was disappointed to find that rather than having crispy bacon, they've gone down the path of only providing soggy bacon, and all the trappings that go with it seem to have slid as well. It's unfortunate, because this was my favourite hotel in Sydney (or at least, favourite of the ones my company was willing to pay for!), and it was mainly because of the breakfast! The rooms are still fine and comfortable, with a nice firm bed and a pillow menu (although even then no pillows quite firm enough for my tastes). I'll really miss that breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Mercure in Sydney, and I would happily stay again. The location was central - just right for my conference and for a bit of after-conference dining and shopping. Very easy to get to from the Airport. Check-in and check-out were smooth and efficient. One small niggle is that on the third day of my trip the breakfast restaurant was full with conference attendees and I lost my assigned table twice. Mercure staff assigned patrons to tables (and walked me to my table), but then gave away my table to other patrons while I was at the buffet. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Water pipes in the bathroom made a high-pitched whine when taking a shower, which I hope didn't annoy neighboring guests.

Reviews.Title: “good value in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Marky_Mark4
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel. Beds were comfortable. The room was a little small but good enough. The bathroom was large and clean. There was just a little bit of noise from the street but not enough to be a big problem. Higher floors or the orientation of the room would probably solve this problem. The gym on the top floor was small but reasonably equipped and with a view.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Above average inner city hotel for price. Great room choices - love the twin option of 2 double beds - even some top hotels don't offer this. Great location for shopping, transport and food options. Walking distance to market, chinatown and many other local conveniences. The only letdown for us was the pool. Not very big, the pool room had a very bad odour and it was like crazy hour at the creche!!! Not adult inviting, more for young kids. My 16 year old daughter wasn't even tempted - different story at Crown Prom in Melbourne 3 weeks earlier - we spent 3 hours every evening at the pool there!!! Great view from gym next to pool and the room service options were great also.

Reviews.Title: “Easy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great, close to Darling Harbour and China Town, walking distance from the train station. Rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The staff on duty were very friendly. Would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “cros trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: original room-depressing over looking alley and into nearby residences-easy upgrade for $20 per night -gave city views breakfast good value- disappointing cold meal in restaurant location is fine as long as you know fair way from CBD but is compensated by easily accessible public transport very helpful front of house

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hgst
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as my flight was delayed. It was a lovely hotel. Very comfortable. Staff were well able to deal with the influx of passengers who were stranded because of the flight delay. Food was very tasty. The ensuite was lovely. The air conditioning was a welcome relief as it was very humid. A fully stocked mini bar and satellite TV was available in the room. I enjoyed my stay there, pity I could not have stayed a bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mercure Sydney is excellent value for money - very friendly service and is always our first choice when staying in Sydney. I would highly recommend this hotel, particularly for those with children as you can all stay in one room (two double beds).

Reviews.Title: “Family Visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Sydney to see a show at Star City. The hotel was very convenient to Star City, China Town and The Power House Museum - which we visited. The car parking was easy (essential when you come from the country) and the fact that we could park on arrival in Sydney (Saturday) and leave the car there until Sunday afternoon was great. The family package was a hit with the kids, & parents. All of the staff were really friendly and helpful. The food at the breakfast buffet was good, the kids in particular loved the food. The restaurant staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend the hotel to friends and we plan to stay their on our next vist to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel at least five times now. We have found the staff, courteous, friendly and very helpful. Rooms are nicely furnished and clean with no compalints about the breakfast. We also like the close proximity to China town and Capitol Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms wern't cleaned in a timely manner (they where cleaned very late in the day), mini bars where not stocked on a daily basis. The rooms were small for the cost of the room and pillows where also in need of replacement.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CindySt_Marys_PA Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Sydney for three nights. We had a room with two queen beds. The room was very clean, and we did not hear any outside street noise. We took the train from the airport which cost $14 per person. When we arrived at our stop which was only like l0 min. from the airport we did not have to go outside and cross the streets until we got to our hotel. The hop on and off sightseeing bus was just around the corner. My husband and daughter went across the street to McDonalds every day for breakfast. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We walked from the harbor one night and it was a nice walk although you probably wouldn't want to do it with young children. The concierge desk arranged for us to take a taxi back to the airport. It was cheaper than taking the shuttle or train. It only cost us $25.00 (we got a lot of green lights and the traffic was very light on a Saturday afternoon. We check out of the hotel at 11:00 and they stored our luggage until the taxi came for us at 5:00. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if using public tranport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in was nice and quick. Standard Room (2 double beds) was tiny - no place for suitcase. Somewhat dated decor but comfortable beds and clean linen. Under bed we found a couple of empty bottles from previous guests? Swimming pool was tiny and the environment quite stuffy (mould between tiles on floor, dirty windows). Great location to catch a bus or train - right outside the hotel, so perfect for us to get around the City ... don't remember being bothered by traffic noise at all despite being right on the main road leading into the City. We got a great deal on special, and weren't planing lengthy stays in the room (we were out and about most of the time), so for this reason there were no complaints ... but had we paid the full price, I'd have been disappointed as it was nothing flash at all. Not sure if I would consider staying here again even at the special price - I'm sure I can find same time of special deals at some other more spacious and fresh hotels in the city - I have before ... still good to try and once again great location for users of public transport. I would recommend to a friend but only if the deal is great and if they were only staying in the room to sleep at night, particularly if they are staying with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is fantastic, just minutes away from the Central Railway station, China Town and free shuttle bus stop. Staff members are very friendly and helpful. I booked a twin share room (2 double beds) for 2 adults and 2 children, and the room is very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT ...”
Reviews.Author: JAWGJW Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Mercure Broadway many times, the rooms are always clean and comfortable (although lower level ones suffer from traffic noise), but some bathroom fittings are wearing especially taps. Reception staff are always excellent. The problem on our last 3 visits is that the restaurant standard has slipped a fair bit, slow service, the shared plates have been served less than hot and the portions tiny, we'll eat out next time. Table clearing at breakfast was also erratic, good one day, non-existent the next.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Mecure hotel is tired and in need of a good overhaul ; Many items don't work, others are a little outdated. Having said that, it is great value for money. Position, cleanliness, food and service were as good as any Mecure.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you once again as we have really enjoyed our stay with you again. This is our choice of place to stay when visiting Sydney as it is family friendly, price is great, the buffet breakfast is a must and much loved and it has the perfect central location for all our chosen Sydney adventures. This is all topped of by the great customer service received by all of the staff!! See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: D698
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Ten min walk to darling harbor lots on route. IMAX is excellent. Boat around to opera house or walk. Train station outside and bus stop. Concierge very helpful. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “My personal favourite in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SamOz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when in Sydney. It easily one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and is great value for money. It isnt super lush but it is honest in presentation. Staff training is reflected in the service which is reliably excellent. Its location is ideal being a short walk from Paddy's markets, Darling harbour and right next to the train. The rooms are quiet and the dining is good. There is a 24 hour general store close by for people on a budget. Secure parking is another bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Over night in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay just on the edge of the CBD. Local restaurants open during the day. Parking is not over expensive for Sydney and walking access is great for those physical ones who do not mind the walk. Access to public transport is a bonus

Reviews.Title: “happy traveller”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: clean and tidy. sauna was lovely. everything as i'd hoped except a very minor issue - no mini bar in room - you are meant to get a card with your room card to use in the vending machine. there was none included with mine, and i couldn't be bothered putting shoes on to go down to reception to get the right card.

Reviews.Title: “Security Concerns Make Me Switch Hotels - First Time Ever”
Reviews.Author: JimmyMc
Reviews.Content: As a very frequent traveler, with over 1MM miles on two different airlines and upper-tier hotel clubs, I can be very tolerant of a wide range of service and comfort levels at hotels. However this Mercure is responsible for my canceling my eight-night booking after only one night. Several incidents from rude and abusive desk clerks, bad bar service with my clients, and abusively high ($22/day) internet access were annoying, but would not have resulted in my throwing in the towel. However when leaving the hotel for a morning walk and a coffee at 5AM, a Middle Eastern couple was sitting in a lounge area on my floor arguing, with the man throwing me a hostile glance as I walked by to the elevators. Upon arrival at the lobby I reported the incident to the desk clerk on duty. When I returned 15 minutes later, the couple was still there and the argument even more heated. I called to the front desk and was told, get this: "The hotel doesn't have in-house security overnight and we called our security service, and they haven't arrived yet"!!!! What do we pay for in a hotel. Security is high on my list, as I'm sure it is for everyone. Having no in-house security is a breach of trust, and required my immediate departure, at a much higher cost than the now abandoned reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great location for getting around Sydney. The staff were very helpful and exceptionally friendly. Even though it was in the heart of the city it was very quiet at night. We stayed for four nights and purchased the breakfast buffet - which was of great quality. We also dined in the restaurant on one of the nights, which was excellent quality food, however the service was very slow. With two small kids this made it a little uncomfortable trying to keep their attention occupied until the adult meals arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathrynMelbourne Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Choice of pillows was great - I found the feather pillows, hygienically wrapped so I know they haven't been used & gone unnoticed in cupboard. These were the best I've slept on - not too thick, not too thin. Slept surprisingly well in unfamiliar bed. I rarely heard any noise from corridors, and didn't hear TV in other rooms - a welcome relief. Room is well appointed for the price, and in good condition - excellent actually apart from a few inevitable scuffs on walls. Wardrobe is a good size. Reception staff were very helpful - as was concierge desk when I rang ahead to pick up my luggage on the run. Polite staff member carried one case up the stairs so I could run for my connecting train! I would definitely stay there again - it's not luxury five star, but it doesn't have 5-star price tag either. It's a great 4 star hotel located centrally and with convenience stores, cafes, buses & trains all on the door-step. I only had the breakfast once - reasonable hot buffet & choice of cold foods. I also went into the bar intending to get a drink but it was very noisy, sports-bar atmosphere so I changed my mind (I had hoped it had more of a lounge atmosphere) - great for some, but not quite my scene. The staff were all lovely - not pretentious but friendly and helpful whenever approached. Clean, neat rooms and friendly staff in a surprisingly quiet hotel. I am comparing to the Marriot & Sofitel in Sydney where I've stayed in the past 8 months on previous visits. I would stay at Mercure again unless I had bags of cash to spend on 5 star. Thank you to everyone who made my stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a 5 night stay in this hotel. Rooms are not great but okay. I was shocked to see the bathroom switch almost in a falling shape and everytime I touch it I had the fear of getting electric shock. Cleanliness is excellent and so is the customer service of all staff. Location is great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hairspray the musical and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Mercure Sydney as its location to the city and surrounds is easily accessible and convenient to many venues in Sydney. Public transport is easily accessible right out the front door of the hotel. The staff are always extremely helpful, it is always a pleasure to stay at the Mercure, thank you. Cathy Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Mecure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent and the location excellent we enjoyed staying at the Mecure and would stay there again. The restraunt was fine dining and the staff very attentive, we enjoyed breakfast and dinner on two occasions and enjoyed all meals and service. We were treated very well at all times, by all staff we came in contact with.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling with small children”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In my opinion I wouldn't opt to stay in a room with 2 beds if you have small kids. The reason is because the room does not have a balcony or separate area to sit and watch TV or talk while the kids are going to sleep. This was a blunder in my booking the room. I would also prefer a kitchenette as paying for breakfast and what you (and kids) would eat was not worth the money (in my opinion). There was nothing wrong with the room as such it was the choice for our budget. Finally, the bathrooms could probably do with an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I believe the beds /rooms size was to small. Beds were hard .The hotel is getting dated and requires a revamp The room service and staff were excellent.We only stay there due to the location of the hotel to transport, very handy.Over all experience was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Twin rooms with double beds - great idea :)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great one night stay with my sister for a family gathering (we live in QLD) - comfortable beds, friendly concierge, no hassles. Enjoyed our stay. This is the second time I've stayed in 4 months and it was the same last time too.

Reviews.Title: “Coffee”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing about our stay was that we requested a coffee plunger for the room but were given sachets of instant coffee. The rest of the stay was brilliant. The location was good and the staff were generally very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “3 out of 5”
Reviews.Author: parkidude Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, the room was two double beds. We were 2 adults and two kids aged 6 and 9. The package included movies and breakfast. The kids spent 2 and 1/2 hours in the heated pool. The only problem was the buffet breakfast. The scrambled eggs tasted like they were powder eggs. The bacon was the cheapest cut of bacon that you could get. After attempting 5 cups of coffee we gave up on their automated coffee machine (even though one staff member made another staff member a real cup from the real espresso coffee machine). The other funny thing was there was a sign on the wall that said something like, "I AM NOT A FUSSY EATER" - "AS LONG AS IT IS THE BEST." I would have to say the breakfast was a big let down. Especially for me the wife, as I don't get my breakfast made very often. Oh I forgot to mention that our view was of the street and office buildings the other side has the city view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great access to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed very comfortably here. Room was excellent value for the money. Neighborhood is a little sketchy (near train station) but felt pretty safe. Location is several train stops away from the harbor area, that was surprising to us. Overall very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Staff wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent. We all loved the breakfasts - service EXCELLENT. Dinner on first night - slow, service not well coordinated. Front desk - excellent. Room service - One of our children was sick in the bathroom. We cleaned it up and room service replaced our towels really quickly - we were very impressed. On the Sunday morning, the lady cleaning our room was WONDERFUL. Our young child caught his finger in the door and the 'cleaning lady' was so kind and caring. She was so helpful to me - just a beautiful lady. I didn't take her name but she should be commended - just left a great feeling for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is right in the middle of the city of Sydney where the University of Sydney is in the walking distance. We are impressed with the size of bed where one bed can actually accommodate two persons. The concierge serive is brilliant. They gave me the address of "Pancakes on the Rocks" in no time. Services are impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very very close to Central Station. Convinient to bus transport to sight seeing locations. Close to many asian restaurants. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Service at reception was excellent. It is a family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Mercure because of its central location and boy was it central, very accessible to eating places, Paddy's Market & Chinatown, all within walking distance. Central train station was also literally next door and there were buses at your doorstep. The buffet breakfast at the Mercure was also tasty although a tad overpriced. Rooms were spacious & adequate, views were quite nice you get to observe the city below you. Air-conditioning/heating was great and the room could be toasty warm if you wanted it to be after you step out of the shower and you could adjust it to a comfortable temperature. Beds were very comfortable & clean. Staff were always helpful and very polite, service was excellent. Only criticism is not a really good shower but other than that it was a very pleasant stay, will definitely consider it as accommodation the next time we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Hotel in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location good and convenient, service was nice / friendly. Room was average...a bit scruffy and smoky smell through the buildings air conditioning. Bed was comfortable....room was reasonable value for money. Restaurant was small but good quality and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and convenient to transport. Service a bit slow in restuarant but food excellent. The staff were very friendly and efficient and I commend your concierge staff who went out of their to help me. The room was adequate for me as I was travelling alone to attend a conference.The room service was efficient delivering my meal on time.

Reviews.Title: “great for transport links”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for our purposes. We arrived to central station on a late train and were leaving again the next morning. The hotel is really convenient for the station and it was great to have the bar and food options around so we didn't need to go far. There are probably better locations if you want to be in the thick of it, but the transport links are great.

Reviews.Title: “short stopover”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the staff courteous and very helpful to our needs for computer access. The room comfortable with twin beds as requested. The tea making facility was most welcome. The room was clean and suitable for our needs. A brief but pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Neat and tidy. Helpful concierge. Breakfast buffet was lovely. We stayed with a young child and the room suited us well and had good digital TV reception for ABC kids (entertainment during down times!)

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we love staying at the mercure in central ,top location,and you don't need a vehicle to go aywere in the sydney region,,you have public transport at yopur door,, and the service is 100%,i would reccomend the mercure to any of my friends that do travel,,thank you so much ,,kind regards........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nellygirl71
Reviews.Content: I have just recently stayed at the Mercure for 3 nights to attend a training course for work and one night earlier in the month. Both of my stays have been great. The rooms are always clean and the staff are more than happy to help. The location is great also as it is right next to Central Station so you can easily get a train to wherever you want to go. It is also not very far to walk to Chinatown or Darling Harbour. I would definitely recommend this Hotel and will be staying there again any time I have to go Sydney as the prices are very good also.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found my stay to be excellent, the room was comfortable and I had a restful comfortable sleep. The location is ideal for transport as I took my daughter to the airport by train and was able to walk to my accommodation in the CBD. I love the view and access to shops and restaurants. The service was excellent, quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was a fair deal, but it was the quality of the restaurant that let it down for me. A medium-rare steak came out as well-done, service was very inattentive and prices were over-inflated. If I hadn't been in a hurry I would have walked out. If you don't eat there, upgrade the value to a '3'. The location is fairly good - close to train stations, Chinatown, etc. - but there's very little in the way of cafes for breakfast nearby - and after my experience at dinner, there was no way I was going to trust them with eggs...

Reviews.Title: “Food”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Dinner to slow with the services as I was asked to come to the later time slott and waited 45 minutes for the start of the tasting menu with long delays when we asked for two more of the tasting plate A piece of metal scourer in one of the tasting plates most unexcetable Breakfast no tomatoes with the colded bacon

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our recent stay at the Mercure Hotel. From the minute we arrived at Reception the service was excellent, all hotel personnel were a pleasure to deal with. We ate in the Restaurant several times and the food was excellent. Regarding location, I was pleasantly surprised at how convenient it is to everything. We especially found Central Station very handy and used it several times.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located for Capital Theatre, Paddy's Markets etc. Rooms are slightly dated but comfortable. All staff were exceptional but breakfast does not seem to be as well organised as other hotels - long queues, no drinks served at tables etc.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As per usual enjoyed the stay and the hotel really looked after us. The 2% card fee was disapointing particlarly with the price of the rooms. Probably one of the best locations in Sydney . Enjoyed the stay throughly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: reDcentAexec Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: YOu would stay here for the location, with Sydney city and public transport right on your doorstep. Relative quiet (from street noise) but could hear guest inthe next room have a telephone conversation very clearly. Rooms looking tired. No mini-bar in room, there is a machine on each floor that dispenses a limited selection of mini-bar items. Reception staff friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again. Great location near public transportation.”
Reviews.Author: mntraveler18
Reviews.Content: Close to train station and buses. On central street in Sydney, so you can walk to many sites from hotel. Ask for a room away from the elevator and not overlooking busy George STreet. Staff are vey helpful in giving information about transportation and Sydney sites. They also have discount tickets to the Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet our Expectation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: - The swipe card access to room was a problem for us. We could not access the pool and our room on a number of occasions. - The room was very small for a family of 4 - The plumbing was noisy - We could not ewatch the TV in the morning due to no input?. - The service and breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: joquail
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights for a combined business/family holiday. The location is perfect with public transport a short stroll away. The staff couldn't have been more friendly if they tried, from hailing taxi's for us, assisting with the lift, early check out & friendly smiling faces...the staff is definitely 5 star. Even though the location is close to Central Station, noise is not an issue (we were on the 5th floor). We found the hotel to be a welcome respite from the busy day out and about in Sydney. The only one small downside to the Hotel is that there is no exhuast fan in the bathroom/toilet, but this wasn't a huge issue. The hotel was spotlessly clean, beds were supportive & comfortable, food was divine but may get a little expensive to eat there for all meals. There were plenty of take-a-way options less than a 5 minute walk away, so no problem. Overall, a fantastic hotel in every aspect to holiday in, best we have ever stayed in...thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Aeryn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip to Sydney visiting clients to the south west of the city. It was easy to reach and has a below ground car park (at an additional cost). The rooms were pretty standard but overall the hotel had a good feel to it and I felt safe, both in the hotel, and walking out at night to find something to eat. There are a lot of food options (both restaurants and fast food) in the area. The breakfast buffet was great, though at the price I wouldn't say it was a cheap option. I'd certainly be happy to go back on subsequent visits to Sydney but unfortunately the prices have increased over the last year or so and it's now out of the company's budget. I certainly have no hesitation in recommending this as a place to stay.
