Reviews.Title: “Bed configuration”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: You advertised the Standard Room comes with a queen bed. We however got a double bed. Upon check out and we explained the situation, no appology was given, no offer was given. It was as if it was not their problem. The night was not enjoyable as both being over 6ft.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysinHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. What i loved best about the hotel is its location. It is just beside the bus terminal and train station. It is located along George Street which is a major road with many restaurants and bars. In fact, Mcdonalds, 7-11 and KFC was just across. The hotel is near to both Darling Harbour and Circular Quay which are the major tourist attractions in Sydney. There's also a green bus that goes around the area for FREE. The room also has 2 double beds which is quite spacious. They even have a pillow menu so you can choose the type of pillow that you want. Would definitely recommend it to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teganw Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, I'd have no hesitation in staying here again. I was looking for a hotel close to the train and this is in an excellent location - across from Central Station. Just cross the street and there I was. I was also able to walk to the Mary Poppins musical. The room was clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Tour Driver”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Checkin service was excellent and at check out the service was almost as good except that I was double charged for one night (booked and paid for on the web then I was charged again), the only slightly low point was the restuarant for breakfast as I was there at the start the hot food was just warm and the coffee machine kept playing up.

Reviews.Title: “concert night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were attending a concert starting at 7pm. The restaurant could open at 5pm to accomodate these evenings. We ordered from the bar and althought the range was limited the quality was good. We found the staff in the bar area to be very help full. Every thing taken into account it was a very enjoyable night.

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed i this hotel before and will stay again. The location is great and the rooms are nice. My only criticism is that when ever we stay in an accor hotel lately we never have enough towels per guest. Staff need to check how many guest are due to stay each night and make sure there are enough towels, cups, tea and coffee etc in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Positives and Negatives”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Didnt like the donation to charity added to my account before checking with ourselves, even though we have the option to decline this, we like to decide where we donate our money to. We travelled to Sydney to purchase a car and paid by putting $15000 on our credit card and not incurring any fees to do so. We put accommodation of $300 from your hotel on our credit card and incurr a fee of 1.5%. My husband put a call in to reception regarding our tv not working and waited 40 minutes for someone to come and fix it. On a positive note we had a lovely room, it was quite and we were happy with all other aspects of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, location good”
Reviews.Author: GeeTee007
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok for its' price, although the staff certainly don't waste any opportunity to ask if you want to upgrade (for a fee). As a smoker, I appreciate that they still have smoking floors, although I hate the fact that you can't open a window for some proper ventilation. Rooms are clean enough although the one I stayed in showed some sign of wear. Breakfast ($25 for full buffet) is reasonable enough value although the dining room is crowded and my newspaper was cleaned away and my table emptied while I got up to make myself a coffee. The perils of travelling/eating alone when on business! Concierge staff are certainly friendly and efficient. I am staying there again next week, so I will be interested to see if I have a similar, better or worse experience.

Reviews.Title: “Getting old”
Reviews.Author: blip6161 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Paid for upgrade but room very tired and hotel is now well past it's upgrade date. Bar downstairs , barman said it all it's a very quiet boring bar. Rooms have had a facelift and the upgrade suits have a nespresso machine (nice) bathroom old, very old and not quaint no relationship really with accor card and no advantages except points.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure George St Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: "Does what it says on the tin". Room small, but well laid out. Bed and pillow very comfortable. Bathroom well laid out, once again. Conference rooms excellently supported. Catering excellent. Restaurant excellent Well located close to train station for travel to airport. Concierge very helpful. Convenience stores very close

Reviews.Title: “Good value compare to other hotels in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TheEclecticEve
Reviews.Content: We got the bigger rooms with king size bed that comes with a sofa bed. It was a good value if you're traveling with kids. My 4 year old sleeps in between me and my husband in the King bed and still feel spacey.. the sofa bed can fit another 2 people. I've search hotel prices and I find Mercure to be reasonable. It was a clean, good hotel, don't expect to arrive at a five star look.. more like 3 1/2-4 star hotel. Location was not so central as they claim to be but if you like walking then it is fine. It was at the edge of George St. Some small restaurants across the street is a good alternative for budget dining. The small Chinese restaurant was surprisingly good. For quick fix there's a KFC and McDonald's across the street. We love the free bus that goes around every few minutes and take you to Circular Quay, the concierge will show u some maps to get to the station...Again, I'm giving you tips to save money because Sydney is an expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “Good price/value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: well located, esily accessible by public transport, living up with the Mercure reputation of comfort accommodation, however to charge for internet (without having the possibility to use it in public areas) in such a hotel is a disgrace

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay here. The Hotel has an in door heated pool of which the kids were keen to use. The first day there it was an o.k temp (average) the next few days too cool to swim in (luke warm temp). We were a bit disappointed with this. The rooms were nice and daily cleaned e.t.c very nice. The location to the city was excellent. It was very close to the trains and buses,so easy the get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot.”
Reviews.Author: barryjohnsmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, well furnished and has clean rooms of a good size. Staff are friendly and professional. Great little "smart bars" on each floor where you can purchase drinks at a relatively reasonable price. It is just across the road from Central Station, so most of the city is within easy reach by train, though it's not ideally located for visiting the sites on foot. Chinatown is about a 5-10 minute walk, Darling Harbour about 20-25 minutes. If you want to go to the Rocks or Circular Key, it's about a 40-45 minute walk. Taxis and buses are plentiful. The only slight quibble I had about the hotel itself was the room service menu, which is somewhat limited.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience and won't visit again!”
Reviews.Author: PHG007
Reviews.Content: Having booked in here ready for business meetings and ultimately my flight out of Sydney I wouldn't book here again. The rooms are clean and of average standard, the room service for evening meal is excellent, and the food served up was pretty good too. The concierge service is good the guys there are very helpful. So why wouldn't I return? The reception staff were unhelpful, cold making you feel like an irritant rather than a guest, they are argumentative, and cannot be got hold of on the phone from the room or when you do queue up to see them are dismissive. So, when there is an issue such as a late check-out they don't get the detail right and screw up the times you can use your room key, then they take 30 minutes to resolve this! So if you're looking for simple effective hotel service the front of house really lets this place down. The breakfast is way over priced and much of the fruit bread stale, or frozen and hard, So if you must book here don't anticipate a good start before a run of meetings better to save cash and eat breakfast at the airport. By the way no point emailing their management as after a week there is no response from them I figure due to the location they simply can exist on first time visits and those with the Hotel Chain loyalty card, as I wouldn't choose to have this service the front desk and breakfast deficiency mnore than outwieghs the good parts of this experience. Beter staying at a hostel 3 minutes down the road, it probably gives a better service1

Reviews.Title: “SUPERCALIFRAGILISTIC”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There was plenty of staff available if needed, they were polite and helpful. Efficient from cthe time of heck-in to check-out. The location was handy. The food was good quality and sufficient selections.

Reviews.Title: “Location suited us perfectly, but other factors made this stay below average”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but tiny, and the bathroom was tired. The taps were difficult to turn on - impossible for my children, and they dripped no matter what we tried. The location was ideal for us, as we only stayed one night and had a function to attend. We went to the restaurant for dinner, which was fine, but the service was not fantastic, and it wasn't good value. The iron in the room also left dark brown, almost burn like, marks on my daughter's top and my husband's jacket, which was a bit upsetting. My family did, however, throughly enjoy their breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “we always stay here”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always stay at the Mecure Central when we go to Sydney. As my mum was in St Vincent's hospital it was easy and convenient to stay there again in May. The staff are helpful and extremely pleasant. The rooms are well appointed and the food in the restaurant for breakfast and dinner is of a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “First visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right up to standard for a Mecure. The best aspect is the position with its easy access from theairport by railway (having just flown in from international) and then most convenient for the buses, trains or just walking to most of Sydneys best areas.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I felt very confined as I moved around the room. It was crowded and made moving around difficult. The hotel is poorly positioned and difficult in heavy traffic to get to. I made use of the room service for dinner after a very big work day, and was very disappointed at the quality of the meal. It was very ordinary. The breakfast in the dining room however was lovely. Front desk service was friendly and appropriate. I would struggle to recommend the hotel though due to the dinner and the confided nature of the room

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Brizzz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right at the start of the city. It is convenient for public transport - buses from Railway Square and trains from Central Station. If you wanted to walk to the shops however, be prepared to give yourself anywhere between 10 and 30 minutes. Even further if you want to get to The Rocks. The rooms are fine. We were lucky enough to be upgraded. Our room looked out over the city. The beds were great and we ordered the contour pillows from the 'pillow menu', which were also very comfortable. The only negative is that I had $420 held on my Visa card. I can only assume this is the security deposit. However, I wasn't told about this at check-in or check-out and only found out about it when I checked my online banking account. Even a receipt of some sort would be good, particularly for such a large amount of cash. If you can fix this up, it would've been a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Once again well c ateredd for”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Once again we were well catered for during our four day stay at Mecure Sydney. Service was very good, rooms clean and bedding (two Queens ample and comfortable. L><ocation is ideal with a short walk to buses and a 7 minute walk for trains. Will stay nnext time in Sydney. Tony

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival staff seemed mostly concerned with selling us an upgrade which didn't include anything that appealed to us. Our room was uncomfortably hot when we arrived so turned on air conditioner and went out for the day. That night room was still hot making it almost impossible to get any sleep. Early next morning asked concierge to look into airconditioning problem but when we arrived back later that day still not fixed. Tried to ring for help but no answer. Went back to concierge desk again and was finally moved to another room after maintenance man confirmed aircon was broken (he was the only one who was efficient). Paid account by EFTPOS but found we had been charged twice (plus a bit extra) when we got home. Efforts to resolve this were very frustrating. Manager promised to call back to explain how this had happened........still waiting.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: tripsterlisa Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the location was perfect for us ,across the road from the train station and with some excellent cafes nearby it suited us perfectly . the room was tidy and the service was friendly ..we had a small problem with the validating of the carpark ticket but that was quickly resolved. id definetely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel / rooms / location all good - did not eat / drink at hotel so I am unable to comment. Stayed in twin room - had two double beds - all good. Other friends staying in same hotel and when they came to visit - had to ask them to bring their own cup as there were only two supplied - D

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: Nilbog_Aus
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and otherwise a good level of service and finish as you would expect for a four star hotel. Chose a room higher up which was quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was used as stay for a trip to Europe. We have use this Hotel several times and have found the staff very friendly and willing to help. This hotel is in an ideal position close to railway and buses and easy to reach the Airport. Breakfasts should be included in the cost as there are cheaper alternatives near by.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was a first time visitor and was warmly welcomed at check-in. The room was great and I liked the view. The Accor priority check-out was appreciated when I saw the queue. Will definately stay again and recommend to others. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located quite close to the city center. The train station is just a few minutes from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and some of them were willing to go an extra mile to make the stay comfortable. To me, the employees are the greatest asset of any hotel and for me they can make or break my stay at the hotel. And at this hotel they were superb. I recommend this hotel strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great service and is central to the city. Concierge very helpful offered tips on restaurants in China Town. Printed airline bookings and made sure taxis came. Breakfast is very comprehensive and it was great it was included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we were expecting but ok”
Reviews.Author: Joey95
Reviews.Content: +ve Location - next to Sydney central station Bed - Comfortable Concierge - Efficient and quality -ve Breakfast - Not enough staff on so took 15mins to be seated, the hot buffet was terrible chicken sausages disgusting and eggs way overdone. Bathroom - Very dated, needs updating Room - Only 1 chair and no facilities for In room dining which we had to do as Sydney restaurants get v busy on weekends and you can't just turn up as we found out! Paid over Â£100 which was decent deal for Sydney but think it was 3* at best.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pillows and bed very uncomfortable. Breakfast buffet not re-stocked adequately, dirty cups in room, Shower was awful hard to control temperature. Not the best Accor hotel we have stayed in. Concierge was very helpfull and appreciated the early check in since we had a wedding at midday.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the best location for plane, train as very close to public transport. Great location for CBD and surrounding area. Reception staff were amazing and made us feel welcome. The room was adequant for the services we needed. The breakfast is ok but we came at a busy time and had to wait for certain items. However a good range of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Only one down fall”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only downfall was the power sockets (bar one) were not working and hence the hairdryer was not working as mentioned to staff whilst we were staying at the mercure. Other than that I was very impressed with the room and the facilities, the staff were extremely friendly and the location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: our meal in the restaurant was cold and not value for money. We had scollops, they were about the size of my little finger and cold. The pork belly was lovely, but for what you pay, not value, we ate outside the hotel later as we were both hungry

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in April 11. The hotel is well located close to Central Station. The rooms were clean and reasonably comfortable. Overall, the accommodation represented very good value. What disappointed was the buffet breakfast experience. The layout was cramped and things only seemed to be replaced as they ran out, so we had to wait around for dishes and various food items to be replenished. This persuaded us to breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: solotraveller59
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the mecure a couple of times. this time i stay mothers day weekend, on arrival our room was upgraded to premium, yah!. i like that 2 mins to central station, bus interchange right outside the door. walking distance to china town. i went to mary poppins short walk to capitol theatre bus back to door of hotel. great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have recently stayed at Mecure Hotel Sydney at George Street. I stayed in a double standard room. The room is a bit old. The water was leaking from the toilet into the room. And the carpet was wet near the toilet door. I asked the housekeeping to look into it. They brought a machine to blow wind into the carpet to dry it. I guess that was all they could do already. Baby cot was not pre-arranged though I sent the request before arrival. No mattress was provided for the baby cot. I had to use the blanket as the mattress. I needed to put on the blanket, bed sheet etc. myself. For most of our stay, housekeeping did not bother to make up the baby cot. The kettle was old too and the lid was fixed and could not be opened. I asked for the one with open lid and was told by reception they only had the fixed lid type. Later, housekeeping came and I asked where I can buy a open lid one. The housekeeping was very helpful and asked whether I wanted to change to an open lid one and they actually had it! Wonder why in the first place, reception told me there was no such open lid type. Is it because it was only reserved for those staying at the deluxe or suite? The shower head was a little bit weird cos' the water was distributed too widely and the water stream could not be changed. Even the shower head at my home has this function of altering water stream. Recommend only for the location Some staffs were friendly. Some were so so but still helpful. Overall I am a little bit disappointed about my stay in this 4-star rated hotel. I will only rate it as a 3.5 star, the 0.5 is for the size of the hotel and room. That is based on my hotel-staying experience in other countries as well. But it was very convenient, next to the central station, within walking distance from Chinatown. There is a shopping mall nearby, about 10-minute walk, broadway shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night on a business trip and found it a nice, clean hotel. It was well located when you have meetings at the top end of George Street. The room was reasonable size and in good condition. The bed was comfortable and there was no noise during the night so I slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in heart of Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: megal97
Reviews.Content: Rooms of reasonable size, clean and comfortable. Pool area shabby and need of a clean - although the pool was bonus to have in a city centre hotel and the children enjoyed the use of it. Food in hotel of a good quality. China town within walking distance with nice restaurants. Ideally situated next to central train station and good bus link to bondi beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessHowell
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be great. It was only a few minute walk to the train station so we were able to go everywhere we wanted to very easily and did not have to rely (or pay for) taxis. Most of the staff were helpful. The rooms were very clean and tidy. Although it was not overly special or fancy, it was certainly very nice. The only issue I had was that we were in a room right next to the lifts and the lift bell was quite loud and did wake me up a couple of times during the night. I feel that all hotels in Sydney are expensive so considering the price of other hotels we looked at, the price to stay in this hotel was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Price, Location, Services - excellent overall !”
Reviews.Author: lonesometravellerGB
Reviews.Content: Our 'deal' price-matched to hotel's 'own best offer' price for standard double room: ours included a room with two double beds and included the full breakfast self-service buffet, free of charge: this usually costs $25 per person, we understand - paid $169 Australian inclusive - same price as hotel's 'best offer' for room only rate.. On booking, I added our 'requests' i.e. 'high floor' and 'quiet location' - both of which were met without fuss on our arrival. Air-con excellent (but a little noisy - it had been left on 24 degrees C - a bit too hot for 'Brits' used to cold bedrooms, so the full fan setting was needed to cool it down). Some (slight) traffic noise from double-glazed seventh-floor room, but this hotel is effectively on a large traffic-island in the centre of a main roads complex, so what could we expect but some noise? A great night's sleep: excellent quality beds and bed-linen, and a fridge to cool our (own) drinking water - none supplied, though wine glasses were available in the room. Our tea/coffee (instant) was fine, and the milk 'jiggers' in the fridge were adequate. :the hotel's kettles are odd (to Brits?). When 'on', the switch on the kettle is 'UP' so, be prepared - I wasn't and thought the kettle was not working ! Shower (over bath) was OK, but not 'power-shower' pressure. Certainly adequate for travellers just in from a short (distance) but very long (duration) Countrylink train, which at times I could have beaten by getting out and walking, arriving at Sydney Central at almost 22.00 hours! Not one of Australia's great trains ! Breakfast was excellent: a huge hot/cold buffet, with scrambled eggs available on the buffet, but other styles available on request - poached, fried and boiled to order. Typical Australian-style bacon - streaky and under-cooked, obesity-style! - but tasty, too. â€˜Home cooked baked beansâ€™ were hard and sharp-tasting: a conventional â€˜canned beanâ€™ from a known supplier might taste better. Cold foods included cereals, fruits of all kinds, several choices of milk, including reduced-fat, soy-based, etc. Staff were helpful and attentive as required. I regard this hotel as excellent, for the price/location/services: highly commended..

Reviews.Title: “top stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: staff always helpfull nice and clean always enjoy happy hour. stay here 99% of the time where staying in sydney i recomend this hotel to anyone handy spot can get noisy so ask for a high floor.very close to public transport buses right at the door central station couple of mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All staff were excellent, smilley & freindly. The only thing I can complain about is car park expenses, miles too expensive for my daughter to park just to visit us Rooms were tidied every day Papers delivered as required, It was that good I actually joined the club

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First time stay and we were happy with with friendly staff and clean rooms and not overpriced. Had no problems with noise when sleeping and had a view which is always nice. Only suggestion would be to have one more chair in the room to sit on as there was only one at the desk. I personally do not like to lounge on my bed unless im in it or having breakfast in bed. Buffet breakfast was fine, very busy but they managed to keep the food coming. Had a lovely relaxing drink in the sports bar very good and nice staff. I would certainly stay again as I found it easy to walk down to the shops, China Town etc or a very easy spot to catch a bus. Also there were always Taxis when required at the front door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: klhump Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mercure Sydney was near perfect. The service when we checked in and out was very friendly and fast. We had a free nights stay so as far as value for money it was perfect. Great location near China Town and walking distance to the centre of the CBD. The only downfall was the noise at 6am of people opening and closing their doors however, that prompted us to get up and go for a swim in the pool. Overall, very satisfied with our stay and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We thought the rooms were great, the service was excellent and the location was terrific. The hotel is really clean and good value, the only problem we found was the shower head was to small- had to run around the shower to get fully wet. I would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure Sydney review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location. Rooms clean but lighting inadequate. Rooms are small. Resteraunt only has a limited menu. Accomodation is overpriced unless Accor has a special deal & during these times it is good value for money. Recommended at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, not so good view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Mercure Sydney (Central Station) was great in terms of service and comfort. However, the view of two massage parlours in the adjacent building was not what I expected when told I had been 'upgraded' to a city view room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Functional”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 14th floor. Good views of the city, very functional room with fairly basic fittings. There is a small pool and a very inadequate gym that needs a major overhaul. Lifts are accessed without room cards meaning you don't feel especially secure. It's also on the edge of town so a long walk to some attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel want to give more than 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Easter weekend very friendly smiling staff,restaurant food was the best,perfect location public transport and central station just walking distance can go any where around Sydney,nice and clean rooms,was very happy to stay and like to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “GENERAL COMMENT”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife & I enjoyed our stay, the only comment that I have would be the fact that we both presented ourselves for dinner on Friday evening 30 April at 7.30 pm and were told that there were no tables available. Looking around it was obvious that there were empty tables but the staff advised that they were set for breakfast and consequently were not being used. We ended up utilising room service at a cost of $81.00 and no discount for using the ACCOR Card. Just a bit disappointed. Otherwise the staff were very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently very good”
Reviews.Author: go99go Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This stay was mostly leisure related although I did have some business nearby. The first room I was allocated, standard queen on the 9th floor had problems with the heating so after calling reception they came to check it out. Without a ready fix they offered to move me to another room which I accepted and got a slightly larger standard queen on the 14th floor. Hotel staff happily helped move my belonings with me to the new room. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable and I love the 'pillow menu'. I had the best sleep at this hotel of almost 2 weeks on the road. I thought the rate was reasonable as was the parking but I thought internet access was expensive. Why is this the case when if you have a room towards George St you can access free wi-fi from McDonalds over the road. Overall I'd recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mercure Hotel is well located near Central station and China town within walking distance. 5 mins to train station, 10 mins to China town and 15 to Darling Harbour. Besides, the hotel room is spacious for family at an affordable price. Will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney Central Station”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great value accommodation. The rooms were a good size. The room with two double beds was great value with a lot of room. Great location and close to public transport and taxis. The room was clean and tidy. The service was great. The shower head could have let out a little bit more water, but I guess that was to save water.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Takeley
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband ended our 3 week trip in Sydney, staying 4 nights at the Mercure. We were very pleased with our room - great location - right near the train station, rooms very clean and comfy bed - what more do you need! Staff were very helpful from the concierge to the bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, especially for families with children of all ages!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff provided great service to us The room "King Bed Suite" was very spacious with the King Bed and Sofa Bed. There was a decent size LCD tv and the bathroom was clean. Too bad there wasn't toothbrushes and toothpaste where it comes as standard to other hotels The Mercure Hotel on 808-820 George Street was convenient to walk to Central train station for going to places like Parramatta, Cabramatta & Olympic Park. For all the not so keen walkers, it is a bit of a trek to head out to Circular Quay, Town Hall where all the bustling shops, attractions are Overall, it is a good hotel and i would definitely recommend it to other people who would consider staying in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Three little things stopped it from being an excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sleepy_Holidays
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Mecure and would return & recommend it. But three little things just spoilt it somewhat. The first was house keeping had missed a previous guests raunchy underwear in the bathroom. (Hanging on the shower curtain rail in the corner.) I was travelling alone so it was merely a humerus oversight and went straight in the bin. But had I been travelling with my wife, girlfriend, better half, etc I could have been up for some serious explanations. The second was the lack of directions to Circular Quay in Sydney. I got a 'its that way' with a quick point of the hand. That was it. No map, or its a 25 minute walk, or go down that street, can I call you a cab, etc. The third was I requested a room away from the elevator. I've had bad experiences in the past and wanted a good nights sleep. So which room do I get? Literally the one closest to the elevator. But there were some brilliant staff. The person checking me in couldn't be more helpful, shared some commentary on the royal wedding, had a great sense of humour and simply seemed to enjoy her job and helping guests. (There were a few worse for ware people that night with the rain.) The concierge also offered me an umbrella for my walk down to Darling Harbour. Plus was very helpful with directions or a taxi. The sound proofing is superb. Literally not any type of sound could be heard from outside. Its a busy street down below. So that is an excellent reason to return. The bed was medium to firm. Choice of pillows, quality linen, comfortable, no sagging and so forth. Room size was excellent, nice space and things didn't feel cramped at all. Nice fittings, decent sized study desk, new LCD television and the usual suspects. Plus internet wasn't the best price around. But it was cheaper than other hotels I've stayed with. Price was excellent. I recommend booking through the hotel directly, rather than the discount sites, as it was actually cheaper through their website. So lots to recommend and no problem with the facilities. Amazing value for money. Just a few little things made it average. Otherwise I would have rated it as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Easter In Sydney”
Reviews.Author: matebs Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over Easter. Staff always very friendly especially the concierge X3 , who couldn't do enough for you . Hotel is not right in the city centre , but trains buses right at your door. Price is very good value . We stay here almost everytime we visit Sydney & keep coming back . Good for a family as you can get a room with 2 double beds. We will definitely be back .

Reviews.Title: “sydney mercure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent location not in the heart of Sydneys CBD only a short walk 2km ish very clean great value for money has all the facilities that you need right next to train station not disrupted by any noise though will definetly stay there again. kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: fantastic room with excelent views, close to all the main attractions and wonderful staff. would definately stay again. only down fall was the pool was not heated and we did not recieve chocolates on our pillows. other than that 10 outta 10

Reviews.Title: “poor cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Vicadvisor_11
Reviews.Content: Upon our 2 night stay we found the room not very clean. The room had a heavy smell of cigarettes.The doona was uncovered and was soiled with body fluids of some sort. Made us feel very sick. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service for this hotel was outstanding. Everyone at the concierge was friendly and helpful. Location, Cleanliness and Rooms were all high quality, however for sleep quality, it was a little loud through the walls to other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was overall happy with the hotel's facilities and service howver I was unable to check-in to my room until after 3pm as it was still being cleaned which I was a bit disappointed about as check-in is from 2pm but that is the only issue and it was only a minor one. It didn't inconvenience us too much as the staff offered us access to the hospitality room if we needed it and a drink vouchers at the bar but as we had a yound child we didn't take advantage but the gesture was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Zero service but good location”
Reviews.Author: wyap
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights over the Easter long weekend with 2 young children. We are compelled to write this review on our 4th night. My wife asked for a V-shaped pillow which was offered by the hotel, but it never arrived. We also asked for extra face towels for our baby, but it didn't arrive too. The same with morning newspapers. On the 4th night, we came back after a long day out and found our room door ajar, prevented from closing by the latch! Naturally we spent hours going through our luggages and the room. Hotel staff could not confirm whether it was mistakenly left open by housekeeping although they suspected that to be the case; and this only left us pondering whether someone else also had access to our room. My wife didn't feel she could sleep safely through the night as she kept wondering if someone else could come into the door during the night. The hotel staff was apologetic. On the positive side, the hotel is convenient to trains and buses, and Chinatown is within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service close to everything!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chellee85
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the mercure in april for my sons birthday, in room with 2 queen beds on 8th floor, room was good size. staff were fantastic, rush to get your bags and greet you, as soon as you pull in the driveway. hotel is very clean, room service is good and well priced. hotel is right opposite central station,walking distance to darling harbor (10 min), and about 3 min walk to Chinatown,markets and entertainment center. plenty shops surrounding hotel, but surprisingly quiet room fantastic value for money!!! will be back ;)

Reviews.Title: “School Holiday Sydney Explore”
Reviews.Author: Yay_A_Holiday Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I love the Mercure Sydney and am a return guest. It is in such a good location, a very short work to Central, easy walk to the monorail and Darling Harbour. The hotel itself is great value, always clean and service great. And it is nice to find a hotel that comfortably and economically supports a family of 4 - our room had two double beds which was perfect, no awkward rollaways taking up space. It is the perfect place to explore Sydney, we had just a short return trip from the Easter show instead of a two hour journey home.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight flying visit to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Whilst I found the hotel to meet all of the expected needs of a traveler, reception staff - very good; portage assistance - very good; room more than adequate for a short stay; placement of the hotel very close to our preferred means of travel (Sydney Central rail); publec transport / taxi service at the door; everything seemed perfect until we headed for breakfast. We had to wait in line for over five minutes before we reached the entry, staff were a bit rushed by a large numbers of diners and seats were difficukt to find, no real support for an Advantage Plus member, many many staff running around (not sure what they were doing) and the food left a lot to be desired. Bacon uncooked; Scrambled eggs tasted like powdered eggs, coffee was terrible and there were cockroaches running over the table. Definately the worst breakfast experience in Australia, more so with the cost of $40.00 per person (yes, forgot to show 50% offe Advantage Plus card). Whilst I will be retrurning to this hotel during May 2011 and the fact that I would recommend the hotel to friends, I will be extremely aggressive on the breakfast choice - 'anywhere else' - and I will be canceling my May 2011 pre-ordered breakfast.'

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good stuff first:- great location for bus, train, monorail. Excellent choice/value for breakfast at $25 per adult, had a kids eat breakfast free deal, generally friendly helpful hotel staff. Niggles:- hairdryer & extraction in bathroom inoperable. Took 3 requests to get a hairdryer, no-one came to check extraction, put up with it as in too hard to do box. Booked Airport shuttle bus through hotel, the vehicle had seen better days, driver seemed to have had a bad day.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure Sydney April stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay at Mecure Sydney was good, I thought value for money and location was great, food and breakfast was fantastic,service was good as a whole, stay was soured only by a few people at reception,their idea of service wasn't what I have experienced at other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I remember...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times before & was happy. The location is great for train travel. This time I found the service was a bit lacking & it just wasn't overall as pleasing. The breakfast was very dissappointing, we had to ask for teaspoons & various other things that weren't being regulated. Makes me wonder if I'd go back next time.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in time was specified as 14:00, room was not available until 16:00. Paying $300 for the night, i felt this was poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great concierge, very little help from the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 nights. Because my view was facing a business area with lots of neon lights which penetrated even the curtains and made sleeping very hard I asked to be moved to another room when one became available but this request was ignored even after multiple attempts. As well, I asked for an adaptor (which the hotel provides) but after 10 days one was never given to me. The concierge however was extremely helpful and friendly. The location was very good and only a five minute walk to Paddy's Market. I strongly recommend people simply take the train from the airport to the central station instead of taking the shuttle bus which is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Aging ungracfully”
Reviews.Author: Mattwww
Reviews.Content: Great location. Good breakfast. Good sized rooms but the finish was a disappointment. Basin in bathroom was cracked and repaired. Why when a new one would cost $180. Both bed side lampshades were broken. Mould in bathroom grout. A general lack of detail in a generally good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An enjoyable stay from start to finish. All staff were exceedingly helpful and nothing was too much trouble. When the smoke alarm started beeping at 23.30, the battery was changed within 5 minutes of my reporting it. The room was comfortable with a view of the city centre. The rooftop pool was delightful and a half hour dip started my day off well. Public transport was at the front door and made exploring the city easy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great spot to stay. Walk to Chinatown, Surry Hills, CBD etc. The staff were helpful and friendly, and parking in house a breeze. Central Station right on the doorstep. A little noisy in the AM, but not too bad. Great view up George and Pitt Streets.

Reviews.Title: “Room service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice and it is easy, comfortable, good bargain and great location. The Only let down is reception as it takes a while to check in and twice have asked for more milk or shower gel and never had them delivered. Only a small problem but annoying. However will prob stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had a great time the room was nice and bedding lovely a shame the pool was too cold to swim. The location was close to darling harbour and all the great chinese resturants.we loved the resturant and staff nice and friendly fast check in

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in a very good location for a short stay in Sydney. Good access to circular train service offering all access points to the city. It was a good price for a inner city hotel, very clean and 2 very good queen size beds. Nice quality towels. Staff very happy to assist with any questions. Would be very happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location good if you are new to Sydney, but not a disability friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: asukaone
Reviews.Content: Location was good from the point of proximity to train and bus, but this made it also a very noisy location. Not a disability friendly hotel - stairs everywhere, even up to the pool, which was very disappointing - small, uninviting and ladder access, also cold, instead of being heated as advertised , so I personally couldn't use it, and is a major requirement for me in a hotel. Rooms were very neat and clean, but small and average. ... with shower/bath, again not disability friendly. Concierges were knowledgeable and quick to look up something if they weren't sure, but we werent offered any discount vouchers or similar, which would have been good with a young child. We only had breakfast there, and this had a reasonably good selection, but nothing special for the price. Overall, I found it overpriced for what we got, and will not be recommending it to anyone, apart from the location.

Reviews.Title: “A very happy stay.”
Reviews.Author: bigal242 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: gooGreat value , Great position in SYDNEY CÃ�NT GO WRONG'Hotel is very clean,nice decor,good sized rooms,handy to lower Sydney,Darling HARBOUR,haymarket markets.and,quick transport to middle and upper TOWN.by either trains or bus.Hotel is a lot quiter than ones in middle or upper town,which makes a big difference for a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Moby-Wan
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, small rooms, dated appointments, cheap flatscreen TV. beds dip in middle, lights in bathroom not working and when reception were advised thay informed us that they would send someone but never did! Cleaning staff had dropped an expensive moisturiser which cracked the bottle and hoped nobody would notice. REWARD THE GOOD, PUNISH THE BAD. Verdict: Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great very friendly people plus we got a smoking room which was great so me and my boyfriend didnt have to keep going up and down just for a smoke but the only downer i had was we had to pay a $50 deposit i didnt mind paying but i was never informed untill i went to check in there was nothing on the site telling me i had to pay a extra $50 so maybe if you clearly add it onto the accor site so people know there is a $50 deposit when checking in

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very friendly service form the start on booking in. We had breakfast with a 2 year old on the Sunday (10th) morning and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and tolerant.Have been before and will certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the quality of the food that we had for breakfast. The food (bacon) was cold & greasy & eggs were well below average. Everything else about the hotel accommodation was fairly good, we were just unhappy about the breakfast that was on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: WirlyandHerbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before an early morning flight. Great location to Central Railway (5min walk) to catch the airport rail link plus many pubs/restaurants within walking distance. We received a complimentary upgrade to deluxe room with balcony (view of George Street). Room (level 11) very clean & comfortable plus offered a pillow menu (we chose the rubber pillows which were very comfortable). Very little noise heard from outside & corridor. Service was excellent - nothing was a problem. Will stay again when we next have an early flight

Reviews.Title: “Consistently high standard of service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stay at Mercure Sydney every few months. The service, accommodation and consistent quality of food service and presentation makes this hotel outstanding in terms of value for money, location and customer service. I would recommend it to both business and leisure travellers. Not too many though as I want to be able to make reservations for us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay if you would like to explore more than Sydney CBD. Very close to trains, buses and the light rail making it very easy to explore more of Sydney. The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. There is also a airport shuttle bus which concierge can arrange - which was a good price for 2 travellers. The pool and gym area is nice, but the sauna you need to turn on yourself and wait at least half an hour before you can use it. Quite a few hotel guests couldn't get it to work. I've stayed in quite a few hotels in Sydney around this price range - I would definitely consider this one again for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Facilities and Service”
Reviews.Author: unabryn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Mercure last November and were shown to our room which unfortunately had been overbooked and had another family in it. We were given a temporary room and were promised another room the following day. However, during the few minutes we were packing up our luggage to move to the new room, the receptionist gave the room away to oher guests. As you can imagine we were non too pleased and asked to speak to the manager. The Room Manager, Sarah Connolly, immediately phoned our oom and arranged to meet us in the restaurant with drinks waiting. She listened to our problems, went away for a few minutes and said she would arrange another room for us. We were given the most fantastic room in the hotel - on the uppermost 14th floor, two queen sized beds, a dressing room and the most magnificent views over the city from double aspect windows. I felt I had to write this because it's fine going to a hotel when nothing goes wrong but it's important to know how a hotel deals with problems when things go wrong. It was a truly amazing stay and I would recommend anyone staying at this hotel to book room number 1411. You won't be disappointed. Apart from this hiccup the hotel facilities are wonderful, the restaurant and food is superb, staff exceptionally helpful and friendly, especially James and Mohammed. Darling Harbour, Chinatown, shops etc. all within walking distance. We had 6 hours to while away before we had to leave for the airport on our last day and we were given a lovely suite with comfy armchairs in which to relax with shower and toilet facilities, tea and coffee making facilities, computer with internet, books and magazines. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “So close to Central Station, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Sydney, a lot of time was spent researching hotel choice. Itâ€™s true that the Mercure does not have a waterside site and may not be in a particularly fashionable area; it does, however, have excellent staff. In three days, I guess we encountered ten staff, from the reception staff, to concierges, and restaurant personnel. All were superb. Whilst I can recall the names of some, it would not be fair to pick them out as we were uniformly impressed. If you are coming from the airport, the Airport Link train is recommended. Expensive on a cost per mile/kilometre basis (like the Heathrow Express) but it is very frequent and avoids traffic congestion. Thatâ€™s another way in which the Mercure scores because it is four minutes walk from Central Station; try to make sure you exit the platform at the correct end although itâ€™s not a problem if you come out on the Belmore Park side. Because of our inbound flight from the UK and efficiency of the Airport Link, we were at reception by 07.20. Incredibly, we were in our hotel room by 10.30 because the staff â€˜fell overâ€™ themselves to help. Really welcome after a very long flight. In fact, we could have had a â€˜smokingâ€™ room even earlier, had we wished. The Queen Superior is a good size room and ours had views down George Street with some very clear landmarks (such as the old Post Office Building, Ernst and Young Tower). The hotel is no distance from the Sydney landmarks, e.g. brisk walking of less than ten minutes brings you to Hyde Park and the Botanic Garden in fifteen. That means Farm Cove with its views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House is about twenty. In fact, I am not convinced itâ€™s worth taking the train from Central to Museum and walking the rest of the way. Breakfasts are good although having stayed at the Mercure Berlin An Der Charite just three weeks ago enables me to make a direct comparison. Sorry, Berlin has the edge on breakfast but only just. Itâ€™s buffet style with a good range of options. The Bircher Muesli now seems global. All in all, I am pleased we chose this hotel over some others with, apparently, better views. With the sterling â€“ dollar exchange rate and leaving booking late, this hotel was not cheap, it does offer value. Really recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, good Location”
Reviews.Author: RussellSydney Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, fantastic value. Customer service was excellent. The location was great for the purpose of our trip as it is very close to Central railway station and bus stops. A short walk to the entertainment centre and Paddy's Markets.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently had my fourth visit to the Mercure Sydney. As usual the service was efficient and friendly, I had an unexpected room upgrade and was pleasantly surprised by the Nespresso machine for a wakeup coffee. The gym is well equipped and the hotel is conveniently located next to Central station and a short trip from the airport. I'll be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A great spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mercure at Central is certainly a great spot for the traveller who wants a comfortabe, excellent-priced place to stay. The hotel is in a great spot, only 5 minutes from the train and tram. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in two things: the small size of the room and the service and quailty of the breakfast in the dining room. The location was great and the communication before and after the visit were both fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Not So Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: philovacation
Reviews.Content: PROS: Great location - close to trains and buses. Only a few blocks from Chinatown. Great restaurants, shops, and sights nearby. Hotel reception was able to check us in even though we were early. Concierge was also very friendly, and extremely helpful in giving us directions and booking tours. The hotel also sells discounted tickets to sights like the Aquarium, so no need to stand on line. CONS: The hotel room was small and old. Though we requested a non-smoking room, it still wreaked of cigarette smoke. The bathroom was sub-par. The shower head sprayed water everywhere, so the floors often got wet. Toiletries are hotel brand, but the cleaning personnel was extremely stingy with it. There were days we would run out of toiiletries and the cleaning staff would not re-stock. Those are supposed to be replenished on a daily basis. Overall, the location of the hotel is great, but the rooms are old and smell bad. I would not recommend this to those who are sensitive to cigarette smell, as we are.

Reviews.Title: “Privilege Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice clean room. The room only came with one bathrobe which was a bit disappointing considering that I had stated two people in the room. I would stay again though. Nice and close to all the enjoyment of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but is the cleaning done properly?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: is a good value for money hotel stayed there many times but this time i had stuff in fridge left over from previous guests, so it made me wonder if the cleaning has really been done properly??? or just a quick tidy??? are the decorative cushions changed etc or just the sheets???

Reviews.Title: “Suggestions to make Mercure Sydney more competitive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In general, the Mecure Sydney is good, in terms of convenience and quality. Nonetheless, I would like to see (i) better quality shower, the existing shower is terribly weak (ii) cheaper internet fee, the existing charge is unreasonably high

Reviews.Title: “Good establishment but not fantastic. Loved the pillow menu! Atleast I slept well :-)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights and pre-payed for my stay. I was at all day conferences so I only came back to the room to sleep. I would rate is as average, but by no means bad - it was good in some ways (service, cleanliness etc) but my room was tiny. I booked a standard room and the confirmation said 1 Queen Bed. When I arrived in my room, it was a double bed. Atleast they gave me a top floor room (Level 14) with a view which I stated as my preference. I liked the pillow menu - I slept well every night with a contour pillow (bought up to my room within 5 mins of my call to housekeeping). The aircon was a bit on the noisy side (even with the fan on low - its not really low) but I was getting tired at the end of the day so I just slept even if the bed was a bit firm for my liking. I didnt try out the onsite restaurant etc so no comment there but when I checked out, I was about to be charged an extra $36 or so for room service that I didnt even use. This was wiped out with no further questions asked when I said I didnt use any room service. Overall, I liked my stay and I would recommend this hotel to others and I would stay there again if I cant find anything else closer to the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Central to EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Concierge was FANTASTIC anything we needed - they'd be on it - shout out to Mohomad!. Location = BRILLIANT!!. On central railway, bus depot - by Sister got the train from Airport to Central with ease!!. CBD, Paddy's Markets, restaurants were across the road. The best part about it - as weird as it sounds - NO NOISE!!. Slept well!. We always go back without hesitation! Thank you Mecure Sydney for another enjoyable stay!!.

Reviews.Title: “I will always remember MERCURE SYDNEY HOTEL for their large comfy bed and impeccable service staff.”
Reviews.Author: DingxiangHuang
Reviews.Content: I will always remember MERCURE SYDNEY HOTEL for their large comfy bed and impeccable service staff. For a tourist who goes around sight-seeing all day will appreciate the comfy bed as you will feel fully energised waking up for another full day ahead. Friendly and experienced hotel staff is always there to assist you in booking taxi, providing directions to Sydney attractions and also recommend interesting places to visit! In short, they seem to have an answer for everything. Besides getting the well-furnished room with large screen TV; sofa; mini fridge; bathtub as such, furthermore you save time in your daily commute as the hotel is situated at heart of Sydney CBD close proximity to trains, light-rail, buses and short walking distances to nice eateries in Chinatown. Additionally the concierge can assist you in booking for KST Airport Transfer (Kingsford Smith Transport Sydney) which is a wise choice to commute to the airport in terms of comfort, time & cost efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were returning from NZ onroute to the Nth Coast. It's handy to Central Railway, China Town and the markets. We stayed on a friday night and it was very busy. Rooms are clean, food is good and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “One night.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Would have been amazing value if we didn't wait to book the room. Went up from 170 to 209AUD for the standard room over night - but it was still best hotel for the value in the area. Will stay there again when we're back in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A very good clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Boristhebold
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel to be a base for your trip to Sydney. It is a hop stride and jump from the central station wheren the airport rail service termintaes and a fifteen to twenty minute cab ride from the airport. We took a train ride to the Blue Mountains which is a pleasant site seeing trip, the train was on time , clean and not at all expensive. The UK rail operators could learn a thing or to from the Australian Rail Company. We had a room on the top (14th floor) with excellent views which was adequate in size, it was classed as a ueen superior. There was a faulty bed side lamp bulb which was fixed speedily and efficiently. We had no trouble with laundry in respect of towells the room was serviced daily and to a very good standard. We had the buffet breakfast which was not in the price of the room and whilst very good it was in my opion a little pricey. Overall this hotel does not deserve some of the poor reviews it has been given and I would recommed it to any one wanting a good clean value for money hotel with excepionally helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, though very small”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for an overnight stay for our family. While the room was very small, it seemed to have everything we needed. We were close to the Powerhouse museum, which we visited in the morning. The check-in staff were very pleasant. However, we left a book in the hotel room, and emailed the hotel the next day to try and retrieve it. I am disappointed that we didn't get a reply to our email.

Reviews.Title: “good value in inner Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Marky_Mark4
Reviews.Content: a perfectly adequate city hotel. The room had good views, was quiet and clean. For a base for exploring the city of Sydney this is a good value hotel. The reception seemed to be very busy and slow most of the time. parking was reasonably good value for an inner city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely better second time around”
Reviews.Author: SamatSwindon
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay (and review) in October 2010, my friend and I were very pleased with the attention to detail this time. Apart from lack of towels and facewashers on arrival, which were delivered on request, everything was as expected of a 4* hotel. The highlight of the hotel is definitely the staff.......where do you get such fantastic people? We found the proximity to public transport very pleasing.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again a great stay....”
Reviews.Author: APRS
Reviews.Content: Stay here a few times now, and the service is still just as good as the first time. Great location near Central Railway Station and easy access to the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Laurie-blueyes
Reviews.Content: We arrived after travelling for 30 hours from Canada, and although our room wasn't ready, we were shown to a Hospitality room to relax and freshen up. Our luggage was stored for us, and after only a short wait, our room was ready. The hotel was in Chinatown, with transit right outside the door, which was very convenient, and easy to use. We were disappointed that during our stay, the fitness room and pool were closed for renovations, yet this was one of the reasons we chose this hotel for my teenage son. Another disappointment was the restaurant in the lobby of the hotel does not allow teens under 18 years! Our room was nicely appointed and clean. There was a mini fridge, coffee/tea maker and supplies. The concierge arranged transfers back to the airport for us at only $14 each. When we arrived from Canada, we paid $16.80 each for the train to Central station and had to stand on the train and walk from the station to the hotel, so the transfer direct from the hotel to the airport was perfect! I would stay here again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and room”
Reviews.Author: Sally528956
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night at the Mercure. It is a very short walk from Central station, the staff were helpful and friendly and the room was nicely decorated and comfortable. The Capitol Theatre and Haymarket/Chinatown are all within an easy walk and there is plenty of public transport if you want to head further afield. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value.”
Reviews.Author: Douglas3
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for six nights and did not feel it was a good value for the money. It's a very average three-star hotel, but it comes with prices that suggest 4-5 stars. Accommodations were middling, and service left something to be desired. The average price per night for my stay was a bit more than $300. I had a "Privilege" room, which supposedly offers extra amenities, but as far as I could tell this really came down to a box of chocolates and a bathrobe. Unfortunately, the room itself did not reflect much in the way of luxury. Furnishings were OK, but the bathroom looked and felt cheap. All bathroom fixtures and the ugly yellow-and-white checkered tile on the floor looked as though they had been selected with economy as the primary concern. The shower curtain was flimsy, and tended to want to fly away while I was showering. The sink was a pedestal-style and offered no counter space to put toiletries or even a space for soap. Water pressure was fine, but temperature calibration was very fussy. The bed, desk, and chair were all suitable, though the closet was actually an added-on wardrobe, as opposed to a built-in. This room gets zero points for interior design. The TV was a flat screen, which was nice, but the picture was definitely low-def and the channel selection was weak. One big plus: Internet access was wired and fast, and I was not charged extra for the access. I had several interactions with staff that left something to be desired. First, I requested a room with a city view, and was told this would not be a problem. Well, I did not get a city view room; my room faced entirely the opposite direction. Worse, I looked out at a empty, black, and eroding billboard. To top things off, the backside of the billboard was illuminated by a row of blindingly bright lights that shone in my window all night long. (See attached photo.) I had to pull the blinds entirely closed every night. All things considered, I don't know that I've ever had a worse view, and to have been lied to about being granted a city-view room made it all the more galling. Furthermore, one day the staff simply did not clean my room. Housekeeping knocked in the morning as I was getting dressed, and I asked if they could return later. I ended up leaving my room at about noon, placing the "Please Clean My Room" sign on the door handle, and when I returned late that evening the sign was still there. They also managed to mangle my laundry - one cotton pique shirt has returned to me with impossibly long arms. I'm not quite sure what they did with it. The concierges were hit-and-miss. One was surly, one was never at his station, and one gave me flatly wrong walking directions - sending me hopelessly in the wrong direction and 30 minutes out of my way before I realized he simply didn't know what he was talking about. Others, though, were friendly and helpful. One helped me book tickets to an exhibit at the art museum - without his help I would have spent hours queuing in line at the museum. Worst, though I gave more than 24 hours notice, I was flatly denied when I tried to take one night out of my reservation, as a side trip to Melbourne for business cropped up. The location of the hotel is pretty good - it is close to Chinatown, within a 20-25 minute walk from Darling Harbor, and just a few blocks from Central train station. Unfortunately, however, it's sort of just on the outskirts of the central business district, and about as far away from the water as you could be while still being in the CBD. If you are in Sydney as a tourist, I think you should be able to do better. The business center is a joke - it's just a room with a few computers and a printer, and it smells like stale cigarette smoke. It is unstaffed - you have to get a passcard at the front desk. There is no scanner, and the hotel staff were of no use as I did need something scanned. I was told they had no scanner, and none could point me in the direction of somewhere that did. Overall, this hotel is a very average 3-star joint with a pretty good but not great location. It is clean and comfortable enough, but the high sticker price contributes to expectations the hotel can't possibly meet. Service is a mixed bag. It's a functional hotel, but not much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: arbulluss
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight with some girlfriends in Dec 2010. Overall the rooms are spacious enough and clean. Room service was lovely but unfortunately did not dine at restaurant. Gym is great, kept very clean. Towels and water provided. Equipment was great. Parking was cheap considering what you can pay in Sydney. Motel location was ok, a good walk to Darling Harbour. Public transport very accessible. Check in was not until the afternoon however they were more than happy to store our luggage so we could head into Darling Harbour for breakfast. Overall nice place to stay with family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Chinese New Year Festivities close by”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location for trips with public transportation, train, metro, bus, tram Close to Haymarket and Paddy's Market Very friendly and helpful staff, especially the concierge Excellent connection to Airport

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight prior to flying to New Zealand.. Bed was only a double when a queen was requested. Probelm with TV but that was fixed within 10 minutes of a phone call to reception. Early morning shuttle service to airport was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced and under-whelmed!”
Reviews.Author: Drewcifurr
Reviews.Content: On check-in, the room had been cleaned, however the bathroom was disgustingly filthy with a pool of urine on the floor. On request, this was subsequently cleaned, however soaps etc weren't replaced. Room service was ordered at 9pm, arrived at 9:45pm, and was of extremely poor quality, and quite obviously prepared earlier that day, and subsequently re-heated. The bed was effectively a stone plinth with sheets. The high-speed Internet access was so slow, that dialup would have been a vast improvement. Whilst this might seem a little petty, at $389 a night, I expected a LOT better, given that this hotel is on the edge of the CBD, rather than in the middle of it.

Reviews.Title: “easy acces”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very well situed and the double window are good for the quietnes,i recomand this hotel when yu can have it on hot deal or special promo,room are litle short but it s ok..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel. We often stay here. It is just so convenient. We had a room upgrade which was great. A Privelege room. Bigger and more comfortable. Ate in restaurant Tapas menu lovely and service good. Bar service very slow but staff pleasant.Breakfast is always good here. Enjoyed the Indian Poha breakfast dish but had other things too. All very good quality. Service here very good.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: YasminaJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: My family (6 adults & three children) stayed at the Mecure in January 2011. The hotel is very central and very close to Chinatown and Paddy's Market. Darling Harbour can easily be reached walking (though it is approx 2 kms away). The metro station is at the hotel's doorstep and transport is no problem. The rooms are a little old and dull and the bathrooms could do with a little modernising. For value for money this is an excellent hotel and very clean. the service and staff were excellent. There are plenty of fast foods and convenience stores close by. Ask for the City facing rooms as the view from the back rooms is terrible. Parking is quite expensive - $25-30 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Mercure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure from the 26th Jan - 2nd of February 2011 with my wife and son in their deluxe room. The hoyel was good value for the cost we paid for the week we stayed. The only problem we encountered was with the airconditioning that seemed ineffective from about 9.00 am - 2.00pm throughout our stay. It seemed that sun came through the glass and the room became very hot. This made the airconditioning ineffective. We adapted by being out of the hotel during these hours. Otherwise the hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very Confortable Room with views over the city. Hotel is in an excellent location a short walk to much of the city and next to Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mecure in Sydney a few times and the rooms have always been clean, however on our last visit I was very disappointed to say the least, the room I had booked for my parents had feces on the bathroom wall and a clump of hair left on the carpet. Due to noise from a function on the floor below my elderly parents had around 3 hour sleep. My complaints to a supervisor did not get much response, I would say this will be our last visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the hotel I felt at home. After giving my name I heard "Welcome back sir". It is these small touches that make you feel welcome and make you come back. The hotel is right next to Central Station, which make it easily accessible and close to all that the Sydney CBD has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “good location,convience,cleanness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My family stay Mercure Sydney for 4 nights. We arrive the hotel at 8:30 am,the room is not ready. So,we go to take city tour in the morning. When we return the hotel in the afternoon,our baggages are already in the room. It's good service! The hotel is near central station. You can walk to the station just 5 minutes by walking.There are MacDonald,Kentuckey and convience stores,it's very convience.In addition,the hotel has the washing machine.Because we travel at Australia for 10 days,it's very useful and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We're a party of 4 adults and a newborn visiting Sydney. We found the location of the hotel the most convenient for us to move around Sydney. The reception desk and concierge were very helpful. The breakfast served in the rooms was worth it. We had dinner at the Four Elements which was a bit too pricy but the food was very good. Not an affordable choice of eatery for a family though. Getting taxis with proper and safe baby seat was impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Short and Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The front desk staff when we arrived was great but upon check out the front desk staff was rather rude. And We thought we left something behind so we call the following week only to be tranferred around the hotel and left waiting on the phone for ages with the person unaware we were actually put through to house keeping.

Reviews.Title: “Year of the Rabbit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
