Reviews.Content: Location - perfect. We were there for the offical start to Chinese New Year at Belmore Park a 5 to10 minute walk away. Room seemed a little small, but only staying one night, so it really wasn't a big deal, but we did get 2 double beds (instead of 2 singles at an interstate Mecure we stayed in last year). The room rate was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel with friendly staff who were happy to accommodate our needs, and great value for two parents and a teenage son.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location, next to buses and trains, or short walk into CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ljr88888
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Mercure despite paying a premium price because it was NYE weekend. It's close to the train station ... in fact on the last day we discovered the underground pedestrian tunnel that takes you right to the station without having to cross streets. I thought the breakfast was great (once I figured out the coffee machine!). $25 is a lot to pay but the variety and quantity of food filled us up for the day. Room was adequate size, clean, nice decor. Yes, you can walk back from Circular Quay ... but it's quite a hike!

Reviews.Title: “Good Reliable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly at Mecure for business and have always been extremely happy with quality of room and in particular customer service. Handy location. No longer spend time searching for other hotel. Always return to Mecure.

Reviews.Title: “Australia Day stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pleasant ,polite staff.Room was functional and clean.TV difficulty quickly solved. Understaffing experienced during breakfast and checking out.Should have asked for a room with a view as it was booked in October.Appreciated Happy Hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TwoSixFiveOh
Reviews.Content: My stay is in the Australian summer and I had a room that was heated by the sun that it took 5 hours to cool down. I wish the hotel management would cool down these rooms ahead of guest's arrival especially when it's in summer! The room is a little tired (and should be re-fitted) but for the cost I paid and the hotel being in a central location, it was good value for money. It's moments to Central (Railway Station) and food and drink outlets are a-plenty. Shopping is nearby too. The concierge is one of the best (repeat: the best) in any hotel I have stayed so far. There was nothing they could not answer. Service was excellent and it was across a few shifts that I had tried them. Would rate Concierge 10 out 10. 5-star hotels can learn from them. One annoying thing I found during my visit was that the self-serve mini bar along the corridor would beep if someone was a bit rough with it; and it would just beep and beep till someone came to reset it. This is annoying for those whose doors are just a few metres from these self-serve bars (where the alcohol and soft drinks are). The room has an empty bar fridge. Housekeeping could be better in my room as they did not vacuum after the last guest left and as I walked about barefoot, I stepped on small stones and gravel. But the toilets and sheets were always clean and room well stocked. The lifts were fast and again, many 5-star hotels can learn from Mercure. Check-in and out was pleasant and quick. Note that this hotel receives a lot of tourist groups and reception can always be full of people either coming or going. In room flat-screen TV had only standard free-to-air channels and all movies were chargeable. The pillow menu (you can choose/request for different pillows) is outstanding and most appreciated. It's a free service. Internet is chargeable, rather highly priced like every hotel. One question for the management: where do we put our bags? There's no bag rest or area to put an open bag!

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary and a little dated”
Reviews.Author: LFLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a standard room for 3 nights over New Year only because it was one of the few hotels that still had availability. The hotel is fine, room was a reasonable size however theyâ€™re slightly dated (carpets, overall finish, bathroom) although everything worked perfectly well. Gym / Pool: The hotel advertises a fully equipped gym which is incorrect, the gym is tiny and comprises of approx 6 pieces of cardio equipment and 2 weights machines. The equipment is dated and since it doesnâ€™t have any free weights, a stretching area, stability balls & lacks basic weights machines I wouldnâ€™t call it a fully equipped gym. The swimming pool is also very small, overall the gym/pool area is bland and uninviting, itâ€™s also at the top of the building but the views are just of other buildings. Breakfast: We decided to purchase the full breakfast one morning and it was disappointing. The staff appearedto be in their own world and had no sense of urgency, there were numerous tables that were left uncleared for the duration we were there and it wasnâ€™t even that busy. Nobody seats you and tea/coffee wasnâ€™t brought to your table you just go and help yourself, when we went upto the cooked items there were only scrambled or boiled eggs. I enquired about fried eggs to be told they could cook them for me â€“ why isnâ€™t there a sign advising guests of this or better still an egg station where all eggs are cooked fresh?? The quality of food wasnâ€™t good, cost aside Iâ€™d still eat elsewhere, the fruit was bland, the cooked items â€“ bacon, sausages were saturated in fat too, and the items were luke warm under the tin covers. Overall for a hotel of this size the selection & quantity of items was limited and items were left to run out completely rather than be topped up when they were getting low and staff had to be asked. Location: Slightly away from the main tourist sights but if your ok with this itâ€™s walking distance to the subway and only a few stops to Circular Quay station.

Reviews.Title: “At least it's a good location”
Reviews.Author: Jah420
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 4 star hotel! Rooms dirty and overall condition of building is poor and run down. The only thing this place has to offer is location, but I'm sure a comparable place could be found for less money. I checked the reviews here before booking and thought the good out weighed the bad but trust me will look for other options next time.

Reviews.Title: “Value Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Quiet room (Level 9),Good business retreat options ,Good location with easy access to all types of transport. Breakfast good value with the accor card.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: squishy_9 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel for a business traveller. Leisure travellers may want to consider somewhere else. Rooms are a little on the small side, although clean. The pool area is tiny without many places to sit. Unfortunately the room was not ready at the stated 2 pm, and we had to wait an hour for it to be ready, although the staff were polite about the delay I was still disappointed. The room then did not have any towels. Although these things are minor nuances it really detracted from the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Style”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Mecure Hotel was a very pleasant surprise. It surpassed all my expectations from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The friendly , courteous and very helpful staff ultimately contributed to what was a most relaxing and enjoyable stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Accor Accord”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place; good service. Room is in need of fresh air; smoking odour does prevail. Internet access needs to be part of the deal ... in this day and age, at that level, to consider it an accessory is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, was concerned it was to far out from main attractions when I made the booking but I was wrong. A short walk to the'free' city circle bus!!! The staff were extremely helpful especially 'John' at the tour information desk. Would recommend to anyone after a classy hotel for a fraction of the cost....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: KoobC
Reviews.Content: If you want a place to sleep, close to central station and surrounding attractions. The Mecure could be for you. I stayed here with my young son. Found the rooms small. Yes, a bit of room they could have been wider and provision for a long desk and somewhere to put your luggage. We had a room with two single beds, bigger than the average and really comfy to sleep in. You have the option of order different pillow types from the Pillow Menu. The desk provided was for one person so my son had to sit right at the TV on an otterman with little room. This was for the room service meals of course. The TV has local and Foxtel. But he was disappointed at not being able to get Nickolodeon. The bathroom, whilst small, was very clean and amenities provided. Shower over the bath. A fan would be helpful at shower times. The aircondition, whilst a little noisy, was okay with providing some relief from the heat. We had to leave it on all the time to keep some sort of comfort in the room. There were no personal reading lamps so I had to turn all of them off to get my son to sleep and hope by turning one back on later, it wouldn't wake him. Although the room was very clean, no bin liners were provided and lack of replacement items where they attended to the room on the second day was a little frustrating. More frustrating after waiting 1hr for someone to come and replace them. (soaps & sugers). A mini bar is non-existent. You get a smart card and use the Smart Bar, found on each floor. They don't tell you this at check-in and they don't tell you that you need to leave a credit card number in order to get this card, at reception. I used debit card so had to go and attend to this. A guest laundry is provided. One washing machine and one dryer. $4 for each and $2 for powder. I just waited. Breakfast - really nice. Everything provided. Loved the scrambled eggs! Room Service - Pretty good. A little exy $$ but food was lovely and welcome after hours sightseeing. Found most of the staff lovely. Who ever seemed to be incharge of the dining room, always so sour in their faces. Not just the same person either. But I got over that. The lovely concierge from NZ, Shane I think, was just lovely. The others....didn't impress me. I mentioned to the Assistant Manager at check out that I smelt cigerette smoke from the air-con vents in the room twice and he promised to look into it, and he meant it. We weren't aware of any neighbours. Being on the eighth floor, we had a restful sleep. My son loved the pool. There is also a sauna and gym area. Great view from there. There is a McDonald's, KFC, Hot Wok, Sushi takeaway restaurant, & Pub across the road. Also a few convience shops very close to the hotel. Parking was $25 a day. Safe & convieniant below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: young_happy_tourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disappointing, as we had come from the Mercure in Queenstown, which was wonderful and had set our expectations high. Unfortunately, we were disappointed by the small, dark room and distance from the city (approx 40 min walk to harbourside). This was exacerbated by the rain which meant we spent more time than we had anticipated in the hotel. The saving grace was that the concierge were helpful and directed us towards some really yummy food in China Town. I would not recommend this hotel, given I am sure there are plenty of others in Sydney that would make for a much better visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Mercure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Sydney. While it is up one end of the cbd (central Station end of town) there are plenty of great shops and theatre close by. Chinatown, Paddy's Market, Darling Harbour are all within a casual walk. Even the walk right up to the Opera House and Botanical Gardens is not hard with plenty to see and do along the way. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful, breakfast was awesome and parking was convenient and safe. This was my first stay here and wont be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook this pearl in the ocean”
Reviews.Author: ShazzanDazza Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was so easy to find, very close to train station and Sydney CBD. The Hotel website has a map with directions you can print. A 20 minute walk to the Harbour Bridge, 10 minutes to the Opera House and no hassle parking under the Hotel. We arrived early and our room was ready. The room size was generous considering travelling with two teenagers who each had suitcases . Ensuite was very clean and supplied with nice thick bath sheets. The pool on the top floor was fantastic and the view magnificent. We enjoyed the buffet breakfasts each morning and the staff cannot do enough for you. Our room was conveniently close to the lifts, all of us slept very comfortably and were not disturbed by any outside noises. The concierge are well resourced and knowledgable of the area and always willing to assist. We parked our car under the Hotel and the rates are very reasonable given you are in the CBD. We will definitely stay here again, Mercure certainly maintain a high standard of care towards their Hotels and it's guests. Thank you looking after us so well.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mecure is ideally siuted for a stay in Sydney whether you arrive by train, car or plane. The proximity to Chinatown, the city and public transport means you can maximise your time. Also a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A must for the best value for money stay”
Reviews.Author: Neil9664
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveller to Sydney with a family of 5 the Mercure offers the best value for money. The location is in a short walking distance to all Sydney has to offer. Staff are more than helpful, rooms are clean, food is good. A must stay for families. Have tried a lot of motels in Sydney but the Mercure is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: kalexn
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in an excellent location! Right near the train and within walking distance of everything. I actually took the train in the morning and then used a map and walked the rest of the time. The bed was SO comfortable and the hotel was VERY clean. The staff were wonderful and I truly enjoyed my stay at the hotel. Would definitely recommend!! I was also able to request to check in early with no problems!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge”
Reviews.Author: DavidA200
Reviews.Content: Average hotel with excellent service from the Concierge who gave us maps, told us where to go and how to get there in the best way.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although we had prepaid at the discounted online rate, we were given a great room on the top floor with heaps of space and a great view. Thanks to the manager who allocated our room that day! The kids were doing cartwheels the room was so big.

Reviews.Title: “Complaints, disappointment and distress”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: At arrival, the room was not fit as per reservation. After returning from New years Eve celebration, the room was not cleaned, no fresh towels etc. The response from staff was that the hotel was fully booked and they didn't have enough staff.On the 3rd day same problems, room was not cleaned, no towels etc. I think that is enough to rate this hotel by yourself.

Reviews.Title: “wifi”
Reviews.Author: daveneal Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very good and clean. The concierge system proved to be very useful. I used the gym every day of my stay but unfortunately the air conditioning was not working for 3 of the 5 days. My main problem was the cost of wifi access. I think it is now time for the hotel chain to move with the times and offer free wifi access. Several establishments in the vicinity of the hotel offer free wifi and consequently I ate there rather than at the hotel. In my case I needed the internet in the morning for half an hour and in the evening for a similar time and felt the cost was too much and should be included in the price

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EXPATALICANTI
Reviews.Content: Toured from England to Sydney on round the world trip, having been to Vegas, Honnolulu, Auckland, Adelaide, Brisbane, and to the Mercure Hotel Sydney. May i say this is up with the best, for its locality, for trains and the buses, and restaurants. Being a hotelier myself i think i know what i am talking about, i know you will not be dissapointed. If any of you are in ENGLAND come and give us a try OAKTREE FARM, HOPWAS, TAMWORTH

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, especially at new years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Fallaslover Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although it is clean and well situated when you need to go to the airport and still don't ant to be too far away from the city, it is overpriced, especially at new years Eve

Reviews.Title: “great service and rooms - dissapoimted that the pool and gym were not open”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great service and rooms, only dissapointed that the pool and gym was being worked on those 2 nights that we were there and it would have been nice to have been told this when booking , I was soooo looking forward to a sauna

Reviews.Title: “School holiday entertainment”
Reviews.Author: Kaddy49 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We took the Grandchildren to Sydney for a couple of days sightseeing. We had planned to go to Manly but the weather was not the best. The Sydney Mecure is in a great position for transport with both the light rail, buses and train in close proximity. The hotel is close to Paddys Market and can be easily walked to or accessed by light rail. Service on arrival was fast and efficient and the staff were friendly. Our room was clean and had two double beds - we even could choose a pillow to suit which is a huge plus for a good nights sleep. The menu in the dining room is a bit limited and we travelled with a coeliac 10 year old and that made choices even more difficult. The fact that kids can stay and eat breakfast for free is great too. The Accor advantage plus membership is a bonus when eating in. We booked on the net through the Accor Advantage Plus site and were happy with the rate considering we were travelling with a 10 and 13 year olds. A lot of hotels want you to book two rooms with kids this age and that would mean that a trip like this would be out of the question financially for us as we are retired. I would recommend this hotel to the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I satyed at the Mercure in George street for 5 nights. We found the service to be of a very high standard and having stayed there before, we noticed a vast improvement in the service, not only at the check in counters but also the concierge desk, they were marvelous. The rooms were always well groomed daily and thelocation is just excellent. Right next to the Central railway station, no need to hire a car, excellent commuting. The hotel is only 10 mins. walk to Darling Harbour and China Town and is surrounded by bars, cafes and restaurants. A very concenient location. We will definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “mercure sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Shane on the concierge desk especially helpful and assisted us to book a fabulous cruise, nothing was too much trouble. Food in the restaurant excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay here couple of times a month and its a very good and comfortable hotel. The bar is not big but it serves amazing cocktails, the service from all staff is always professional and friendly, rooms are decently sized (Its very conveninent for smokers as there's smoking rooms so you don't need to go up and down) and its situated right opposite central station which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Trying their best, even during the festive season. Very helpful with parking arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, supportive staff the room was very clean, I also ate in the hotel and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: QueenBeeNZ Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mercure has location and convenience. Right across from Central Station, it's a quick trip from the airport into a comfy bed in a quiet, spacious room. It's the best place to stay if you are attending an event at Olympic Park, again just a train ride away. Room service on this trip was fantastic - I recommend the Barramundi

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a night in the city”
Reviews.Author: mameshiba
Reviews.Content: I was journeying through the Sydney hotels with rooftop pools when I came across this hotel during an Accor 40% off sale. I paid less than $100 for the room which was great value. The hotel is really close to Central station so catching the train from the airport was easy. There were no waiting lines to check-in and the limited staff that I had to deal with were pleasant. The room itself was an average sized hotel room with room for a desk and chair. The bathroom was also an average size with a shower over tub. Not the best shower head, but hey gotta conserve that water! The room was clean and tidy and they offer a choice of pillows which is good. I had plans with a friend in the city, so after seeing the sites we hit up the pool at 11pm. It was open until midnight, which is pretty cool feature. The water could've been a little warmer, but hey it was 11pm I suppose! They also have a gym and sauna up there. Overall I enjoyed my stay. It was close to the trains and bus and a short walk to China Town and the city. For the price I paid it was great value too!

Reviews.Title: “History”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Regular use over years. From business trips while company in place to see clients,, to now appts at specialists/ and even entertainment & spontaneous overnight while on holiday. Only ever one mistake by staff during long history Otherwise always efficient service, good communication.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very comfortable and well looked after. I will look at staying there again the next time we travel to Sydney. I will also recommend it to anyone that asks about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap hotel in every way but the price”
Reviews.Author: PeterG38
Reviews.Content: This was one of thoise poor experiences that one gets where every fault seems to build on top of each other fault to make you vow never to return to another hotel in the chain ever again. Since I have stayed up to 100 nights a year in hotels, this was a very poor service experience indeed. We had booked for two nights each for ourselves already in Australia and our daughter who was coming into Sydney from the UK, but she was held up by the snow. i.e. we had booked 4 nights accomodation (2x2). Having heard that our daughter was going to be 36 hours late, we phoned the hotel early in the morning that we heard that she was held up and asked to extend our stay by one day and change our daughter's booking to one night starting two days later (i.e. still keeping the 4 nights, 3 for us and 1 for her). They refused to accept the change in the booking saying we had booked through a UK agent and we would need to get them to make the change. I pointed out that with the 11 hour time difference that would make us too late for their deadline for no-show charges. They couldn't care less, and insisted we pay another 2x$169 for the so called extra nights. To add insult to injury they also charged 1.5% for charging the credit card - I have never been charged for putting a room on the credit card at a so-called decent hotel ever before. Apart form that the room was OK, but there was no shampoo, too few towels, no wifi in the room, and we had a narrow double bed. At $169 per night unimpressive. Breakfast at $25 was very poor, with orange juice being watered down concentrate, a huge queue at the one coffee machine out of three that was actually working and the pancakes so tough you could line shoes with them. The attractive looking bowls of melon were all under ripe. Parking was $22, and interenet access also $22 per day. The internet would not allow outgoing mail from outlook/outlook express. The swimming pool was closed for the three days we were there (no explanation) and from our point of view the location was awful - a long walk or a taxi ride from anywhere and everywhere. To top it all, when we checked that the room was available for our daughter, despite having paid for it they appeared to have given it away and then I was told by the receptionist that I had an attitude problem when she proceeded to call me a liar about having prepaid! There must be better hotels in Sydney and my advice is avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to. Park the car and you wont need it again. Bus, Taxi and trains right at the front door. Staff are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed at mecure Sydney for concert at Sydney football stadium. Great location easy walk. Also easy walk to darling harbour paddy's markets shopping excetera. Intend to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Survey George St Mecure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lightning for reading either in bed or room just average. All staff that we had contact with were extremely helpful and friendly. Bathroom door (rm 921) was loose on both sides. Loved the large towels. Great nights' sleep! Breakfast hot foods only warm, some fruit not quite ripe. Breads and sweet pastries limited but still enjoyed huge variety of menu. Thank you for sending the survey for me to complete as my husband stayed at Ibis Wollongong in November and is still waiting to do his survey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahclark117
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, overall this hotel was great. Good location, modern and comfortable rooms, nice bar area and friendly staff. We would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Oprah visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were just a bit small but the overall experience was 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. Restful Sleep. Friendly and helpful staff. Close to Chinatown / Paddy Market etc... Right on Railway Square for quick access to trains and many buses. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “7th December 2010 review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived early to attend a meeting. The three bags were checked with the concierge, who said the bags would be delivered to the room when it was ready. On arrival at the room at around 4PM, the bags were found to be strewn across the floor and one upside down. it appears as if they were tossd in from the doorway and left were they landed. very poor

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thought the room was very good, close to everything, the service from staff was excellent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Going from ordinary to awful...”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTony
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times because of the location and never been that impressed, but it seems to be getting worse. It's an old Trevelodge design and the upgrade has done little for the pokey bathrooms and I agree with comments on here that they are a bit stinky. The service has been worse each time I've stayed. The concierge people chatted to each other and ignored me on arrival, when I asked for help and on departure. Three out of three! The check-in staff's command of English is really poor and it was actually hard to be understood. The Accor A-club membership seems a mystery to them - I certainly didn't seem to get any advantage. Finally on check-out, I found out they still charge ludicrous amounts for phone calls - over a $100 for a Sydney-Canberra call which are both in the 02 area. I thought hotels had got over that scam years ago! Under no circumstances forget your phone charger - it might cost more than the room! Not going to bother again.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the lovely night. I had a really good nights sleep and the room was very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Cost effective Inner City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skillr01 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well located to Darling Harbour and Entertainment Centre with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Hotel - Centre of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to have if you do a lot of business in the city and want to keep your logistical arrangements simple. Close to all public transport, resturants and facilities including key attractions. Rooms are very comfortable, spacious and service exceptional. Their attention to detail is impressive. I have been and will continue to be a regular visistor. If you have a hearing impairment, their TV allows you to watch some channels in captions (they are working to address all channels as we speak).

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I continue to use this Accomodation because of its convenience to public transport, the CBD and Darling Harbour etc. Good service is always provided around the Hotel and in the Restaurant etc.

Reviews.Title: “Rushed visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my stay was very brief rushed and I was not able to use the hotel's facilities except as an overnight place to sleep (ie no food service, bar or fitness facilities, etc). My review is therefore only of the sleeping and concierge facilities

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mercure appears to be directed at large groups and business travellers, and lacks some of the personalised service that the costs would imply. Against that it is convenient in terms of locations and runs smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great hotel to stay whilst in Sydney, we do often. It is clean and the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Mercure Sydney, I find the location suitable for what I need to do when I'm in Sydney - not a great deal of interaction with the staff but check in & check out effortless. Handy little bar adjacent to the lobby, the wine selection could be better but I found the "Summer Time Lager" to be quite enjoyable, it's produced by a craft brewing establishment called "Schwartz Brewing", who for those playing at home are also the owners of the hotel. Easy access to public transport with the bus interchange at your doorstep and Central Station within easy walking distance. Will happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “old hotel in need of refurb”
Reviews.Author: swishdude
Reviews.Content: oh dear! they were quite full so I had to have a "premier" room. Expensive room, bad check in area, tiny room (perhaps the cats are small in Sydney?), taps in sink drip unless you turn them very hard (no spanner provided) shower could not hold a reasonable temperature and went from hot to cold to hot. Water on the bathroom floor turned out to be a leaking cracked toilet bowl - unbelievable! Hairs on the floor of the bathroom (not mine!) Callers to my room were unable to leave a message as the system would not work. I was offered another room but too late. Gym very small and limited. Plus points - staff are friendly. Decent wines by the glass in the restaurant. Bar menu limited but interesting. Breakfast very average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Concierge”
Reviews.Author: SleeperAwakened
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for three days in August 2010, and we were happy with our choice. The rooms were a bit small, but clean, and the location was excellent, very close to the central station but still quiet. The best thing about the hotel was the concierge staff, especially Adam. They were very helpful, reserving tickets for attractions and for finding activities. The swimming pool was a highlight. If you come with kids, they will definitely enjoy this pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorpionsholidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights, hotel is located in George Street, in the China town area of Sydney. That was a bit of a put off for us as we had just come from Hong Kong and had had enough of chinese food ! However George Street leads straight to the Sydney Bridge area (about a 45 minutes walk.) The hotel is very modern and we were very pleased with our room. Very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The railway station is nearby and bus depot so ideally located for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, superb food, well worth considering as a place to stay in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mercure is showing its age. It must have been completed for the 2000 Olympics. The rooms are satisfactory and clean. The lifts, common area and dining are very ordinary, if not sub standard. The breakfast area is very busy and facilities were over stretched at times. The only saving grace is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicole S Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time, everything went smoothly, service was great.

Reviews.Title: “All you need hotel in central location, but basic”
Reviews.Author: honkiehoteler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has all you need: no frills rooms (but bit old look and feel and a bit run down and it smelt like the room used to be a smoking room once...), adequate small gym with small swimming pool (on top level with great views over the city), good breakfast and in a nice location. Near central station (so basically the whole city -or the whole country for that matter- is within reach) with walking distance to the sights in town. Too bad there is an extra charge for internet which I find ridiculous these days, when rates are already high enough (as it was in this case as well).

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Sydney Mercure Paradise”
Reviews.Author: JimJamJo
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I have only ever stayed in one hotel... ever. But my, do the others have a tough act to follow. On visiting Sydney back in August 2008 it seemed particularly daunting to an English-countryman that I would be staying in a towering hotel located smack-bang in the middle of a bustling city. The Mercure website offered a warm and pleasant impression, which was similarly reflected by the entrance hall and the welcome desk of the hotel. The staff were pleasant and readily handed over our room key and wished us a pleasant stay. So good so far. Walking along the pristine corridors which housed â€œ517 modern and contemporary guest roomsâ€� we arrived at our door and took a deep breath before gazing bewilderedly into what would be our room. (One hears of such terrible rumours on the internet...) The room was simply beautiful. A clean, minimalist layout, yet ornate furnishings and complimenting bed linen gave the room character and appeal. A basic bathroom, a flat screen TV and complimentary biscuits. What more could one want? The hotel itself is situated right in the heart of Sydney city's modern retail district, and is no more than a 15 minute walk away from beautiful Darling Harbour or the bustling centre of Sydneyâ€™s Chinatown. With Sydney Central Station located next to the hotel, anyone can easily hop on a train and discover some of Australiaâ€™s greatest tourist destinations; such as the iconic Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Although if you have come to the hotel to get away from the busy schedule of everyday life, the hotel offers the magnificent â€œFour seasonsâ€� restaurant and the relaxing indoor rooftop swimming pool, gym and sauna to work those stresses away. The beds are extremely comfortable and the room is surprisingly quiet considering the lively buzz of the city that awaits outside. In summary, this really is a fantastic hotel, The quality of the rooms and the hotel is fantastic and the position is so handy for popping out for an evening of entertainment or a day of Australian culture. True, the hotel may be a little pricier than others, but for the overall ambience and excellence of the hotel, your stay will be worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A first rate hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Mercure on a number of occasions and always enjoyed the accommodation and friendly service. The hotel restaurant is one of our favourites with wonderful food and excellent service. The staff really made our stay an enjoyable one. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We dined at the restaurant and found the mewal choices unusual: would have prefered more mains. The food was good but the srvice was VERY slow: 1.25 hours for 2 courses, 45 min wait for desert

Reviews.Title: “Mother and adult children”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, Staff friendly and helpful, close to Central Railway

Reviews.Title: “Staff made mistake after mistake with the Booking”
Reviews.Author: Peter4WD
Reviews.Content: The Rooms were very small, way to costly for the size, you couldn't swing a cat in them, The group we were with had 1 room cancelled by the staff, when it came time to pay the bill, the cost of the 2 rooms had doubled. Oh the beds are not that big either. Car parking ended up being close to $30 per day, we were not told that until we booked in. I recommend staying elsewhere, not that far down the road, you can get a room 3 times the size & its cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney stopover”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sydney overnight on our way home from Cairns, we were very happy with the service we received from the hotel staff, everyone was friendly and only too happy to help.The hotel was in a good location, handy to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kittybellefield
Reviews.Content: Fab place to stay in Sydney, the room was spotlessly clean, had all the things you need in a hotel room (iron, hairdryer) and we we're also able to do our washing (we were travelling through Oz for the next couple of weeks, and baggage restrictions are quite low, so laundry was a must. Great place to get a good night's sleep for busy days sightseeing in Sydney. And it also had good air conditioning! Hotel was in a good location - 15 mins walk to Darling Harbour, and five minutes away from the central station. Staff were very friendly, especially a young man on reception (who I think was called Nick!). We returned to the hotel unexpectedly the next week to stay an extra few days in Sydney, and felt like the guy on reception welcomed us back like old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A little over priced but a nice place to stay. Close to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were met at the front door by two concierge staff to assist our check-in at 8 AM after a long flight. A check-in staff member also came forward and greeted us at the door. We were amazed. Reception was able to offer us an early check-in and the use of the hospitality room to freshen up with showers. The room was comfortable and quiet. The buffet breakfast was an excellent value, and after six months in New York, it was such a treat to have fresh Australian food. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Athough the cost a little higher it was worth every cent. If you want good service and great nights sleep I suggest this motel. cheers''' Anthony and family

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pool with a view!”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in height of (Aussie) summer. Really cool, fresh and contemporary hotel - a pleasure to return to after a hot day in Sydney! Especially the rooftop (indoor) pool with a view right across the city. Spacious, clean rooms with everything you need. Top marks :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad overall!”
Reviews.Author: Worldgoneby
Reviews.Content: the decor is pretty nice as is the location......However the bed in my room was horribly uncomfortable. Honestly I would compare the bed to a bed in a Motel 6 or Super 8 in the states! For a hotel that charges those rates and has the decor it does I was surprised at the bed situation.... I would stay again but would have to check out other properties first for similar rates with more comfy beds....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kimmykye Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern, staff were friendly and helpful and the location is ideal. Short walk to trains and buses. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: k27672
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed here for 2 nights, have stayed in other Mercure Hotels and this is up there with the best of them. The location was perfect as we were attending a function at Darling Harbour, easy walking distance. The beds were comfortable but not the best we have slept on but we still had a good nights sleep. We were on 9th floor and had some traffic noise but was very minimal, not enough to keep you awake and lets face it you are staying right on George Street. The staff were excellent, extremely helpful when we pulled up with our car and were offered assistance with luggage which was really apreciated and the staff at the concierge desk were really helpful with directions etc, the reception staff were extremely welcoming. My only gripe was that the fridge was far too small, but that's because we needed water bottles for our sports events and car parking was a little steep in price but it is Sydney so what else do you expect, but did really like that it had secure on-site parking. The bathroom was a good size & house keeping was also really good. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to the Big Smoke”
Reviews.Author: Freddo01 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Came to Sydney for one night to see a show, and after 8,000 k's, and three flights later, I arrived. All I needed was a good bed to have a rest before the show and then return back to the other side of the country the following day. All I wanted was a good bed to rest my old bones, and I got it.

Reviews.Title: “great location great stay”
Reviews.Author: tictac Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a shopping trip with my friend and 2 teenage daughters loved the roof top indoor pool and spa. nice walk to darling harbour, qvb or broadway... Vaule for money hotel , rooms were quite small and windows dont open but overall nice, clean central hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean efficient stay”
Reviews.Author: mezAussieTrav Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, v clean, stayed on 13th floor - price included small bar fridge, tea + coffee making, and internet. Close to University for the residential school I was attending. Several convenience stores nearby and good pub meals across the road. Used room service and this arrived promptly and as ordered. Do not disturb sign honored. Very close to transport hub for trains and buses - hotel has taxi rank and other rank at railway. Parking available underneath hotel - have ticket validated at check-in and you have unlimited in-out privileges. I noticed that help was frequently offered with bags and for the care of elderly guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThreeBueys
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 month old and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last week. I was in Sydney for business and we only chose it, because we got a dicsount through Holiday Rewards (we bought some tyres through Beaurepairs and were given vouchers to use). This was one of the hotels we could stay at in Sydney, using these vouchers. Upon arriving, the staff were very professional and friendly. We couldnt fault the staff throughout our stay - always lovely and engaging. Location wise - its in the City, but on the edge. Everything in the CBD of Sydney was accessible - only a short walk or you could walk to the monorail and use that (about 5 - 10 mins away). Rooms - we stayed in a Studio Room. It was fine and quite large actually. It had a bedroom with dividing doors and then a kitchenette, dinner table and couch. The room was clean and had everything we needed - flat screen TV; microwave; sliding doors so we could put our sons cot on one side too (for peace and quiet!) A few marks on the walls etc - pretty standard for this class of hotel. Bathroom was fine - but it did have a shower curtain, which I am never a huge fan of! There was nothing in the mini fridge though - if you wanted water, drinks etc - you had to purchase them from a machine in the corridor, which was different. The only thing we could probably fault was the breakfast. My husband ate at the restaurant and the scrambled eggs were powdered, which wasnt great, as we would have liked to have given some to our 11 month old. Overall though - this hotel definetely served its purpose and it was a good stay. The staff are one of the highlights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location-great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dona89
Reviews.Content: Very clean and centrally located. It is on border of Chinatown. Two blocks from trains and you do not hear them. Major bus stop on same block as hotel. Pleasant and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, centrally located hotel, great for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: millie00044
Reviews.Content: Family of four (kids 12&15). Stayed 6 nights. Kept costs down by sharing a room with 2 double beds. Great value family package included free parking and fantastic buffet breakfast each day. Centrally located with buses at the door and 5 mins walk to train and light rail (we got weekly bus/rail/ferry multi tickets and 3 day light rail/monorail pass and didn't use the car all week). Very helpful and friendly staff: prompt problem solving and excellent concierge service for advice and booking theatre tickets. Kids loved the heated indoor pool. Modern decor in foyer and restaurant. Rooms very clean, comfortable and well set out. Would recommend Mecure Sydney - we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: EPL58
Reviews.Content: This is a very well situated hotel, close to the train station, bus, restaurants and shops. We stayed 5 nights there in February and we got to go everywhere using the public transportation since they are all very close to the hotel. The room was clean and the concierge was always very helpful with everything, including making dinner reservations. All in all, we had a wonderful time and would love to stay there again when visiting Sydney in the future. I agreed with other reviewers about the high internet charges, but it seems like that is the going rate in Australia. We ended up using the hourly internet in the conference room and it worked out OK for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well situated”
Reviews.Author: RRic
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and well situated. Near to station, bus, restaurants, fast foods. Room is good and well equipped. The person at the Concierge desk was very helpful for our tours. The only negative thing is the staff at the reception desk. They are very cold and unfriendly. On check-out, I asked for a copy of bill. The lady at the reception was annoyed that I asked for this and she gave it to me in a very rude way.

Reviews.Title: “Value, but probably most suited to families”
Reviews.Author: kabartolo
Reviews.Content: Our accommodation was fairly cheap for early January accommodation so overall, I was pretty happy with the value we received. We caught the train frequently, so the distance to the harbour wasnt a problem- though it is a bit of a walk if you are not planning on catching public transport. The rooftop pool was very much appreciated, the room was clean and the staff were attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but internet connection is poor”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous34333
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with many advantages. For example, one good thing is its all day, all night room service which is great for jetlagged guests like myself (Essential for all Sydney hotels if you ask me.) Also don't worry about any noise that you would expect from traffic and railway station. It didn't bother me. The hotel is well insulated and I slept very well. The one bad thing is the very poor internet connection. It is very expensive (22 dollar per day) but it is very slow and cuts out randomly. For a business traveler a high-quality internet connection is an absolute must. I would therefore not recommend this hotel to colleagues purely because of this. However, if you don't care about getting online (and I can see why it wouldn't be that important to the average tourist) then yes I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure, Sydney - I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Max255073
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to this particular Hotel as our annual Trade show relocated from Darling Harbour to Fox Studios. The central location was great for transport to any of the locations I needed to visit. The staff were professional, helpful and friendly. Loved the fact that as a smoker I am still catered for and not treated as a 3rd class citizen and forced to stand outside in the street in all weather conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Value for dollar is disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: matt260989
Reviews.Content: This stay was for my girlfriends birthday and boy it did not live up to my initial excitement. We stayed on a Saturday night and because of this I knew the rate would be higher but later on I found out how much the markup was for Saturday nights and was appalled I had just spend 429AUD on their King Deluxe Room. Checked in with no issues, was given our rooms by front desk. As soon as we opened the door for the room, all I could smell was a smokey/burnt smell. I had booked a non-smoking room online and had paid in advance on arrival and did not notice until we had gone up to the pool later on that we were indeed on a smoking level which I had explicitly not chosen as I cannot deal with smokers even 2 meters away let alone a room filled with the stench. Not to mention we could not even shower because the showers nozzle was facing to the ground. I am a laid back guy and I thought I could get through a night no problems but the TV died an hour later and would not turn on/froze and this is where I felt very ripped off. After spending some time in the pool (which does not look as nice as it does on their website - not to mention squashed cockroaches in the sauna) I decided enough was enough, so I went downstairs and had a word with front desk. I initially spoke to one of the girls at the front (I wont publicly display her name) regarding the issue and she said look there is nothing I can really do, we are booked out and are you sure you booked a non-smoking room (looked at me like I was an idiot). I said look, this is not good enough, so she went to speak with the manager who was sitting out the back and she came back saying we can give you a free breakfast (one that I had paid for already) so she offered me 30AUD off our total bill to compensate. Not good enough - and I aired my exact thoughts to her. This is when a must more nicer girl took over and seemed to try her best to sort out the problem, she again went and spoke to the manager (who i'm sure at this stage the staff must have to run everything by him) came back and offered me champagne and some chocolates for the discomfort - well first off my gf and I do not drink... I again told her, look freebees are not going to fix the problem, I want what I paid for - a room, non smoking, a TV and shower that works and that I was not happy with the dollar I spend on this room. I have stayed in the Vibe hotel for 100AUD before and have been 100% happier. She spoke to the manager who finally after half an hour decided to come out as I was not going to go away and forget it,. He said look, I am sorry, the rate is naturally higher for Saturday nights and you would have only paid 250AUD any other night for the King Deluxe Room - 200 diff for one night? That is ridiculous! I said look if you knock some money off the bill to compensate for my poor stay then I will be happy, I will feel like I have not wasted half a weeks wage on a sub par stay. He said this could not be done - and although he said earlier he was 100% booked out of everyroom, that he could upgrade us to a suite. Which we eventually did, which once we moved our bags in the girl earlier who was fantastic and the guy from concierge came up with some freebees anyway, unknown by the manager at this stage which put a smile on my face as the staff went to their own trouble to make me happy after basically having to wrestle the manager for some sort of compensation. The rest of the experience was much nicer however long story short - I think I will be going somewhere else next time...

Reviews.Title: “The Mercure exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Facemaker
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were recently in Sydney for a friends wedding and a few extra days for sightseeing and relaxation. As we didnt know Sydney, we looked at all of the hotels websites to pick where to stay. We had booked a different hotel in the CBD weeks in advance, and a week before we left I read several bad reviews for said hotel on Trip Advisor. I panicked and called the mercure hoping to get a late notice reservation. Thankfully there was availability and our stay was made an amazing one. The Mercure is a comfortable relaxed place to stay, the staff were so friendly and were more than willing to help with anything. Our room was roomy and comfortable and it was a pleasure to come back to each day. The rates were very reasonable for the standard of this hotel. We will definately be recommending the Mercure Sydney to anyone travelling to Sydney (in fact we already have)! Thank you Mercure :o)

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and disapointing”
Reviews.Author: KarenR6
Reviews.Content: It was noisy, not just traffic wise but could hear people in the rooms around us-toiletsm voices and walking aound. Dirty, dusty room. Scuffed paint work and cracked sink in the bahroom was just cheap and really not nice. Food was good. Would not recommend other than for attending for business.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central location near to station”
Reviews.Author: pmlinc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure for 14 nights on a business trip. The hotel was well located for travel being only 10 mins walk from Central Station where most train services start and stop. Its a little way from the main tourist attractions in the city centre but this isn't an issue due to the good train services. The main problem location wise was the lack of a supermarket (at least I didn't find one) close by. There were lots of convenience shops around the hotel and McD's KFC etc. but these were all shockingly expensive. As I was paying for my own food and was on a budget this was an issue for me. The room was quite adequate and clean. The bathroom plumbing was a little worn and dated but worked Ok and was clean. The plumbing in my room and other nearby rooms was very noisy and at 7:00AM it was quite annoying as each nearby shower screeched in turn. One good feature was very good blackout curtains in the room. Traffic noise on the 5th floor was audible but I got used to it after a couple days. Staff which I encountered were noticeably friendly and efficient. Staff encountered in lifts etc always asked if you were enjoying your stay and if you had had a good day - this would never happen in a UK hotel. The pool/gym was quite good but needed some tlc. Pool was a good size for a city hotel. Gym was well appointed but several pieces of equipment needed maintenance (pedals broken on bikes etc). Sauna was nice but would never get warm due to hole in back wall and sticky door catch. I had limited time for sight seeing and was on a budget but good choices were hanging out in Circular Quay area, botancial gardens, ferries (free with mymulti card), ferry to Parramatta, ferry to Manly, Aquarium and Bondi beach. Check prices for attractions as I found that several tickets could be bought more cheaply from alternate sources. (eg public ferries are much cheaper than Captain Cook ferries and often go to similar places.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: D_D_Galle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for a conference. Pros: - great location - awesome breakfast - comfortable bed - clean - reception & consierge staff great Cons: - dinner in restaurant was average. Ordered a rare steak, it was bleeding profusely. In a place like this the chef should know how to cook a steak properly. - wireless Internet is obscenely over-prices; $10 per hour or $22 per day. - some restaurant staff were inattentive. Table of three were seated and then ignored for 20 minutes before order taken - only 4 other tables were occupied. - bathroom is rather dated compared to the rest of the room Overall it was OK. The location makes up for its shortcomings, but I feel it fell short of a 4-star rating in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: thegorbs
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in a standard room for 4 nights in Jan 2010 for the Big Day Out festival. The hotel was clean, and the bed comfy. Great location, right next to Central station. It is a bit of a walk to the main shopping area, but Sydney is a big city, and the bus services into town were just across the road. Also, there was not much traffic noise in the room, which was a pleasant surprise. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but room service hit the spot. My only gripe would be that the pool didn't seem to be heated. After our stay, we liked it so much that we became Accor members and will be using them again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: Travellers286
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Mercure, our second visit in 12 months. On this occasion we booked a King Deluxe room, and were very happy with the space and facilities it offered for an average tariff of $149 per night. The bed was comfortable, the room was spotless, the air conditioning was effective and it was quiet at night. As on our previous visit we found the staff to be friendly and helpful at all times, and the concierge in particular went out of his way to assist us with information about bus times. One of the big pluses with this hotel is it's proximity to excellent public transport; there is a major bus interchange outside the front-door, the central train station is next door, and the light rail is a short walk away. We enjoyed the hotel's breakfast buffet each morning, which offered a good range of dishes for $20 (continental) or $25 (cooked) per person. We didn't have dinner in the hotel restaurant, so can't comment on that, but there are many restaurants, take-away places and convenience stores in the immediate locality. All in all, this was another very enjoyable stay, and we wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Mercure again.

Reviews.Title: “A simple and smart facility”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During my short visit at Sydney, the hotel facility provided much comfort and courtesy. The right flavor of Australian culture located in the right part of the city. The facility is a four star one, modest in scale. It was made to cater the Sydney Olympics. Today the hotel offers a contemporary lifestyle for travelers seeking comfort and flexibility at all ends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great loacation”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9am in the morning and staff was able to check me in to my room. Check-in was fast and friendly. Room and bath were very clean. Bed was excellent, a great sleep. Rooms are very quiet, no noise from the outside hallways or from the street. As far as value for price paid, the only thing one gets is the room. Internet is $22 a day for continuous 24 hours which is a definate rip off, or $10 for one hour. There is a McDonalds across the street which offers free wifi, which is where I did all my computer work from. There is also a buffet breakfast which is around $12, I did not participate in that as I paid $5 at Mcdonalds and had the free wifi. There is also a business center, which of course costs money to use. There are many very inexpensive internet businesses in the area at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ejc-free
Reviews.Content: Booked a s a suitable city centre meeting venue - only to find that that means on a traffic island surrounded by rail lines, roads and noise. Rooms like those you get in a cheap motel - hair dryer stuck to the wall, mean with towels and the food was just appalling and very expensive. I could not sleep due to road noise and people down in the streets shouting, throwing up etc. It is not the sort of area you want to walk alone in at night nor is is "close" to anything" you need to take a train / bus or taxi. Granted the staff are pleasant but when one of your party ends up in hospital because of the food it is the icing on the cake as far as never recomending this place to anyone. the swimmong pool is badly managed with way too much clhlorine - so the water quality is poor and probably not very healthy and the fitness centre is laughable for it lack of equipment

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: unclephil12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Oct. 2009 and was very happy with the hotel. Good value as we paid just under $100 Aus per night. The location was quite good as it is right by Central Station it took no time at all to get to the hotel from the airport by train. There are lots of inexpensive places to eat near the hotel. It takes about a 15 min. walk to get to the free bus to go down to Circular Quay which is a real plus. The room was very clean and modern and the bed was very comfortable and included a small fridge. It was made up, cleaned and towels replenished each day. We were on one of the higher floors so the noise from the busy street was not an issue. The only minor downside was that internet access was expensive but I found that was the case will all hotels we stayed at in Australia, whereas many hotels in North America offer free internet access. There is a small pool on one of the top floors in which we swam a couple times later at night, and was a relaxing way to end the day. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ChristineCharlotte
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very good location next to the central station. The view was not that great, nor was the central heating... Sydney can be ratehr cold in the winter. The breakfast was good and offered many choices depending on one's diet. The internet connection was fast. For a Mercure Hotel, I was susprised not to see a better choice of european TV channels, especially french. Still, the croissants were perfect. In sum, the hotel is not great luxury, but is very functional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nigs-Baz
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that we have stayed at this hotel. It is very well placed for getting around the city - you have Central Station almost on your door step. The staff at the hotel were super efficient, going out of their way to see that your needs were catered for. We will certainly be back. Thanks for another great time.

Reviews.Title: “Handy place nice modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: harrypet
Reviews.Content: Typical Mercure standard - next to the Central station nice restaurant and efficient staff surprisingly quiet given it's busy location nice to recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAFF, GOOD LOCATION, CLEAN, COMFORTABLE, QUIET, FAMILY FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: TandemCreative
Reviews.Content: The staff here are the hotels main asset. Without exception every person we came in contact with was friendly and went out of their way to to help. The chaps at the concierge desk deserve special mention for being able to answer every question we had and dealing with a couple of small problems with our room very efficiently. The breakfast here is a must if you have kids on tow as there are not any good cafes within walking distance (no McDonalds does not count) and even if you do find one it is going to cost far more to eat outside the hotel with a family. The deal was kids eat free so for $40 - $50 you can eat a huge breakfast. For those who need it like me there is even gluten free bread and cereal. Our room was a large deluxe family room on the top floor which was comfortable and clean (although showing signs of wear in the bathroom). This was great for getting to the pool and gym on the same level. The hotel is near the train station (no you can't hear the trains at all - our room was VERY quiet) and it is so easy to get to and from the airport. Recommended over shuttle and taxi which take much longer especially in bad traffic and can work out more expensive for a family as you only pay for one child on public transport. Location to good eating places was not great unless you like Asian food as it is near Chinatown but transport is fairly cheap and efficient so no problem getting to other areas at night. The hotel restaurant was very good for adults but perhaps not a great choice with kids as the menu is a bit limited for them. I think this hotel represents good value for money and made us realise how important the friendly service was to our overall impression of the Mercure For just this reason alone we would highly recommend this hotel as this level of service is rare (and we have travelled a lot!).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jobell66
Reviews.Content: Mercure Hotel Sydney was quite good value for money if you go for the weekend package which included buffet breakfast, late checkout and $50 food and beverage voucher. Location was not as close to the city as we would have liked but the staff are excellent and it is a short walk to Central Station. The rooms have been renovated, good king size bed, but the bathrooms need updating and the shower pressure is very poor - lucky only stayed 2 nights. Breakfast was your average buffet - go early as it gets busy - overall quite a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for Sydney City with professional service.”
Reviews.Author: Mick111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights through work. Very professional staff and atmosphere. Situated across the road from Central Station with main bus stop a 10 second walk away. For exploring the main city of Sydney it is an ideal base. Breakfast great. All in all nothing to complain about. If you can get a deal, grab it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sootystravel2
Reviews.Content: Location This hotel isn't the closest to the main attractions (the bridge, the rocks etc) but it is literally on top of the central station, and once you buy a pass its only a few minutes from everything. Is an excellent base and very near to the chinese area. Rooms Spacious and the bathroom is nice and is cleaned every day. Was told we had a city view but it was only if you craned your head at the window, but we'd booked one anyway. Food We didn't sample the food so can't comment. The breakfast did seem expensive - I think it was between Â£15 - $20 AUS. Hotel facilites The gym and pool was good for a quick use. Its not overly packed out with equipment but then we were on holiday so weren't there to exercise! It does though have an excellent view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “very large rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: sgaiter
Reviews.Content: If you will be using public transportation for area's in and around Sydney and would still like to be able to walk to nearby attractions this is a good place to stay. The hotel is very nice and the staff are very helpful. The room we had was quite large with 2 queen beds a small sofa, chair and desk with wifi hook up. The closet was huge and was able to accomodate all our luggage so it was not in our way. Our room was a corner room and had lots of windows. I would recommend this hotel for anyone travelling in Sydney. We were able to walk to Darling Harbour and China Town and Paddys Market. Lots of restaurants and the food at the Hotels Restaurant was very good. The bus transit is located right behind the hotel as is the train. Lots of amenities and an indoor pool on the 14th floor which was heated so even in the winter you can play. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, vacationers or business.

Reviews.Title: “Good location... close to most attractions”
Reviews.Author: APRS
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to location, close to Central Railway Station (minutes walking distance). Especially good and easy to get from and to Sydney Airport via the Airport Line (AUD$15.00 each way - 13 minutes travel time). Internet (wired and wireless) a little expensive at AUD$10.00 an hour or AUD$22.00 a day. Easier to walk across the road to McDonalds which has free WiFi - one hour or 50MB limits. Eurocar Rental cars have a desk there and on site parking of the car (saves on the surcharge for airport service, plus the train is much quicker than any car). Ideal for business traveller, nice staff and pleasant place to stay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sydneyshasha
Reviews.Content: my friend and i was not satisfied when we entered into standard room. but receptionist was very nice, he upgraded us immediately.the hotel is quite nice and modern, room is clean and bright but toilet is a bit small. i also did group work with my classmates. sales manager jennifer met us and gave us great help. i really want to thank her!

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff make all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: violin1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Mercure. We booked via wotif.com and got an unbelievably great rate. We were expecting a basic room for what we paid but WOW, on arrival we got a free upgrade to a city view room with balcony!!!!! The first thing that strikes you as you enter the hotel is the staff. Every single member of staff that you come across in this hotel is just excellent. Immaculately groomed, bright, polite,courteous and foccused on helping the guests. The concierge guys are famous here on Tripadvsior and I would say that all of the staff team in this hotel are worthy of that recognition. Our room was a good size with a very comfy double bed, desk and chair. Nice big TV with digital channels, Foxtel and a good range of pay-for-view latest release movies. We had ample storage cabinets, a safety box, little fridge, tea and coffee making provisions. The room furnishings and decor are modern, in excellent condition and the entire room and ensuite are a credit to the housekeeping staff in terms of cleanliness. Sleep quality for us was excellent. Even though the hotel is located on a busy city interesction the street noise is not an issue in the rooms. PAYG WiFi is available in the lobby and resturant bar area. PAYG internet in the rooms is via an RJ45 plug in connector. A MacD less than 10 minutes walk away at the Entertainment Centre has free WiFi. Eating wise there is a great array of fast food outlets and vibrant, colourful Chinese and other Asian resturants in the immediate and near vicinity. If that is not your style then you are in luck because the in hotel resturant is really good. The menu includes some very stylish and imaginative dishes including:- seafood, meats and vegetarian options. The service and food presentation are both excellent and the prices are very reasonable. Although we did not breakfast in the hotel ourselves; other guests that we spoke with rated the breakfast very highly. The hotel also has a great room service; the range, style and quality of food matching that available in the resturant. The service is available 24 hours a day and a very small charge applies for the courteous and prompt delivery. BE WARNED though, this room service is addictive!!! My wife really enjoyed the swimming pool on the rooftop while I sat on the balcony sipping wine (terrific bottle shop on Ultimo Road, 5 mins walk) and looking out across the city view. We are planning our next visit to Sydney later in the year and we will be staying at the hotel again. Full marks to Mercure Sydney from us and Thomas, I envy you for being able to work in such an environment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twiggy74
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be clean, comfortable with friendly staff. We stayed on the 13th level in the Privilege Room, and had some view of the city. Unfortunately there is a smaller building in front of us that had this horrible un-used sign on top of it's roof. Obviously it use to be used before the Mercure was built. I felt sorry for the people on the floors below us as they wouldn't of had a very nice view. The room was clean with a King Bed. The bathroom was a little out dated with shower over bath, but it was clean. It was a good room for what my partner needed as he was there for a conference. The hotel location is good if you are wanting public transport, or to be in the middle of Chinatown, otherwise I wouldn't reccommend it for location. Unfortunately Chinatown has quite a few homeless people. There wasn't much variety of restuarants except Asian, which had nice food, but more variety restaurants would be good. There is a McDonalds, KFC, Subway and Gloria Jeans across the road, but the employee's are not very good at speaking english. The food in the hotel was excellent. As we couldn't find much on the streets, we decided to eat at the hotel in the Four Elements Restaurant. The food and service was wonderful. We had the Tapa's type menu and it was delicious. We hired a car from the hotel, which was easy and the staff were very helpful and friendly. If you are wanting to go to Sydney to see the sites, I would stay closer to the city, but this hotel is good for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: coco023
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of 6 nights at the hotel, and must say we thoroughly enjoyed the convenience of having just about everything right at our doorstep...Chinatown, paddy market, Central railway station, and buses etc all within walking distance.Our standard rooms were clean, comfortable and had a quiet facing. Concierge service was impecable. Both Alex and James really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Will definitely be back and recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Sydney for the first time. Cheers. Singapore traveller

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: BlueGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to go to a graduation at the University of Sydney and this hotel was close by. We caught the train from the airport to Central Station and it was a very easy walk to the hotel from there. Each member of the staff that we came across was extremely helpful and friendly. There were 2 small corner stores very close to the hotel and a McDonalds, KFC and a Subway also very close by which were very handy when needing a quick bite to eat, especially since we were travelling with our son. The hotel was only a short taxi ride to the University and was also a very central location to walk to Darling Harbour (about 20 mins), Chinatown and Paddys Markets. Being so close to the train station, it was also very easy to get to Circular Quay (to go to Taronga Park Zoo) and to other locations. Even though it was close to the train station, there was no noise at all, either from the trains, traffic or anything else. We had a King Bed Deluxe room whch was very roomy and the bed was extremely comfortable. We also saw one of the standard rooms and, although it wasn't as roomy, it would have still have been quite adequate. We had booked on a half price sale, so for us it was excellent value. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Globaltraveller55
Reviews.Content: Centrally located on George Street within easy walking distance of shops,attractions,bars and restaurants. Friendly welcome on arrival,allocated a spacious and comfortable room, spotlessly clean on 12th floor with great views. First night, ate casually in bar in lobby where staff were most helpful. Breakfast was buffet style with good selection of hot dishes suiting most cultural tastes.Ate dinner in main restaurant on 2 nights, food well prepared and tasty with a good selection of Australian wines.Overall, a most comfortable stay with no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: CeeJay55
