Reviews.Content: Booked Mercure Sydney George Street on Hotel club 1st night booked (included breakfast) 2nd night through hotel (did not inlcude breakfast) and asked them to link my bookings and breakfast was included. When I arrived no links were made and agin asked staff to stay in the same room. After dinner on the 1st night at about 11pm I asked if I could swap my paid breakfast for the next I was advised that no breakfast was listed and had I bring the hotel club voucher once again to reception to confirm breakfast. I could not be bothereered so I did it the next morning. What an inconvenience all this was. TV did not work on the 1st night it was a new system, staff tried to fix it before left for dinner. When I returned that night after dinner it still did not work. I called recpetion and advised that I would be out all day please fix the TV. Next morning I reminded them to fix the TV. After a long day working all I wanted to do was have room service and watch TV and an early night as I had early flight next day. The TV was not working I called reception 3 times and it took them an hour 20 minutes for a staff member to come to my room. He reset TV and it did not work. I called reception them again, they offered for me to change rooms! By this time 9.30pm just did not want any one in the room. This is very poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Overcame initial bad front desk experience for an enjoyable stay in a comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mick M
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings about staying here because of an earlier problem at the booking desk. I booked through lastminute for an earlier date but had accidently input the wrong date. Having paid in advance I expected the hotel to be a bit understanding and perhaps offer me a discount or something ...... but no. The duty manager was happy to take our money and send us on our way without a room. A few emails to the general manager later and at least the Mercure was able to offer a "special rate" which was in fact equivalent to the lastminute rate. I decide to stay in November 2009 and, despite still being annoyed by the unprofessional way the front desk staff treated me, was quite impressed by the hotel. Its rooms are well appointed albeit a little small and very comfortable and clean. We had a nice view down George street and its a skip to the station and walking distance to Chinatown and Darling Harbour etc. Recommended but don't take no for an answer at check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing after reading so many good reviews”
Reviews.Author: sukai_25
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review beofre, let alone a bad one, but our stay at the Mercure started on the wrong foot, and ended that way. Check-in wasn't a problem, but got up to the room to find that it was a smoking room. I rang the front desk to ask for a change (because of allergies, and the smell was aweful!) but was told that there weren't any rooms left, and that I should have specified when we checked in that I didn't want a smoking room (mind you, I was never provided that opportunity). The best they could offer was to come and spray the room with air freshener. My husband proceeded to go back downstairs, and after talking to a different person on the front desk, we were moved to a non-smoking room, no fuss, no worries. After returning to the hotel after an evening out in town, we got into bed, only to noticed that the sheets didn't feel quite right. I pulled back the duvet and top sheet to find that the bottom sheet on the bed didn't even cover the bed, a whole foot and a half of the mattress and protector were sticking out! It looked like the cleaning staff had ran out of queen sheets and thrown a single sheet on sideways. Suffice to say, it was a pretty uncomfortable stay. The hit-and-miss of the staff certainly didn't help - don't think I'll be rushing back to stay here, despite excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: anoopcosmos
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location. Very near to central station, bus stop at railway square. One can get 555 free bus at very near stop. Darling harbour, paddy market & china town is at walkable distance. Concirege staff is very helpful. we reached 4hrs before our checkin time. They provided us hospatility room to take rest and have cup of tea. This was great help after flight of 14 hrs. They gave us room before our check-in time. Swimming pool was small but has nice location on top floor. Kids enjoyed in swimming pool. We had a great stay with nice value in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel especially for business travelling or short trips.”
Reviews.Author: solo_traveller12
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful. My room, although a little small, was clean and presentable. The bed was comfortable and the tv worked fine. The only negative comment I can give is room service was not up to standard. The staff member was polite and courteous, however the food delivered took 1.5 hours to arrive and was then cold. The main meal of ravioli was so oily and the fruit salad had little, if any taste. There are heaps of places to get decent dinners or takeaways nearby such as chinatown or further along george street. That is what I did for the remainder of my dinners, half the price and much better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would come back”
Reviews.Author: Notpicky28
Reviews.Content: Check-in/out was easy and hassle-free. The concierges were very helpful. The room was nice with queen bed, large TV, internet access and bathtub. Restaurant and room service were good. As it turned out it was cheaper to have breakfast in bed than to go to the restaurant for the buffet :) Convenient location near Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: annieandhamish
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to location for a business meeting. It is fairly centrally located and also close to Chinatown. Our room was booked direct with the hotel on their website and included breakfast for $129 - basic room. It was more than adequate for a very brief overnight stay. If I were staying for leisure I would have paid the extra to upgrade to a better room. The staff were welcoming & efficient, noise was not a problem, the room was clean & in good condition and the bed comfortable. So it ticked all the boxes at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Kagga1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was very near to family and as i think i have made clear the location is fabulous, next to bus stops and train stations, very near circular quay and darling harbour etc. The hotel itself....the room was nice, great TV channels for English speakers ( they have a pay view or interactive japanese tv thingymajig) Jade the assistant manager is fab, as are concierge. On the down side, they gave away our pre-paid hotel room to someone else , putting us in a non smoking room and the tv did not work, after a 2 day flight that was just annoying, we were upgraded to a city view. Room service was incredibly slow and had to be chased up twice, two other times it was fine, our room key stopped working twice and our smartbar card would stop working after one go which meant a trip downstairs or a humphy call to reception. the cleaning was basic. I would stay here again because of the location and I think it could be a fabulous hotel if they could iron out a few customer service issues. I think it is worth saying this again just because they were such a delight, concierge are amazing ( Adam especially).

Reviews.Title: “We were happy during our stay"”
Reviews.Author: Lucystupiddog
Reviews.Content: After reading some negitive reviews about this motel, I was a bit nervous about our choice. We were staying for 9 nghts so cost was a factor. We shouldn't have been worried. The staff were excellent, friendly and ready to offer great advice on what to see and do. The room was smallish but clean. There was a walk to the free city bus but all in all I would definately recommend this motel for the price. It was very affordable in comparision to most other central Sydney accom, central to transport, clean and most of all the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. We didn't eat in the motel, as there were lots of cheaper options very easily accessable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasing hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Schnapper
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Sydney is a good standard tourist hotel, located adjacent to Central railway station. It is handy to Chinatown and Darling Harbour, but away from the central retail area and even further away from the Sydney CBD, so not recommended for business travellers. We had a king room, located on the corner of the floor and it was spacious, comfortable and well equipped. Very good option for a family of three. It overlooked a major bus station and our 6th floor room was a bit noisy in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “High rise Sydney”
Reviews.Author: teignmouthlass
Reviews.Content: We booked the Mercure because we would be arriving in Sydney early in the morning and they have a hospitality suite where we would be able to take a shower - this really made a difference to the rest of our day! Be prepared for other guests being let into the room whilst you are using it though!! We found all the staff to be polite and helpful, and the hotel also has a taxi rank right outside, which was particularly useful when we had to leave for a 6am flight back home! The hotel is located close to Central Station, and about a 45 minute leisurely walk up to Circular Quay via St James Park. It's a busy area, but once inside the hotel it's not too noisy. Our room was on the 14th floor so we had quite a view across the city (though unfortunately not to any of the main sites). I think the rooms on lower floors have probably been refurbished and they are working their way up - the decor was a bit tired, but the room was functional and comfortable, so no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “No worries mate”
Reviews.Author: Msgeocat
Reviews.Content: 'No worries mate' are the words that come to mind when thinking of this hotel. Not for any other reasons than it is a great hotel where we had no issues at all. The rooms were clean and well appointed. It was located in a good location - not exactly Circular Quay but close enough to get to everything (Sydney downtown is fairly large). It was close to public transport and the staff at the hotel were more than willing to give advice on how to get to places. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were serviced to a very nice standard each day - so lovely to come back to a nice clean room! We didn't have any problems with noise and work refreshed and ready for a days sightseeing. The lobby looked very nice and the pool was something quite special - so bring your swimwear. We didn't get a chance to visit the resturant onsite, but there is a huge array of great places to eat all around. I am a big fan of Mercure hotels - a great brand - nothing overly fancy - but somewhere that you can stay and really enjoy the place you are visiting. Plus they are great value which means you have more money to spend on other things during your vacation. Next time we are in Sydney we will be at Mercure for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmm... Not in a hurry to return”
Reviews.Author: Eklasse
Reviews.Content: Normally for work have stayed at the nearby Medina Executive, but due to last minute shedule changes there was no room at the inn. Therefore was booked in here. Good position, ,and looks promising but the room was just average, was put in a wheelchair access room (which was OK) but the street noise, street side jackhammering til 10.00pm and noisy clients moving around outside made it difficult to get rest. Popular with Asian tourist groups as its a good position, but with respect to them - this group at the hotel were very noisy and yelled to each other down hallways no matter the time. The breakfast was due to open at 7.00am and there was a nukmber of people waiting at that time - but a few left as at 7.10am the polace hadn't opened! No apologies made, Not in a rush to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel... shame about the maid leaving my door open all day!!”
Reviews.Author: dreamweaver2611
Reviews.Content: Me and my Girlfriend stayed at the Mecure Sydney for 4 nights just recently in one of the Privilege Rooms. Room was very spacious, I had requested a King bed when booked but only ended up with a double which was no real problem. I found it strange that for a room booked for 2 guests there was only 1 pair of slippers and 1 bath robe. Room Service was fine, we had breakfast in bed on the last day and it was fine. Our only real concern was when we returned one day, at around 7pm to find our room door was open. The maid hadnâ€™t pulled the door shut when she vacated the room. Luckily nothing was taken from the room, baring in mind our passports, jewelry and clothes were all inside. I immediately went downstairs to voice my concern and I spoke with a manager by the name of Jeremy (I think thatâ€™s what he was called). I was a little surprised by the fact that there was no form of compensation or goodwill gesture made (perhaps a bottle of wine, dinner etc). All he did was apologise. II am not one to complain or try and get some â€˜freebiesâ€™ but I was just slightly concerned with the room being left open and then surprised by the management response. All in all a pleasant stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Enough - but barely.....”
Reviews.Author: rafalution_2009
Reviews.Content: Reviews for this hotel has certainly been mixed, either this hotel gets an excellent rating or, there would be a very recent review which basicallly massacred the hotel for its service. I have been travelling very frequently, and I hope my review would be decent enough:- Location: The Mercure is located just off George Street - one of Sydney's most notable city streets. Renowned for being busy round-the-clock with many corporate/business high rises, this street begins in the north end of Sydney in The Rocks, near the Sydney Harbour Bridge and extends to the southern end of the city, near Central Station. Well, this hotel is located next to the Railway Station and is nearer to Chinatown or Sydney Airport compared to the other hotels in Sydney's Central Business District. Unfortunately, George Street is at least 3km long (I think) and the Mercure is located in the opposite end of the CBD. Hotel: This hotel is not anywhere near to a 4 star rating. Barely 3 star in fact. The room is decently sized but the interior feels a little bit dated, bare (no slippers or complimentary bottles of water), it does not give you the luxurious, desirable, comfortable sort of feeling, the feeling that after a long, tired day, you would like to retire in the comfort of the room. The interior of the bathroom is pretty undesirable - floor has yellow and white tiles?!! And, apart from the very basic toilet/tissue paper, shampoo, soap, towels and hair dryer (yes, I'm not kidding you), there is nothing else!!! But most importantly, the mattress/bed sheets were clean enough. Service: The concierge was helpful enough to recommend a decent Italian restaurannearby. Reception was ok. No issues about the service - I guess I haven't experienced anything complicated during my stay. My only complaint is having to pay for internet connection (AUD5 for 1/2 hour - in this day and age, does anyone still charge for internet at such prices?!!!). Certainly this isn't a business hotel - more for tourists and cabin crew) Breakfast: Selection was average. It gets a bit crowded betweeb 8-9am, and you may have to queue for a while. There's a coffee machine for your lattes but the coffee prepared was not hot. I guess the management needs to look at it. Or for hot coffee to be constantly served to the guests. This is the 1st time I need to make my own coffee during breakfast at a 3/4 star hotel. I would only recommend this hotel if some improvements are to be made to the hotel by the management. But I am certainly impressed with the response from Thomas Brand, Director of Sales and Marketing, who certainly took the effort to reply to every review in Trip Advisor (putting most other hotels to shame, in fact). Some of the reviews are certainly "near impossible" to reply.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was very good, location is excellent, most of the staff were polite”
Reviews.Author: Mercure_Singapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Mercure Sydney for 3 nights. Liked our stay very much. It's located close to the Central Station and lots of restaurants / KFC / Mac etc around. Staff were polite and helpful (most of them) especially John from the Conceirge. Rooms were quite clean. Overall enjoyed our stay and would recommend this to any tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service- never again!”
Reviews.Author: dcmk1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business trip recently as i was booked by the travel agent at their recommendation. I had no clue about this hotel but foolishly trusted the travel agent. All i can say now is never again! While the hotel is not all bad - in fact it looks rather newish and rooms looks like they have been refurbished although tiny in size - what left a bad mark was the SERVICE - terrible - perhaps i was travelling on a hotel voucher maybe they felt they could be rude to me from reception to concierge to operator to restaurant - i found the hotel to cater more to tourist class and tour groups and air crew - you had to queue to check in and queue again for breakfast every morning - restaurant is packed and staff couldn't care less - no coffee mugs and no coffee one morning! and no food replenished it was like a fish market! The concierge is downright rude and so is the front desk staff- no courtesy no smile just plain rude and nasty. When i calld for bathroom amenities one night as they forgotten to place it in my room /replace - my call to housekeeping was directed to reception - the satff said it should be there and i said no, then she said will send it up - guess what - they never did, When i checked out at 1pm i was told to pay AUD20 for late check out - very firm and no flexibility at all. this is really one of those hotels really for tourist and tour groups - i will never stay here on business ever again - for what i paid i could add a bit more and go to the Hilton or another respectable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sethyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for for 5 days while on holiday in Australia. Excellent room on the 7th floor, we booked a city view room and thats what we got. Room was very comfortable and more than big enough for 2 people. Staff very friendly, and helpfull when needed. Room had tea and coffee making facilties which were replenished each day, am in room safety deposit box (which was free to use), and a large flat screen TV. The rooms also come with a fridge, but don't be shocked to find it empty! The 'mini bar' is now a vending machine in the hallway, where you buy what u want by swiping your room card, you can then use the fridge to keep the bits in, or just do what we did and buy it outside the hotel! Much cheaper! The bathroom was also nice and spacious, and to a high standard of decor. I must also add that the bed in the room was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in!! Location wise, this Hotel is very good. It is down the south end of George Street, but being right next to Central Station and the Bus Terminal (Railway Square) it is very accessable. Hotel to Circular Quay by foot, straight down George Street will take you about 20 minutes. So not too bad! Also just 5 minutes walk to China Town/Paddys Market and another 5 minutes from there to Darling Harbour, so all in all its very nicely placed. Didn't use it msyelf but the Hotel also has swimming pool and gym on the top (14th) floor. Looked nice especially if you go for a swim in the evening when the floor to ceiling windows overlook the twinkling lights of Sydney!! I believe the pool is open until midnight. Thouroughly enjoyed my stay in this hotel and would definetly recommend and even stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Still a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: umsums
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Mercure Sydney and like my first I could not fault any aspect of the stay. The rooms are clean, beds really comfortable and rooms service was excellent, yes the bathroom needs an update but I wasnâ€™t hanging out there too much. I am not sure what some of the previous reviewers were expecting maybe they thought the hotel was Raffles in Singapore. All the staff that I dealt with were very courteous, helpful and were willing to help me. I needed to organise a few last minute work reports and the reception team bent over backwards to help me out, thank you. Also the concierge team recommend a fantastic restaurant up the road in Darling Harbour which was appropriate for me to entertain a client. The hotel is one of the best 4 star hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: DenverAnn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mercure near the central train station for 7 days. It was comfortable enough to make it home for a week. The pool was pretty tiny but it was fine just for a quik dip or some laps if no one else was in the pool. We never went to the restaurants because we were so close to many other choices. The location was right near China town and we walked to many places though after a while we just hopped on a bus or the train.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: nickvegas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and I really like the hotel. Staff are friendly, the bar is a great place to sit and watch the cricket and you cannot beat the location as it is right next to Central train station and the bus stop. Many restaurants nearby, Darling Harbour, Surry Hills are within walking distance. The room I had was very roomy, quite and very, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This is barely a three star -dont bother”
Reviews.Author: GrahamEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice during February, the first time during the Edinburgh review and the second time subsequently. The first time breakfast was a nightmare with insufficient and poor choice of food especially as you are paying upwards of 24 dollars for it! Second time didnt bother with food , much cheaper and better to eat out. The hotel is a long walk from Darling Harbour and we experienced urinating drunks at the bus stop outside the hotel. Lovely!! We were allocated the disabled room for some reason and immediately complained but were told our room couldnt be changed till the next day so we could not unpack. The room still had dirty tissues in the waste bin and a dirty cup and spoon in the washbasin. We raised all these comp[laints in the lift with the deputy manager(nice chap) one day who seemed surprised. Speaking to some of the other guests he should not have been. Pool is grotty situated up some poorly decorated back stairs. Only highlight was concierge service which unlike reception had all the information and was quite happy to send time sorting out travel arrangements. In a nutshell dont bother .

Reviews.Title: “Only as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: scubagirl100
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel did not have our reserved room available. My husband and I ended up in a small, crappy room with twin beds. We were moved the next day to a city view room. Housekeeping failed to change sheets as requested and did not leave us wash clothes or hand towels; only bath towels (which were quite nice.) Not sure houskeeping did anything more than make the bed and take the tip. Bathroom smelled like pee. We were both eager to leave this hotel. Location is in Chinatown, Darling harbor and other sites are a hike. Bar is reasonable and service good. Concierge services are very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Mercure suited my purposes”
Reviews.Author: Aloushka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and ideal to all forms of transport. I spent the night here last year after the Andre Rieu Concert. When the concert finished, I caught the train from Olympic Park to Central Station with the rest of the crowds and as it was only a five minute walk to the hotel, it suited my purposes perfectly, as it saved me trekking home alone on a train so late at night. The room was very clean and tidy and I had a lovely city skyline view from my window. As I was high up, the noise of the parading traffic below did not disturb my slumber at all. I was also given a free drink voucher too, which was nice. Will definitely make use of this hotel in the future. Aloushka, Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable hotel”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure Sydney and it was a good one. The room is after all very basic but yet very comfortable. The size is just nice and the location is great. It is definitely not in the harbour side, a long walk to get there!!! However it is located near to many access for transportations. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel and Central station is just next to the hotel. So it is very easy for you to move around. Breakfast was good but tend to be very packed in the morning. Staff isn't very friendly but it is still tolerable. All in all, I would say it was a good stay. Will I come back? Perhaps, though I might search for other hotels nearer to the harbour side.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody awful.”
Reviews.Author: Bluey2810
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose to stay here over New Year in Sydney... Bad decision. The hotel itself is definitely not 4 star, but our real issue was with the staff, who are completely incompentent and treated us badly. We were given the wrong information about the cancellation policy, where we were led to believe by the staff that we would receive a full refund upon cancellation. This was not the case - it took a few weeks, a lot of phone calls and a lot of stress to receive even half of the money back. It was particularly frustrating when the member of staff who gave us the incorrect information lied about ever talking to us. We ended up staying for one night, when even the receptionist tried to charge us for our included breakfast and was reluctant to give our despoit back. A poorly run, unwelcoming hotel... Avoid it like the plague. There are lots of nice hotels in Sydney, and this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge great...rooms nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Snout117
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing very exciting about this hotel. The room reminded me of a university dorm room, but it was at least clean. I thought the location was good and I will say the concierge service was excellent as they really helped us make the most of our time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: middlemanontheroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just a night on business. The room was quite small specially because of the fact that there were two double beds squeezed into the room (a good thing perhaps if you have family staying with you). Toiletries are very limited, you only get two small bars of soap and a small container of shampoo, nothing else (don't forget your toothbrush then!). Towels though were ample (because the room was really meant for at least 2 people). The bathroom is showing its age but nevertheless clean. I had room service for dinner and ordered the soup of the day and the tuna salad -- this meal was a pleasant surprise. The bed was comfortable. There was a desk to work on but it was rather small. There are other choices in the vicinity really but for someone who just needs a basic but comfortable hotel room to stay in, staying here should be all right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Austin_texasSurfer
Reviews.Content: Nice place but not 4 star.More like a 3 star Ramada in the states.Also not close to the harbor.Having said all that,its a good value for the dollar.Speaking of the dollar BRING YOUR WALLET TO SYADNEY! This is a vey expensive city and you will need lots of cash.For example the smallest bill is a $5.Coffe $4.40,dinner$50,gas $6.50 a gallon,cocktail$17.Cabs forget about it. I found my room clean and comfortable but had a view of the back of a billboard,decent breakfest buffet for $25.All in all what can you expect for $150 in Sydney.The hotels web site had a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kathiiy
Reviews.Content: We were in Syndey to catch up with friends from overseas. We took a priviledge room on the 13th floor and I certainly don't have any complaints about it. My partner loved the coffee machine! But at the end of the day, it was just anther hotel room, although it was clean, which a lot aren't!! Only complaint is that they charged us twice for parking, but one phonecall sorted that right out. Staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: milly99
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this hotel. Very limited toiletries, holes in the swimming pool towels, dowdy bathroom decor - these and other small things add up to give an overall poor impression. The pluses are the location (handy for Chinatown and Darling Harbour) and the fact that 2 adults and 2 children can share a room (two double beds)

Reviews.Title: “Far too basic for the money”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: Given the Mercure name, I was surprised at what I found in this hotel. I was given a room with a small bed, one pillow and no mini-bar. The furnishings were old, the TV tiny, and the carpet grotty. It had no in-room safe. The bathroom was tiny and offered few toiletries. Anything included was attached to the wall (squeeze bottles for soap, shampoo, etc). To top things off, the staff was rude. I wish I hadn't stayed here. I won't make the same mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it !”
Reviews.Author: MaryamSeb
Reviews.Content: Old stuff, poor bathroom, old dirty carpet.... we've stayed 5 nights in a room situated on 14th floor (which is supposed to be the best one!), from 29 Dec 2009 to 3 Jan 2010... the price of NYE was about 6 times higher than the normal price, but that's ok cause all hotels do the same thing but at least I would have preferred to have an acceptable room for that price! The hotel is a bit far from city centre but if you like walking you can walk... anyway I would say avoid it if you can find something better !

Reviews.Title: “OK but maybe wrong location”
Reviews.Author: teassoc
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Australia to visit our daughter and see the sites. We stayed in Sydney city for 7 nights, and 5 in Coogee Bay. We didn't have a good idea of where this hotel was when we booked it but it was described as central, which is true but we weren't really in the centre of places we wanted to be. It's at the edge of Sydney's huge chinatown district and main train station. We ended up getting taxis and buses to practically everywhere we wanted to be. Apart from that, the Mercure is OK but maybe in need of a little refurbishment. Room was a little on the small size but comfortable enough, and was kept clean. This was the standard Queen room but the Deluxe rooms I guess would have been better. Has a rooftop indoor swimming pool and several restaurants. We ate one evening in the bar area - it was not our best restaurant experience. Room service food we had one evening was however excellent. TV channels in the room were rather limited although good for sports. Movies were through the in-house but expensive pay-per -view system. We didn't have the hotel breakfast - we preferred to bring in coffee and pastries from a cafe just outside the hotel. Not difficult to get around from there. There is a free bus service for the shopping and downtown harbour area a 5 minute walk away. Sydney has a good bus service and not that expensive if you use travel cards. Regular bus service right outside the hotel. Sydney itself has lots of places where you can visit. We loved the China Garden, so pretty and different if you like that kind of thing. We visited Manley several times by ferry - about 30 to 40 minutes from the harbour. Lovely place with a nice beach. We were also very impressed with the Australians we met. Bit expensive though, particularly if you are visiting from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure - Excellent location & wow what a breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGilbert
Reviews.Content: I visited the Mercure Hotel on George Street Sydney prior to boarding a cruise. The hotel is centrally located (next to the central train station & by a bus terminus). The hotel is spacious & comfortable & the staff are courteous & helpful. The breakfast buffet was something else but in a good way. Hot & cold choices & SO MANY CHOICES I didn't know what to have first. PLEASE give this hotel a try when you're in Sydney - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: randombirdpr
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in a great location for seeing Sydney. We were there 12 nights and it was always a good night's sleep we got. Friendly staff and all over a good hotel. The only tip I would say to other travellers is not to bother with their breakfast. It is expensive at 25 dollars each and not that amazing, so save yourself some cash and head out in the morning and grab something on the way. There are loads of coffee places just ourtside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: whth2o
Reviews.Content: We felt this hotel was definitely worth the price for its location. We were able to do quite a bit of sight seeing within Sydney by foot. This included walking to the Sydney Opera House and the Royal Botanic Gardens. The rooms were nice and clean. There was nothing outstanding about them but we didn't expect them to be.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience From Start To Finish”
Reviews.Author: Barsha55
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have had the pleasure of staying at the Mercure Sydney on quite a few occasions, & have found that no request is too much of bother by any of the wonderful staff employed there. We always have the Queen Superior with a city view, & each room has been so clean, with all quality furnishings. We have had the buffet breakfast, the best we have ever had, had dinner at the Caboose Reataurant, & drinks at Eves all of which have been very pleasant experiences. It is so central to just about everything such as Darling Harbour, Theatres, China Town & shopping if you wish, at Broadway. If you want to relax or have an action packed vacation, I wound go no further than this hotel

Reviews.Title: “do not go there!! 4stars? yeah right”
Reviews.Author: VillageWorld
Reviews.Content: used to stay in 4 and 5star hotels when on business trips. this one has nothing to do with it. just to keep it very short. all in all terrible. only the concierge was ok. i wish i had stayed in a hostel..for 50$..there is no way it could have been worse (room, noise, view, service, pool, gym, bed)

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: paultry
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the usual things one needs, but nothing outstanding. A few things I don't like though: - housekeeping knocking on my door at 8am asking whether he could clean the room. I was still waiting for my breakfast to be delivered so I said no. I thought it a bit odd though. - housekeeper didn't clean my cups but left a note explaining that he/she wasn't sure whether i was still using it. Again, a strange experience for me. - no in-room minibar. There is a small fridge in the room but contains except milk for tea. Instead, drinks etc are offerred via vendor machines in the corridor which require a smart card to operate. Apparently this card is provided to guests upon check-in. I wasn't offerred one. -Had room service for breakfast but food was below average. - The roof top gym was a plus but it was too hot (don't think the aircon works there).

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we thought”
Reviews.Author: PeterGrant76
Reviews.Content: The location, described as adjacent to the central station, is not really so convenient: it's at least a 10-minute walk to where you can buy a rail ticket and the free and hop-on buses don't seem to pass close by. Our standard room was cramped with two double beds and only one chair, plus an air system that we turned off at night to avoid the draft. The bathroom was poor: no bath mat in a very slippery tub/shower, separate taps for the shower, meaning you froze or were scalded every time and a toilet with a weak flushing action even at the high setting. The buffet breakfast was fine but the restaurant was barely adequate for dinner. We could find no good dinner restaurant within short walking distance. The rooftop indoor pool, when not crowded, was a delight. The people at the concierge desk were excellent, going beyond the call of duty. On checkout we discovered a nice little wrinkle: an $11 charge as a penalty for not paying cash. The clerk pointed to a sign which apparently told us this when we checked in, but in the speedy process about which the hotel boasts, we must have missed it. Overall, just okay; wouldn't stay there again, though nothing was horribly wrong.

Reviews.Title: “the best birthday present ever”
Reviews.Author: marshmellogal
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were very suprised at how modern and spacious the loby was. But the best part was the room it was a very large corner room although it over looked part of the railway station we could hear no sounds. The room was very tidy and very large which was awsome, we then ventured up to the pool and gymnasium which was rather small but still very modern and great looking. we did not stay for dinner but we took a cab into darlinhg harbour and saw a movie then had dinner at a great reasteraunt. I was slightly dissapointed about when i rang up to ask for information about the pillow menu becuse the lady wasnt much help at all. Breakfast was brilliant the next morning with a wide range of foods (the Waffles were the best). That day we went for a stroll up the street to check out the shops and we went and saw Chicago which was a nice surprise. The Mercure was a fantastic hotel and everyone we came across was so friendly and helpful a very modern upbeat exciting hotel definately thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HendryD
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but the view itâ€˜s not quite nice but itâ€˜s clean

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: rainbowLincolnshire_
Reviews.Content: Allowed to check in early on arrival from Airport, much appreciated, great start to holiday but from there on, things went downhill. View from room of a big black hoarding and we were on 10th Floor. Queued for Breakfast first morning 15 Minutes then allocated a table, went to Buffet bar came back to find table allocated to another couple. The purpose of our visit was to try to locate my wife's relatives who she had lost contact with in 1996. My wife is Chinese, and I did not realise how many Chinese (Asian) people there were in Sydney. On the Friday we started our search and due to a very helpful Taxi Driver who took us to the only address we had, where due we spoke to the mother of the couple who had puchased the house from a Chinese Lady, but her daughter was away on business but she would give her the message when she returned on Sunday/Monday. Lo and behold on Sunday we received a phone call from the cousin and consequently we had a very enjoyable time with her Aunty and 3 Cousins for the remainder of our stay, Eldest cousin actually took us to the Airport for our flight home. So even though the Hotel did not live up to our expectations the holiday was a sucess in every other way. But now to the Hotel, Housekeeping - Had to request top up of Beverages in room (tea & Milk) 3 out of 7 days, reception very good, had replenishments up to room in under 10 mins (we were on 10th Floor). Went out on 4th day at 9.30a.m. returned to room at 10.30p.m. to find room not cleaned or made up. Asking for Night Duty Manager, very nice and efficient, had room made up within 30 mins, defused my annoyance very efficiently but should not have happened. Following day saw Hotel Manager who stated room had a notice on door saying not to make up room, but room next door had notice on door but not ours. Why not have a 'Make up Room' Notice? When commenting about room view, told in no uncertain terms that to have city view is about 50 AUD extra, we only booked a standard room! Dealt with complaint very efficiently but said would get room made up while we went for Breakfast across the road, (10.30a.m.) and shopping. Returned to room about 1.30p.m. to find room not touched, rang manager asked to come to room, there within 5 mins, opened door and showed him room, his face a picture of astonishment (wish I had a camera at that point). We left room and went down to Lobby, I was seething, but after a cigarette outside and remembering the look on his face soon calmed me down and I could see the funny side of it. He then came to inform us room was made up. On our last day we were not left soap but by this time I was just happy to be leaving. Money changing, found a little Western Union Office Next to Eve's Place in hotel which changed money giving a better rate than the Hotel about 8c a GBP better and at Michel's outside the Front of the hotel by coach station a coffee and Bacon & Egg roll (Baguette) 8 Aud. Experience of Sydney, expensive, but the purpose of our Visit a Marvellous result, we are now in touch with Cousins by email. Hotel - Very Disappointed. said would come back to me, on one occasions did not. On final day we found no bar of soap left so had to use shower gel bottle for washing. Maybe I am old fashioned but I find soap far better than shower gel. All in all I was not impressed with this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: Chivers_i
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel whilst travelling around Australia. So there were a few places we stayed to compare. I have to say that we were very pleased with our choice for Sydney. When travelling around we need just a clean, comfortable room and some help from staff if needed. We got it all here. Our room was very spacious.The concierge desk was always very busy but the staff always found time for you. Check in was quick with pleasant staff. Walking distance to Darling Harbour (what a great night out) and buses downtown right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality”
Reviews.Author: traveloctopus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the start of the month at the end of a business trip, and upgraded to a Privilege room at the last moment. The bathrobes, sweets, free internet and 13th floor location made this a great idea, avoiding any traffic noise and allowing for extra levels of comfort. Room was well sized, bed was comfy, bathroom was adequate. All the staff were extremely accommodating. I didnâ€™t require minibar or restaurant service there as I ate dinner out and got take out drinks. Proximity to Central Station is a plus, as is proximity to great eateries in Chippendale. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean”
Reviews.Author: GenBren
Reviews.Content: The Mercure is solid - it has a good central location (several buses stop in front, as well as the city's light rail) that makes it easy to get to all the major sites. It's clean, and the staff is helpful - the concierge gave us some nice tips. And the pool has a great view! They charge way too much for internet though - over $20 AUD for 24 hours access. I'd recommend asking for a room on a high floor or in the back of the building - we didn't have any street noise, but rooms facing on the bus stop might.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: newyork2007
Reviews.Content: We were here as part of honeymoon, we had some plush 5 star hotels and some 4 star, as on a world trip. Our hotels were organised witha agent. From the brochure the hotel looked much better....i was disapointed with our room. They gave us a smoking room, we dont smoke, it smelt terrible. The room service, house keeping was not as good as expected. The hotel bar was closed one night for bank holiday...the bar upstairs closed at 10pm!!?? we were told "theres a bar across the street"...not very professional for a hotel whether it be a bank holiday or not, you would never get a bar close at that time in the UK or USA. Blue mountains is a must!

Reviews.Title: “recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: gorn-fishin
Reviews.Content: I found this place on the net, they had a spring special that included buffet breakfast for us ( 2 adults 1 child) which was superb. Rooms tidy & clean, pool lovely & warm. Expected to be charged extra for parking but was included. Turned up at 11.30 am on the day & they checked us in early which was great! Late checkout the next day & they still let us leave the car there until end of day! Location is excellent, walk to Chinatown, walk to central rail. Buses on the doorstep. Always felt safe even at night. Convenience stores all around, Macca's, KFC, Subway for the kids directly across road! Can't wait to stay there again, really enjoyed it & highly recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Always reliable”
Reviews.Author: kazz_usher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mercure many times, the Mercure is always reliable,its quite clean. Staff are always quite friendly and they have parking on site for decent amount per night. On this particular visit, I had just arrived from London with my hubby and little baby, The lady on reception was very friendly, and checked me in very quickly. The "bellboys" were also very friendly :) Rooms are nice but the bathrooms really are in desperate need of a makeover, the colours arent the prettiest in the world, but hey how long do you spend in a hotel room? Beds are comfy, and my sons cot was fine (just a simple travel cot) the cot was already set up in the room which was a major plus. I had breakfast included in the package, it was a nice buffet breakfast with quite a bit of western food to choose from. I wouldnt usually get breakfast if it wasnt included in a package as it is a bit pricy for what you get, there is a patissery just outside the Mercure, as is MacDonalds and other food outlets that would be a lot cheaper. All in all I would stay here again, its easy to get too, good location. In my opinion I dont think its a 4 star compared to other 4 star hotels in the area but its still nice :)

Reviews.Title: “A welcome relief”
Reviews.Author: Mxnau
Reviews.Content: After staying at a disgusting backpackers I desperately booked a room here even though I had already paid at the YHA. It was one of the cheapest in a central location. The room was a good size, everything was fine, my only complaint was the bathroom had mould in the grout and I found it disgusting, also the toilet kept running water after it was flushed, only stopping after I hit it hard every time. The shuttle to the airport was a good, cheap option and only took 15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Togepii
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mercure in Sydney in August 2009. It's in a good location, right by central station so it's easy to get around. I found I walked to most places, even up to the harbour didn't take too long. There are plenty of places to eat and convenience stores in the area. The rooms were a decent size and very clean. There was also a fridge which was useful. The TV was pretty big and had a good selection of channels. Used the hotel pool once which was very small but clean. The thai restaurant/bar next to the lobby is great, lovely food at a decent price and they have a happy hour with cheap wine and beer! Downsides to the hotel was no coin operated laundry and no complimentary wifi. But there is an internet cafe across the road which is cheap, $3 an hour I think. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lavender2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly good. It was cheap, so we weren't expecting any luxuries. The rooms were rather small, but were clean and had good sound proofing which meant that they were quiet. It was a nice cheap stopover for the night, and the included breakfast was really nice. The only negative was the check-in staff, who seem uninterested in their guests, which was a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: wTavcar
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 (2 adults & 2 kids(11 & 15)). We chose it after much searching, and write-ups here. We were not dissappointed. The location was great for exploring the city since you were a stone's throw from busses and trains. The staff was wonderful. The concierge was a gem. From organizing our outings to helping us retrieve a lost item on one of our tours he was an great help. Apart from that, the rooms were comfortable, the pool was OK. A little small. We did not try the restaurant so I cannot say. We were out and about all day long. I would DEFINITELY stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hellywobs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good value for money and all the staff I came across were courteous and friendly. The restaurant is good. The rooms are functional but fine for what we paid. The location is near the main railway station so not great if you want something more central to the main sights, although we did walk from Circular Quay to the hotel on our final night. We had a room-only package - I recommend the Hyde Park cafe (15 mins away) for breakfast and there is a place right outside which does breakfasts for commuters (and others in the station). Room service was quick.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel, especially the concierge!”
Reviews.Author: P.Knight
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from Australia and stayed for two nights at the Mercure Sydney George Street. Our stay was excellent, thanks mainly to the dedicated concierge service. The concierge booked our opera tickets and was extremely helpful providing info on the Blue Mountains etc. I was so impressed, I thanked the duty manager for the excellent service. What a difference from the Mercure Sydney Airport were the service at reception is dreadful. At George Street, the staff acted very professionally. I've read the other reviews and the truth is our circular room was beautiful, no complaints whatsoever. Breakfast was amazing, with a great choice and well stocked. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the central train stop, however there are free buses in George Street which you can get all the way down to the rocks. Great value and thanks to the concierge, a great way to save time and enjoy Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very good we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: o00hhhlalaa
Reviews.Content: Normally we are the type of people who like low budget accommodations.. simply so we can splurge on extras elsewhere. I wasn't sure what to expect by the mixed reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was a good standard size.. not small at all. The bed was soft. I noticed right away that they didn't give us very many pillows. Later I noticed that they had a pillow menu where you select what kind of additional pillows you want brought up. They had about six different varieties to choose from. I was also amazed by the espresso maker in our room. The directions were not to hard to follow, and they brought up fresh milk on demand every day for free! This coffee was by far the best I have ever had crafted in a hotel room and I was able to eliminate buying flat whites on the street :) The location of this hotel is perfect. George street is connected to everywhere you will want to go as a tourist. The bus is right there, and the train is right there. It only took ten min to get from the airport via the train, and that is a blessing when you are dealing with a 14 hour overnight flight! :) The bar Eves place was a fun place to get local brews. The thai food was REALLY GROSS THOUGH.. dont bother with it. We did not try the eatery on level one, I suspect it would be much better than the bar/thai food ;) I noticed some other reviewers commented on how the location is very noisy. When getting into bed I could barely here a bus go by once in a while (This was from floor 13, with earplugs in...) Overall the room was very quiet. The bathroom was large and clean.. They housekeeping attended twice a day... Fridge in room really helped us keep food costs down (however they do have it pre stocked so you have to shove stuff out of the way). we were so busy touring the city I didn't get a chance to use the other amenities like laundry and fitness eq/pool.. but my husband did state that the laundry facility only had one washer and one dryer. The concierge arranged for us to have a shuttle take us from the hotel to the airport when we left. It was 12$ (au) per person, but that was better than walking a little bit with all our luggage to the train and paying 16$ (au)per person. The only BAD SURPRISE we had, was at check out we had 11$ worth of "phone charges". I am not demarking the hotel in the rating for this because I didn't even pay attention to the cost when I picked the phone up. My friends who live in Sydney said the calls they made to the hotel were local and should be free, and I took their word for it. I was wrong. We only talked just briefly to arrange meetings.. talked under ten minutes and paid 11$ (au) so it wasn't a big deal. The other Surprise we had was the big TV in our room only had three channels! I guess that is pretty common in Australia and we didn't care at all because we didn't go there to watch TV! They also had on demand new release movies you could purchase for 15$, but like I said we were to busy to utilize that feature. Overall we will highly consider this hotel next trip to Sydney!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Travellers286
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Mercure Sydney, occupying a "Privilege" room (which we understand is the same as a standard room, with the addition of a coffee machine, a bath robe and slippers, and a few extras like a small box of chocolates). Our room was compact, but well equipped and with an interesting outlook over Central Station. We couldn't fault the very comfortable bed, the standard of cleaning nor the efficient air conditioning. Despite the hotel being located on a busy intersection, we heard no traffic noise and slept very well. A notable feature of the Mercure was the friendliness and efficiency of the staff, from the check-in desk to the hotel restaurant. We asked Housekeeping for a few extras on occasions, and on each occasion they were delivered very promptly. The Mercure is close to public transport (bus, train and light rail), and within easy walking distance of shops, restaurants, Chinatown and Paddy's Market. In effect, anywhere within central Sydney is accessible within a few minutes. The airport is easily accessible by train, or (as we did) by taxi for around $30. All in all this hotel offered exceptional value, and we would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was good staying there.”
Reviews.Author: javed_nazar68
Reviews.Content: Mercure at George Street is close to city center, 15 min walk to darling harbour, trendy restaurants, bars, I Max and many more...

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, if a little bland”
Reviews.Author: cobra_awsom
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May 2009 for just under a week. I know Sydney pretty well and the Mercure was a good base to get to most major sights and places. Of course, as has already been said, you tend to get what you pay for, and the hotel is not going to win any major design awards. Upon arrival I was slightly put off by an argument that was brewing between a disgruntled guest and the front desk, but otherwise our stay there was pretty unremarkable. The rooms were a bit grey but we were hardly ever there anyway. Bathrooms were tiled with a slightly tacky yellow. On the plus side, the hotel's location at the very foot of George Street meant that, relative to central Sydney standards, it was pretty quiet at night, even though it was near a major train station. Breakfast was served at the 1st Floor restaurant and service was brisk and attentive. The swimming pool was miniscule and grotty and the gym looked in desperate need of maintenance but to be fair had a pretty good view of the CBD from your vantage point on the treadmill. A special mention for the SmartBar on each floor: if all else fails and you don't get to sample Sydney's nightlife, then park yourself by the ubiquitous SmartBar and wind down the hours... Certainly not a hotel for those seeking a bespoke, pampered experience, but good enough if you just want the basics covered.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel at expensive rates”
Reviews.Author: karzrao
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels in Sydney. To stay away from this hotel would be an understatement. The rooms are ugly and very small at the expensive prices charged. The service at reception is pathetic and rude. The location for the price is very bad. It is at the southern end of the CBD.....quite a long walk to darling harbour and circular quay. There are a number of better hotels in Sydney at this price

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Kerrynann
Reviews.Content: Very grateful for the two children/two adults being allowed to occupy a room. Position of hotel just perfect to use the public transport system which we utilised to the max. Everything that was required was within walking distance. Room very clean and tidy - housekeeping staff very polite and I believe went that extra mile to accommodate our needs. Extra supplies (milk/coffee/towels) supplied without hesitation via front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and nice large room”
Reviews.Author: sarzamac
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed here twice, once in 2007 and once in 2009. We found both of our stays to be very pleasant. During our most recent visit, we arrived from the airport in the morning and upon checking in, the very friendly receptionist told us that our room was not yet ready but that she would call me as soon as it was. So we walked into the CBD and had a coffee and received a call within 30 minutes to let us know that we could check in to our room early. The room was quite large and nicely fitted out. It was a bit of a hike into the heart of the CBD but the hotel's proximity to central station is very convenient. The breakfast was delicious with a great variety of foods and great tea and coffee. However, we did stop by the restaurant one evening for coffee and dessert and while the coffee was quite good, the berry crumble was simply awful and very overpriced! A fab hotel, overall!

Reviews.Title: “Average but Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustMe54321
Reviews.Content: It is a comfortabel and clean hotel with reasonable-sized room and average deco. The staff were friendly and helpful when we requested a change of room. I don't think highly of the location of the hotel because it is by a very busy junction, so some rooms can be noisy (that's why we had to change our room). However it is handy to Chinatown and public transport (bus stops just outside the hotel and the Central Station is very close). For the price we paid (AUD 79 per room per night), it is good value for money. Overall it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but surrounding area not so good”
Reviews.Author: mteq
Reviews.Content: We were 2 adults (parents) and 3 grown and growing children, and we stayed for 4 nights in a triple and a double room. Both rooms were well furnished and presented. The triple had 3 'real' beds in it, and was said to be 'comfortable'. We had a double suite, which was very pleasant, large and spacious. The bathrooms were well equipped. The breakfast was served on the second floor, and was ok, but because this is a very busy hotel, there was a fair bit of queuing to get a table. The 2nd floor also had a bar adjacent to the restaurant. Wifi was available at a price as was an Internet cable connection in the rooms. If you find the hotel breakfast too expensive, there is a cafe in the bus area outside, which was very good, and a fraction of the hotel breakfast price. We were participating in a Conference held in the hotel. The facilities were very good, Overall we felt positively about this hotel. It is reasonably close to things in Sydney, but the location (at the end of George Street) is not the most salubrious of areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!! Totally Reccomend it!!”
Reviews.Author: Shilpjeet
Reviews.Content: I planned a short vacation with my sister in jan 2008. I was lucky enough to find a great deal of AUD 79 per night through the accor group wesite. considering the price and the location, the hotel was totally worth it. We had a city view room. There is a roof top pool which is mostly empty :-) worked mwell to our advantage. This time of the year is off peak season hence you are bound to get some great rates. Central station is like 2 minutes away. The station connects to all the suburbs very well. Hotel rooms were small but very comfortable beds. neat and clean but small bathrooms. You can walk up to darling harbour which would take you around 10-15 minutes. this is right on george street so ample shoppping once you walk towards town hall station :-) Totally reccomend it for travellers of all age.

Reviews.Title: “Commendable Service”
Reviews.Author: clumsyhumpy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Mercure btw May 12- 15 on an av. room rate of AU $139 (with breakfast). Though the hotel is not located at a central location, however it's easy to get by. With the bus interchange right next to the hotel and train station (central) not too far away. Nearby attraction includes Chinatown, Paddy's Market (5 mins walk) great for souvenirs & even darling harbour is about 15 mins by foot. Service at the front desk & concerige is good. Really helpful, making our trip fuss-free. In particular Alex from the concerige has been a great help in assisting with trip booking along with his colleague from the evening shift. Regretably, service staff at Caboose restaurant pale in comparison though. Stayed at the standard room which is just right for 2 person, with large flat-screen TV & a good choice of pillow menu. Though the toilet looks dated, its generally clean. Overall, a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: UMSK
Reviews.Content: Good Comfortable Stay. Centrally Located with easy access to most of Sydney City, Nice Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff....the stay here was a very nice experience overall

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Convenient Central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: HaggisKiwi
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here briefly before, but this time took full advantage of a Mercure sale to find ourselves accommodated at what is becoming our favourite Sydney hotel. Although conveniently located next to the central rail station & bus interchange, very little traffice noise can be heard from either of these valued public services. In-house services quickly corrected a couple of room issues - lack of tea bags & over-excited smoke detector. Two restaurants & convenience/tourist shop located withing the hotel. Thai style food served within the public bar & pokie room. Smaller more boutique menu served in the restaurant/business bar. AND a comprehensive room-service menu which seems to outdo both restaurants. Only faults I could think of are a super chlorine flavor of the pool & we were only given one facecloth/flannel between the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and child friendly”
Reviews.Author: bd69
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here more than once and less of the whingeing people! Some are never satisfied and seem to expect champagne service on a beer budget. It is not a 5 star hotel and does not claim to be so don't judge it by those standards. For a 4 star hotel in the CBD its brilliant, go and check out its competition if you don't believe me. If you want 5 star luxury then go and pay for it. I recently splashed out on a night in a premier grand harbour view room at the Shangri La to celebrate my birthday with my wife and it was fantastic. However, if we are taking the kids into the city for a few days then the Mercure is perfect. For around $100 less than I paid for one night at the Shangri La I have just secured 3 nights at the Mercure with buffet breakfast on the last morning. Very happy with that. This hotel is EXCELLENT value when compared with other Sydney CBD hotels. I've had some great deals here. Also the car park is directly under the hotel meaning you can get your car yourself whenever you need it without waiting around for a valet driver to do it for you. You can pop down to the car to get anything you might have left behind etc, not usually an option in many hotels where you don't even know where its parked! Service has always been great when I've stayed. The buffet breakfast is huge and varied and every bit as good as in 5 star hotels I have stayed at in Sydney. Rooms are nicely designed and clean, child policy is great (kids under 12 stay free and get free brekky) and facilities are also very good. Location. Right next to Central station. Not the most glamorous spot perhaps but very convenient especially if you don't have a car with you - buses and trains to anywhere in the city at your door. Also worth noting, the hotel is surrounded by places that are open beyond 6pm. A problem I have found in other city hotels is that there is nothing nearby if you want a quick bite to eat, a coffee, carton of milk etc. It might be fast food but at least there is something open in the vicinity. This hotel fits the bill perfectly if you want decent quality in a handy location at a good price. Ask yourself if it is really worth forking out an extra $100 (or possibly quite a bit more) per night to get an in room minibar, marble bathroom, valet parking (I reckon the on site car park beats this option hands down) and a concierge that is utterly charming, knows absolutely everything there is to know but is still happy on a salary of $35k! At times it is (special occasions etc) but for the most part the Mercure will do nicely thank you.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: KLM105
Reviews.Content: This place is really great value - great price for nice rooms, good staff, excellent breakfast and there's a pub on the ground floor with good food and cheap drinks!

Reviews.Title: “find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: hopetoholiday
Reviews.Content: It is hard for me to write any positive feedback for this hotel except in a good location for railway and front check in staff were friendly. I found Rooms very Small and Narrow felt closed in. Tv dosent really work just has static so didn't watch it. Food was ok but very busy and sqashy Now to the Worst bit I had paid to take the shuttle to the airport with the concierge taking my luggage and putting it on a trolley with the rest of the shuttle peoples luggage then when We get to the airport suprise NO luggage the bus driver then informs me the concerge couldn't see me waiting for the bus so he left my luggage at the hotel (funnily enought I was waiting with the rest of the people and I had 2 3 year olds with me so couldn't really miss me) so I rang Hotel and then informed them of there mistake they then told me they will put it on the next bus I said I would like it in a Taxi at there cost as my plane was leaving in 1 hour and I needed to check my luggage in. They said I would have to pay for the Taxi and that the shuttle was there and they would just pop it on I said is the shuttle there or is it due in now the conceirge said it's here i will pop it on I said as long if it is there and about to leave I will be happy with that. Then low and behold I rang them exacttly 11 mins after to see if I could get a number of bus to retreive my luggage at the airport to make sure i had the right bus and got another conceirge who told me the bus had just pulled up so he will run outside to have a look at the number but hang on that bus was just leaving according to the so called supervisor I was earlier talking to. My Luggage arrived at the airport at half an hour later which then had myself running with 2 small children to the check in and then to the gate which then made our plane 15 minutes late for depature and arrival. So for this reason mainly I will never recommend this hotel to anybody because i feel that ok forgeting my luggage because they didn't see me and 2 3 year olds may be overlooked but then lying about the buses that just was NOT acceptable. I also stayed at the menzies this trip and would highly recommend this hotel to any guest .

Reviews.Title: “Not a long-term destination”
Reviews.Author: pferg
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Sydney was situated in a very ideal location, close to Chinatown as well as the train station and Paddy's market. The staff who were on hand to help you book travel and give you advice on where to go were also very helpful. One misleading facility I thought was the Rooftop pool, whilst, yes it was on the roof, when you were in the pool you could not see any of the city, only the walls and the 2 loungers by the pool never got any sun (along with the pool) as it was all covered in - not quite what you expect. The sauna was not maintained at all and was in no way warm or steaming! The staff at the front desk were really unfriendly and on our last morning at the hotel proved to be extremely rude and nearly caused us to miss our plane. We asked for a late check-out which was fine by them but we were locked out of the room with our swipecard early and we had to go up and down between the room and reception 4 times before someone was sent to come and use a general swipe card to let us in. During this period we were treated very poorly and had to wait in line each time at reception behind a mass of other guests and to top it off when we finally got let in we were rung with a reminder that we were supposed to have vacated the room by now - which we would have, had they not mucked us around for 1h! In general it is a good place to stay for 1 night but definitely not for longer and do not expect your patronage to be received with any friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Odor”
Reviews.Author: One2travelUsa
Reviews.Content: As we entered the lobby a strong cologne odor hit us. We noticed people coming from the elevator were holding nose. This perfune odor was disguising a sewar odor which you could smell in the street. When we showered the 3 nights there soap suds actually came up the drain in the bathroom floor and took a good portion of the floor. Air conditioning never really worked well. Our room was a queen bed. I think the cleaning people assumed only one person would be put in that but there were us 2 and trying to get the second wash cloth was difficult. When we asked for one they had to come in to see if there were 2 and we were not telling the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for stopover”
Reviews.Author: moonbather
Reviews.Content: Had been in Australia for 3 weeks and this was our final night before flying from the airport very early in the morning. The hotel room was very clean and the hotel had agreed to provide a put up bed for our teenage daughter free of charge. We were only in the hotel for a matter of hours before leaving for the airport. It took five minutes to walk to the Railway Station and then within 20 minutes we were at the departure terminal - this is an excellent choice for ease of access to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A long review with lots of info you need!”
Reviews.Author: mella2007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at the Mercure Sydney. I booked a higher priced privledge rooms which states" complimentary chocolates, bathrobes and slippers on arrivial" ARRIVAL: We arrived on a very busy Sun morning at 9am...was greeted by 3 bellboys at the front door. Girl at check in could have been a little happier, wasnt overly friendly, however we were able to go to our room by 10am which i thought was fantastic. ROOM: The privledge room was just a normal room on Level 13, with brief views of the city and the slippers/bathrobe/chocolates and a coffee machine. Tiny bathroom, small desk and uncomfortable desk chair. Everything was clean, fresh smelling and tidy. My gripe was the "complimentary" items that were suppossed to be included...there was a note attached saying that if we liked the items they could be purchased after our stay. I complained to management straight away as the website didnt state this..complimentary to me is complimentary! I dealt with a very nice man bellboy and duty manager who were more than happy to hear me out and discuss an alternative. I was moved to a bigger corner deluxe room which I am happy to say was a great room. Decent size, large plasma TV, lovely 90 degree views of the city, couch, and slightly bigger bathroom. Magazines, pay tv channels (more than your standard 5), pay per view movies and hotel info channel. LOCATION: I wanted a hotel which was close to Central Station. Many reviews on here dont let you know about the location. I am happy to report that the Mercure is very very close to Central. YOu walk out a door from reception down a walkway, and you are at the train station. Literally a 2 min walk and you dont have to cross any traffic to do so. HOTEL FACILITIES: The hotel has a restaraunt and 2 bars. We didnt use any of them but the prices looked very reasonable. We ordered room service whic arrived promptly. The food was hot and well presented and rather tasty for room service food. The prices were not cheap. There is a pool which we didnt use, a business centre (with computers and printer...the latest equipment) Internet cost me $4 for 15mins, but i believe its cheaper if you buy a 24hour pass. STAFF: The concierge were a mixed bunch. A couple of the guys were excellent with their knowledge, but one of them had no idea of dinner cruises or recommendations for good places to eat. I seemed to have more knowledge than him. Cleaning and room service staff were all polite and friendly. Front desk was good, though they did appear to chat amongst themselves too much. OTHER: Taxis frequent this hotel, and we had no problem catching one. Concierge can organise shuttle buses at a discounted rate. There is a small shop inside the hotel that sounds lollies, drinks, ice creams, toiletries and tacky Sydney souvenors. Also a Europcar rental desk for car hire. You must swipe your card to enter after 11pm and there was security present. The hotel is located very close to Chinatown. Taxis cost us $7 one way to Darling Harbour, $8 one way to PItt Street Mall $10 one way to The Rocks, $18 one way to the airport, and $28 in the airport shuttle one way. $9 return to go on the train from Central to Olympic Park. As this hotel is part of ACCOR all points programs are in place. The Mercure Sydney is a good place to stay should you get a good rate. Location to Central is the best thing going for this hotel and the deluxe room was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “I guess you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Fredrik_V
Reviews.Content: I think we paid ~130 AUD (?) through Hotels.com for one night double. Questionable if it is worth the money. Room was tired but ok. Location is not great, but ok. Warning!!: do not use the pool!! (it's the one on the fancy pic used to illustrate this hotel here at tripadvisor..). The pool is difficult to reach, water is dirty and murky (have never seen murky pool water before!), used "ladies diper" on the floor together with some hair and I assume millions of invicible bacteria... however, given erlier experiences of Accor hotels I am not too surprised. AND: I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay, just avoid the extras”
Reviews.Author: Metwo3
Reviews.Content: We also booked the $89 summer prepay special on their website for most of our nights--had to book one night for more as special not available. No problem with combining the two reservations and no problem with the prepayment. Upon checkin I asked for Qantas Miles--no problem. Funny experience was I received an email after one night (the separate reservation) asking how our stay was. We had a king standard room facing an office building on the 4th floor, I believe, close to the elevator. The bedroom and bathroom were clean, the curtains heavy to block the sun, the air conditioning sufficient, teamaker worked, etc. The room was relatively small and we ate our takeaway food with one person in the chair and one on the footstool. I think it was the room we stayed in on our trip that had the deep sided tub to step into--those seem dangerous to me. Staff was friendly and helpful from start to finish. Self service laundry cost $4 per load for wash and for dry. Didn't touch the Internet service. Thai restaurant in lobby OK, but different recipes than what we normally get. Someone touched off the minibar alarm and I called desk to complain. Was quiet within 5 minutes. Easy walk from Central out the side of the upper story or through a tunnel to the lower tracks. A strip of fast food restaurants across the street and scattered cafes around. Major bus stops out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Internet Very Expensive read this to save a few bob”
Reviews.Author: IrelandPad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for 2 nights. The room we were assigned had a terrible bed. We had just flown from Hong Kong so we left it until the morning and they gave us an alternative room without question. Staff were fine. Hotel is clean and comfortable. And is ideally located right outside central station. The trip from the airport on the train was 10 mins max. We got breakfast included in the deal and the self service buffet was excellent. Their broadband rates are crazy. $10 for an hour $22 for a day. There is a bar at the entrance to central station (right outside the hotel) and I went there, had a few drinks and surfed for nothing on a free uconnect wi-fi zone. Pool is small and was full of roaring kids when we went up. No supervision either. Gym is small with about 4-5 machines. It wasn't busy though. goof few channels on the TV and the room had a fridge. Concierge is very good and a good man to ask advice from about Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room & great location”
Reviews.Author: paulaandrobert
Reviews.Content: We (two adults) got a great rate booking directly on the Mercure website (early bird Summer special) of $AUD89. We only needed one night in Sydney following a cruise before our flight home the next day and thought this looked reasonable. We were totally blown away when we saw the room. After reading reviews we expected a standard, one room twin room with ensuite however the room had a huge (super king?) bed and in a separate divided area, a pull out sofa couch which was very comfortable to sleep on. The linens were lovely and soft and the towels were huge. There was an enormous HD flatscreen TV, small kitchenette (fridge/microwave) and a dining room table. The bathroom was a little small but we weren't planning on spending quality time in there. The room was very quiet - we didn't hear anyone in the next rooms, corridor and no traffic noise. The indoor pool looked nice but there were some children splashing about in it so we didn't go in.
