The location was excellent, right near Central Station and a short walk to Paddy's Market Mall and China Town. Easy access to trains, buses and the free CBD Shuttle. The checkin was easy, our room wasn't ready when we checked in (9am) but concierge took our suitcases and delivered them to the room when it was ready. We just went back later in the day to get our room number and keys. Both the checkin staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. We got concierge to arrange us a shuttle to the airport for $AUD12 each which was even cheaper than the train and only took about 15 minutes to get from reception to the airport - we were the last stop so were at the airport without delay. I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Comfortable rooms. Easy location”
Reviews.Author: holstrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights while in Sydney. Got fed up of Hostels so booked in as it was close to central station and easy to get to everywhere in sydney from here. Check in was fine, pleasant girl. Didnt offer too much information, i had to ask for info, but apart from that no problems. Had a room on the 14th Floor (top floor) with city views. There is an indoor pool and gym and sauna on the 15th floor, up one flight of stairs. Room itself was very comfortable. Large King size Bed, Big TV, plenty space to put stuff. Bathroom nice with good toiletries would definitely stay again if in the area

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: arwon
Reviews.Content: had 2 nights at the mecure, we found it to be really great.. clean, great beds, decent size room, big tv, excellent service, ample parking.. top location.. would stay again.. no problems...

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TazzyPerth
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now. The rooms are quite small but it is in a good location and the well priced for what you get. The hotel is situated right next to Central station allowing easy access to anywhere in Sydney. The staff are polite and helpful. I particularly liked the fact that there is a public car park at the hotel so that when friends and relatives come into town to have lunch or dinner with myself they did not need to worry about where to park. I would not stay for for much longer then a few days though due to the size of the rooms. Very cramped and the view from the standard room is very ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: oz2u
Reviews.Content: No offer of help with luggage. When asked for help with directions, had a map thrust at us over the counter and "walk to the left to get to The Rocks". Good check-in Easy check-out During the night there was a thumping sound coming from the wall next to the bed head. Called reception, to enquire if it was the room next door or an air con unit or such, they offered to do a floor walk and couldn't hear anything. Of course not, it was not thumping in the hallway, but in the wall. No offer of a room move. Nice view from pool, although no spa and the sauna was broken when we stayed, the staff were aware when we called to ask for assistance, just said "oh yeah, its broken, guess the sign was taken away". Otherwise, nicely situated near train station and close walk to city.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted-and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: ozcookie1
Reviews.Content: We were meeting up with my mother and two teenagers for two nights in Sydney so had booked two rooms at the Mercure Central (as they were coming by train) and one room required a rollaway bed. To make matters more complicated for reception we were delayed and they had to check in first but I had made the booking with an Accor Advantage card. This was handled easily and the staff even offered to set-up the rollaway later so as to leave more space. We stayed in quite a few hotels lately but the staff here really impressed. Was their 10th anniversary and the opening night of the Olympics so they were handing out fortune cookies with free and discounted drinks as the message. Saving around $20 in the bar certainly got the stay off to a good start. Rooms had a 'funky' feel to them with vibrant colours. Lovely big TVs. Bar was really cosy and the free drinks helped. Breakfast was the real treat with the sort of dishes and little touches that you would only see at a 5 star establishment (individual poached eggs, breakfast sundaes etc). Seemed to be a few airline crew using the hotel including pilots which is a good sign. Negatives: quite a few Asian and American tour groups but they didn't impact too much on us, there was a mild 'backed-up' smell from the toilet on both days we stayed but I doubt that they can do much about that. Internet access for 24 hours wasn't cheap ($25) but they may have forgotten to charge for it. Parking garage was easy to find and the fee was around $30 which is pretty average for Sydney. Overall we loved our stay here primarily due to the 'can do't attitude of all staff that we met. Would definitely stay here again as the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mercure - Have stayed before and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: SR32
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Mercure during my previous visits to Sydney and it has never let me down. Location is excellent, adjacent to public transport and great food in nearby Chinatown. Staff friendly as always and beds are comfy. Great water pressure in the showers. Swimming pool (indoor) can get a little cool in during the winter months. Great gym facilities. 100% recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: cdixie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent our anniversary trip in Australia. During that time, we stayed in 5 different hotels, and the Mercure Sydney was the only hotel out of them to offer us a complimentary upgrade. They also sent up a bottle of champagne after we checked in upon finding out it was our anniversary. The accommodations and location were great. We were able to walk to Darling Harbour & Chinatown within 10 minutes. The only downside was the lobby; it had a horrible smell that made us rush through to the elevators as fast as we could. Other than that, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bostravelerBoston
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get a room on the top floor (14) with a nice view of the city. The room was small but well appointed, recently updated all but the bathroom floor. The bed/sheets were fabulous. Internet access was $8 per hour so I walked across the street to the "Wake Up' hotel and used theirs for half the price. There is an excellent casual Chinese restaurant called Cafe de Macau on the corner of George St and Valentine Street about 3 minutes walk that was excellent and worth going to. For the money, this place is very good, I would have liked to stay in Darling Harbor or Sydney Harbor but those hotels cost double the price. Since this hotel is across from the train station, you can get anwhere easily.

Reviews.Title: “Not a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tya12
Reviews.Content: Bad staff : Will not let my friends use the bathroom in the lobby because they said it is only for hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “Cushions galore!”
Reviews.Author: MrsJoxer
Reviews.Content: Cushions galore on the comfy bed, excellent concierge service and good location on George St to explore Sydney. Could have slept in the comfy bed all weekend! Staff fine but not in your face friendly! Clean, plenty room for baggage in the room and stunning views! No hesitation and would stay again on a return visit! Note, side entrance of hotel lobby for taxis!

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: martin_boro3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife & teenage son for best part of a week mid/late March. Much like in the vicinity of many large railway stations throughout the world the area is a bit shabby, at the 'wrong' end of George St in the CBD. However, its proximity to Central Station means excellent transport links to virtually everwhere in Sydney, its suburbs & NSW. Right next to Chinatown for plenty of good, cheap meals, also about 5 mins walk from Darling Harbour and 15/20 mins from Circular Quay on foot. Hotel itself is pretty functional & good value for the centre of town if pretty much all you need is a clean, convenient place to get your head down after a hard day embracing the delights of Sydney. As mentioned, concierege very good. Also Europcar office located in lobby for easy car hire. Restaurants ok, if pricey & a bit lacking in character. Swimming pool small but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not a too bad! I'd stay again.”
Reviews.Author: travelalot15
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent travler for both business and pleasure and I've stayed in the Sydney CBD several times. Overall, the Mercure was a pretty decent experience considering my stays in the Sydney CBD hotels in this price and 3-4 star range. I paid $170/night for a double room, which is not bad for this area of Sydney. I am an American who now lives permantly in Australia and I have to say that from an American perspective Australian hotels are generally more expensive and smaller than most U.S. hotels. Mercure hotels are similar in quality to Holiday Inn Express's in my opinion. Due to concerns about street noise (yes I'm high maintenance because I'm a light sleeper) I had requested a room on an upper floor and was disappointed when I checked in and I was put on the 4th floor. However, the room was quiet and clean (and I am VERY picky when it comes to cleanliness). The amenities in this hotel are very basic, but high speed Internet access in the rooms, comfortable bed, cable TV, good hair dryer and iron/ironing board, small refrigerator, writing table and the shower is good etc. It is clean and comfortable and the staff are generally friendly and helpful. The location is great as it is right by the train station and very close to UTS, Paddy's Markets, Haymarket, Chinatown etc. There are TONS of great China town restraunts nearby and it is only a few blocks to great shopping. You can comfortably walk to lots of attractions from here. To summarize, if you're looking for a luxury accomodation this is definitely not it, but if you're looking for a comfortable, conveniently located and clean hotel then the Mercure Sydney will meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try!”
Reviews.Author: J1821
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Mercure Sydney in October, and was impressed with the room. We arrived very early in the morning (overnight flight from the U.S.), and our room was already ready. I had requested an early check-in when booking, but that's never a guarantee. The concierge staff was extremely helpful with booking our Bridge Climb, as well as offering great "local" restaurant/area suggestions. The room was clean, and a very nice size for two people. And, the location of the hotel was great for catching a bus, walking to sights and getting to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cheap Food Nearby”
Reviews.Author: TJ2VEGAS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my sister for a week over Christmas. When we booked online, we could only get a higher priced deluxe room for the last two nights. When we checked in, the front desk clerk asked if we wanted to keep the same standard room for our entire stay, and changed the reservation. We didn't have to move to the more expensive "city view" room, with no hassle. The rooms were comfortable and clean, with a safe and small fridge. Wish I could have brought my pillow home! Only complaints were lack of drawers, not enough hangers (for two girls) and didn't like the herbal bath gel, shampoo that were provided so we bought our own bath soap. The location was on George Street, which is a main street that goes straight down to the Rocks and Sydney harbour. The Mercure is located near the backpacker hostels, so lots of cheap food to be found in the neighbourhood. It's about a 20 minute walk to the more trendy shops and restaurants further down George St, and 40 minutes to Circular Quay. Or hop on a bus right outside the door for $1.70. We went on a day trip to Featherdale Wildlife Park and found it very convenient to have the hotel located right beside Central Train Station. I would recommend booking an airport shuttle from the airport. We found out when we arrived at Sydney Airport that we should have booked one in advance. A taxi cost $30 between us. On the return trip, we made the mistake of taking the train to the airport, since the station was right outside our door. It cost more than the shuttle ($13.80 vs $12.00) and there was no elevator to the platform at our end of the station. We had to pull our heavy suitcases to the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate decor circa 1995”
Reviews.Author: oliveanne
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly clean hotel, in a slightly-above-ok area. The decor hasn't been updated since the early- or mid-90s. The reception and concierge are friendly and helpful. It's ok for the price but would probably try to find something a little nicer even if it costs a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: scottymelbourne
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a lovely stay at the Mercure Sydney and would certainly recommend it! My partner and I stayed at the there over the weekend following a business conference on Friday. The hotel staff were fantastic and during check-in on Friday morning i mentioned we had a late flight out of Sydney on Sunday night and they immediately offered a free late check-out! We were given a room on the 5th floor which had a double bed and very large LCD TV. Also had small bathroom with shower/bath and basic hygiene products (soap/body-wash/ shampoo/conditioner etc). As I was running late for a business meeting the concierge had a cab waiting downstairs for us after we dropped off our bags. Upon returning to the hotel that evening we decided to inquire about upgrading our room for the weekend as we rarely get away and wanted to make the most of it. The staff were really helpful and offered us an upgrade to a balcony room with city view on the 12th floor for only $40 a night! Gus the concierge was very helpful as we went to collect our bags from our first room and move to our new room. The new room was slightly larger, had a queen sized bed, more cupboard space and fridge with kettle and basic tea/coffee supplies. The balcony was a decent size and the view was much nicer than the wall we had been previously facing. Bathroom and TV were the same. Both rooms however were really clean, comfy and had lovely soft sheets and pillows. We really enjoyed getting breakfast delivered to our room each morning. We would just fill in the card at night saying what we wanted and the next morning at the specified time they would bring you a lovely tray with hot cooked breakfast. Prices were really reasonable (about $10 each), however i can't say the same for the rest of the room service menu which was very over-priced. You didn't need to go far to get great food though. Chinatown is on the doorstep, Darling Harbour is a 5 min walk away and Central station is also right outside so the location is really fantastic! Overall a lovely stay and would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a lovely place to stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “biggest disappointment of our trip”
Reviews.Author: irish1234
Reviews.Content: Having travelled the world and seen many hotel rooms this goes down as one of the worst ever. Room tiny, bathroom old,shower pathetic. No storage in room, stayed 5 days and hated every minute. HOtel staff not receptive to complaints re.room would not recommend this to anyone at any price. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “avoid ! u can do much better”
Reviews.Author: zOom_StaTioN
Reviews.Content: overpriced dingy twin room at the back of the hotel for au$200 a night ! Indifferent front desk - at all times over a 2 night stay . Also phoned several times to straighten out a booking in advance and they still got the dates wrong. Never again , you can get much nicer in Syd.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great value”
Reviews.Author: youngaussie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here numerous times and the last time was back in mid-2003. It is a very basic sort of hotel that's efficiently run and managed. The rooms are pretty small, somewhat gritty due to the high turn over, but usually the price is really good so you can score a great deal. It seems that a lot of airlines use this hotel for their aircrew as I've always seem plenty of flight attendants waiting in the lobby (it's pretty close to the airport actually, but still in a good spot in the city). Although the location is perfect for public transportation (train is a 5-10minute walk underground and buses are all around) and only a 5 minute walk to Chinatown/Darling Harbour, you'll be better off staying further in midtown Sydney (perhaps at Avillon, World Square, or places nearby. Hilton is too expensive, but very, very luxurious and great location). Overall, I would recommend this place as a nice, but relatively cheap place to stay. Not sure what it's like now though on the inside...

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest hotel you'll stay at”
Reviews.Author: cms82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure for 3 nights earlier this month and found it to be an ok experience but i think i'd look elsewhere before going back. The hotel was clean, staff were friendly and the room was spacious. No complaints so far. However, my room was situated on the third floor and it was incredibly noisy at night and it proved to be difficult to get a good nights sleep. Although you don't need to break the bank to stay at the Mercure for the price you pay you'd certainly expect the rooms to be soundproofed better and i'd suggest looking at other hotels in the area before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in suitable location”
Reviews.Author: Crags
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sydney for a mid week 2 night getaway, and was thrilled with acoommodation at the Mercure Sydney. Location was perfect for a couple with only a map and no car- Circular Quay and the harbour bridge / opera house etc is a scenic hours walk fone George Street, monorail is 5 minutes away which can take you to Darling Harbour and the aqurium etc. Bus stop is right out the front, lots of taxis. Conceirge desk well manned and very helpful. Quick check in, smart mini bars located on each floor, table and couches on each floor. Room is nice with big TV, big bed and nice bathroom. Absence of lots of facilities in the room seemed to be the only downside (little hygein kit in bathroom etc). Nice pool on level 15, next to gym. Breakfasts are good, restaurant and bar always full. Another independently owned bar with pokies in on ground floor. Very proefssionally run hotel, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly like all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Opanook
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on hotels to stay at for my visit to Sydney. I came across a lot of properties that looked beautiful on their internet sites but when I read the reviews on Trip Advisor, I'd read what they were really like. I was relieved to read all the great reviews this hotel and decided to book. I was not disappointed. The hotel is located on George Street, across from Central Station, a 10 min walk to Chinatown & Paddy's Markets and buses are right at the front door. A taxi to Darling Harbour and Circular key was $10-$15 and a 5 minute drive. The staff at the hotel were friendly, helpful and efficient. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were just like the photos - modern, clean and comfortable. Beds were comfy and had a choice of extra pillows and blankets. The city view room was great. Lots of pretty lights at night. There are some good cafes and fast food places (McDonalds, KFC, etc) at the door if your hungry. Alternatively, the hotel has a restaurant, bar and in-room service plus a 'smart bar' on each level with drinks and snacks (like a mini bar). I would definitely recommend the Mecure Sydney to anyone wishing to stay in a comfortable, modern hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: mg35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sydney Mercure over 26-29 November 2006 with no problems whatsoever. If you have limited time in Sydney you would probably enjoy being closer to the harbour, but this is a good location for getting around the city as it's quite close to the central station. There was a queue for checkin but this went quite fast. Staff were great and outwardly friendly to guests. Breakfast was a bit too chaotic and overpriced for me, but there are plenty of alternatives nearby. Hotel is close to transport and also there is a 24 hour shop next door...very convenient for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure for me!”
Reviews.Author: DeeBeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mecure en route to Hawaii from West Australia. The facilities are excellent it is perfect location from which to traverse the city if you don't have a car. ( Incidently if our experiences are any guide, in travelling by taxi and tour bus, Sydney is a good place not to have a car, as we were gridlocked twice in two days.) The train station and bus stops are on the doorstep and so everywhere in the city is easily assessible from the hotel. Rooms are great â€“â€“as are the beds. Big thumbs up !

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scottwa2468
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a night with my g/f and the first thing that i found was that the hotel is only a few hundred metres down the road, nice rooms, great custumer service

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sara14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night. Room was clean and of good size. Location was fantastic. Booking thro the hotel website was quite painless and we got a good rate too. as we were leaving early the next day, we did not take the breakfast, They helped us with making arrangement for the airport transfer the folloing day so that was useful too. Asked for extra pillows though and was a little surprised that it was given without cases on them? And i found all the reviews on this site very useful to help us decide on the hotel too. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for centrally located accommodation in syndey at a reasonable price. Check in and checkout was quick and painless. they even let us check in early without any hassles

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay at Mercure”
Reviews.Author: livinginpenang
Reviews.Content: We loved the Mercure. Within walking distance from Central Train station, surrounded by variously priced cafes, restaurants and shops. Its a perfect location to visit any of the Sydney sites. We arrived very early in the morning, checked our bags and did some touring. When we came back at 11 the room was ready. We really needed the rest after an all night flight from Malaysia. The Hotel and room was in excellent shape, clean, quiet and comfortable. Bathroom was large and intelligently designed. We got very good service with our requests for a baby cot and a power adapter. All the staff was professional and friendly. Lots of TV shows to entertain our 3 year old. Our only complaint was the room was a bit narrow for the 4 of us. We did not eat there, but the hotel pub had a decent happy hour. Overall I cannot find fault with the Mercure.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 818-820 George Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
